Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Stadler T
Reviews.Content: I have seen the reviews for Eden House and after staying there for two nights in March feel that the place is overrated. Firstly, it was expensive, i.e. over 250 US dollars. However, no breakfast is provided (unlike some other guest houses in Key West) and the rooms are small. Showers and toilets have been added to the rooms making them smaller. There were no cupboards in my room, although some hooks and hangers are provided. I had a lousy mattress in my bedroom which sagged when I lay down on it and I spent a sleepless night tossing and turning. To their credit they gave me another room the next morning, but it took some insistence on my part. The pool area is too close to many of the rooms and is noisy, especially at happy hour, so don't count on an afternoon nap.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: urbandilettante315
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay in the main part of the Eden House. The rooms were so small there was hardly room to move around. The carpet was grimy and worn. The bed linens were worn and did not look very clean. There was no privacy, it was necessary to keep the blinds drawn the entire time while in the room. The lighting was dim and inadequate for dressing/makeup. There was no hair dryer in the room, and when I requested one I was asked to come to the front desk (...having just emerged from the shower! How inconvenient!) The front desk staff was basically unresponsive when we requested a taxi... the taxi never showed up and we were late for a wedding. The least they could have done was warn us at the the time we put the request in that it might be difficult to get a taxi. We ended up having to drive at the last minute. For the price we paid ($250/night) the Motel 6 would have offered a better value. The one redeeming quality of the Eden House is its great location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great time was had by All!”
Reviews.Author: Hnter64
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely incredible. My wife and I got the sweet package with a bottle of champagne and a sunset cruise! Thanks for setting the mood for us! The location is perfect, right in the heart of 'old town'. You can easily walk to Duval Street and explore all over the island. Eden House offers nice beach cruiser style bikes for rent. The staff is very helpful! Eden House is really quirky, eccentric and just plain cool. The grounds of the hotel are spectacular with tons of decks of multiple levels, hammocks for lounging, swings, chairs, a gazebo, hot tub, heated pool, sun deck, all surrounded by lush tropical shrubbery. Ooh and there's free happy hour everyday and they even give you an ice cold beer when you check in. Eden House truly embodies the spirit of Key West. They also give breakfast discounts at the restaurant next store! The room was spotlessly clean and all the amenities we could possibly need. Fantastic service, staff could not do enough to help us have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect respite”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoBack
Reviews.Content: I had the delight of returning to Eden House for six nights in January with my sister and two friends. I am the "newcomer" to the traveling party, coming for six years to this wonderful oasis; my sister and friends have been coming to Eden House for ten. If you are looking for a location that is a destination in itself to recharge, relax and reinvigorate, Eden House is for you. As other reviewers have elaborated, the proximity of the hotel to great food, and walking distance to downtown is a huge plus. The rooms are spotless, and the fact that they are a "green" hotel is appreciated. The meticulous attention paid to landscaping creates a lush, tropical, private hideaway that makes it difficult to return to the often-snowy Northeast. Mike Eden takes the time to make his guests feel like family, whether discussing the newest Christopher Moore book or comparing pictures of grandchildren. Elizabeth's tireless energy keeps the mechanics of Eden House running smoothly in an engaging, graceful way. The staff is friendly, and go out of their way to make sure guests have a wonderful experience. My appreciation of their expertise was underscored on our early January trip this year, when a group of disruptive guests were managed in a quick, professional, respectful way. Eden House, in my opinion, embodies the "Old Key West" live-and-let-live experience. The "wild-and crazy party-all-night" atmosphere is not what Eden House is all about. Thank goodness.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful guest house”
Reviews.Author: Sheldon13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment and it was a really lovely room with a balcony, plenty of space and great hot shower. The bigger rooms are more expensive so we comprimised and didnt stay as long! Spotlessly clean and all the amenities we could possibly need. Fantastic service, staff could not do enough to help us have a great stay. The grounds are really pretty with hammocks and decks to relax on or a small pool to take a dip in with some sun loungers. Great location, easy walking distance to duval street and mallory square. We tried the recommended restaurant next door, it was nice but expensive for what we got. I would advise walking down toward duval street for better value for money. We really enjoyed our stay here and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 201 for three nights. Great room. Happy Hour every day at 4. Vaery helpful staff. Within walking distance of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “youth hostel experience for 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: ginnydorset
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to this hotel after all the favorable reviews..perhaps I didn't research the actual room enough..we were in 205. This is a tiny room on the main balcony with no space to breathe and traffic of other guests passing all day and night in both front and back of room. I felt as if I was in a youth hostel and couldn't relax at all. There is no safe and the bathroom also tiny. We had no balcony space of our own and the wi fi didn't work in the room. All this would be fine if the room was cheap but we were spending the type of money we would have paid for 5 star accommodation and it just was not worth it. The room is clean however, and the location good. There is no food in the hotel and breakfast next door in the hotel restaurant was delicious but very pricey. The bike rentals are good but don't come to this hotel if you expect to walk everywhere as it is a bit far from the main drag. Finally, we found the staff cold and unfriendly. We were given advice about both snorkeling and restaurants which was inaccurate. When I suggested this to the girl on the desk, she was cold and snooty rather than apologetic which I again did not appreciate. This hotel rather spoilt an otherwise magical vacation in Florida. I do not recommend it and think they have become complacent because of previous good publicity. I actually am not sure I even believe that all previous reviews are genuine. Look for a small b&b in key west rather than Eden house.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a good time in Key West call the Eden House!”
Reviews.Author: noripcord
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to enjoy one of the apartment rooms at Eden House this past weekend. This place is absolutely incredible. The location is perfect, right in the heart of 'old town'. You can easily walk to Duval street or rent a bike from the hotel and explore all over the island. Eden House offers nice beach cruiser style bikes for rent and is one of the cheapest rentals on the island. The staff is super helpful. Ryan, Everett, Elizabeth- all top notch. Everett really helped us in a pinch during his graveyard shift (they even have someone at the front desk 24x7, which isn't always the case in a Key West hotel). Eden House is really quirky, eccentric and just plain cool. The grounds of the hotel are spectacular with tons of decks of multiple levels, hammocks for lounging, swings, chairs, a gazebo, hot tub, heated pool, sun deck, all surrounded by lush tropical shrubbery. Ooh and there's free happy hour everyday and they even give you an ice cold beer when you check in. Eden House truly embodies the spirit of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “You will feel Welcomed and great location”
Reviews.Author: sue9879
Reviews.Content: my friend had stay there numerous times I had always stayed at the corporate places please do yourself a favor at stay at the Eden House and support the locals, what a great and friendly place to stay, take your time and review your room selection on the website, there are pictures and May 2 the rates drop to off season. We stayed in 504 upfront upstairs in a loft because we had three people ,but with the lofts if your older you have to go up and down a spiral staircase and no bathroom upstairs!!!But we had a great street view with a swing. Some of the older rooms are in the back, ask the square footage some rooms are very small they have a two bedroom apt the larger rooms go fast. This place is what Key West is all about. Great pool and hot tub remember there is a live webcam so LADIES KEEP YOUR LEGS CLOSED!! The staff is awesome!! Everyone is friendly that is staying there, there is a grill to cook on, quiet areas for relaxing in a hammock. Get to happy hour get early if you want a seat by the pool, most rooms have a refrigerator and a microwave and plates and silverware,cups, coffee and tea is served downstairs and maybe fruit , there is a restaurant on property we did not get to try it but around the corner is a great bakery and sandwich shop Old Town Bakery they open early so you can wake walk down and get a delicious muffin, croissant, fresh baked bread and bring it back to your room and sit out by the pool and relax. Look for the coupon on the Key West website for the free bike rental, we had a great time on the bikes it was much easier that walking and taking a cab is great and cheaper than the bicycle cabs. Have a Great time and enjoy Key West, go off the beaten path and see what Key West is all a bout there is so much more to see and eat and do then Duval Street. Don't forget to eat at Blue Heaven make a reservation to get a good seat out side, the best food. Willie T's is fun with the music and the food is not bad right next door to the coach store.Once you stay at the Eden House it will be the only place you will ever want to stay at in Key West. Enjoy happy traveling. People of all ages stay here it is nice and quiet if you want rowdy go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Took a risk and it paid off!”
Reviews.Author: cass20
Reviews.Content: found this place on key west visitor site, and decided to try it out. It was worth the risk of not knowing what we were getting into. Location is off the main touristy area, and within walking distance to whatever you'll want to see. Was wondering how I'd do with no tv and a little room but honestly, I never missed it or felt like I was lacking. It was perfect! Pool area was great, and we were able to sit poolside reading, and not worry about time or space. No little kids running around (probaby timing of stay more then anything) very quiet and respectful overall. They make you feel free to roam around and make the space your own. Happy hour is a great bonus, and 24 hr coffee is nice too! Right around the corner is a great bakery so breakfast is easy as walking downstairs in a chain hotel (only 100x better!) Friendly staff makes for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “More than a Serene Oasis - a Comfortable Community”
Reviews.Author: Dottie37242
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit was our second stay at Eden House, and we were quite pleased and satisfied once again. The location, the lush greenery and trickling waterfalls, the comfy room were all terrific, as promised by the video and other reviews. The proximity to a wide variety of places to eat wonderful food in a wide price range was terrific. What the video doesn't cover is the sense of community we experienced both times. The staff are fantastic and seem more like partners than "staff" in the quest for a relaxing, interesting and fun vacation. As Art said in his post, it seems to attract wonderful people and we feel enriched by the friendships we made during the course of our stay. Comparatively speaking, the price is right, too. We plan to continue to make Eden House our winter get-away destination.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed two nights at Eden House for our two year anniversary. This was our favorite place we have ever stayed. The hotel has a wonderul world class, pool, hot tub and sun deck. More importantly it has wonderful people and a great location. The eden house relishes the laidback party atmosphere that Key West is known for. The complimentary happy hour is a relaxing treat, and the staff will go out of its way to please you. The accomodations are basic, no tv, no alarm clock, but this just adds to the laidback fun atmosphere of the hotel and the city. Lastly the location is great. Eden house has it's own parking lot and it's a beautiful 15 minute walk to duvall street. All the best we will be back soon. Nate you were the best.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN KEY WEST!”
Reviews.Author: Douglas M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for 3 FANTASTIC nights. It was our first time in Key West and definitely won't be our last and we won't stay anywhere else but here. All the pictures represent this place exactly as shown. From the time you check in until the time you leave you feels as though you're part of a family not a hotel guest. I can't say enough about the accommodations, the staff, the management, and even the other guests. In one word "PERFECT"!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Funinthesungurl
Reviews.Content: Overall amazing place stay...we arrived towards the end of happy hour, but staff member took the time to show us around the beautiful property. Very relaxed atmosphere-pool, hammocks, a library, etc. Had a semi private room with a comfortable bed and had no problems with sharing a bathroom. Location is on a beautiful street and enjoyed walking around the area. Wish we could have stayed longer... Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mellowness!”
Reviews.Author: Chickens_everywhere
Reviews.Content: We were only here one night, but would have loved to stay longer. Very friendly, mellow place with a vibe that seemed like what people are looking for in Key West. They even have a collection of board games, lovely front porch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens and pool....small expensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: ArlJeff
Reviews.Content: The gardens are beautiful, as is the pool area. The staff is friendly. The place has a classic look. For over $250 a night, however, I expected more from my room. It was walk-in closet sized - so small that the bed partially blocked the door. No TV. I stayed here for only 2 of the nights I was in Key West as my usual place was booked on those nights. Next time I'll go back to my regular place.

Reviews.Title: “It just keeps getting better...if that's possible!?!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDerf3652
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Eden House via a random internet search over 10 years ago! We had stayed numerous other places in Key West prior to that - condos, large resorts, etc. I narrowed the search down to 3 places, one of which was the Eden House and presented them to my husband...based strictly on the websites, he chose the Eden House...we knew as soon as we arrived we had made the right choice! The whole Eden House staff, from the "welcoming committee" at the front desk, to the housekeeping crew, to the grounds keepers and those behind the scenes keep things running smoothly are awesome!! We have returned to the Eden House to many times to count & it's always like coming home! Over the years we have enjoyed making priceless family memories here and now our boys are bringing their friends! We have a large circle of Eden House friends & each time we leave, we leave with a few more! Mike Eden is more than just the owner of this piece of paradise - he is the essence of the Eden House - he routine shows up for the complimentary happy hour at the pool to mingle with those of us fortunate enough to have found this place...the location makes anything and everything you want to do in Key West a breeze, there are bikes to rent on scene, Azur restaurant next door is amazing and will bring your breakfast or lunch right over to the pool for you & give you a 20% discount to boot! The front desk staff is there to assist you with suggestions and or reservations for any type of adventure you might be up for! The chairs on the front porch are my favorite and have been there forever...a great place for a cup of coffee, a breakfast sandwich from 5 Brothers, an afternoon nap or just to watch the world go by. The rooms range from semi privates (you share the bathroom with the room next door to an entire house with a full kitchen and everything in between...the beds are awesome, great mattresses, pillows and bedding! Ok, I'll stop already...I guess what I'm trying to say is that if you don't enjoy the Eden House, you probably shouldn't even be in Key West =)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed agian this year during FantasyFest!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuPineapple
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth FantasyFest (not consecutive years) at Eden House. The hotel is wonderfully maintained, and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The owner is present on a regular basis, instead of the typical absentee or corporate owner you will find at many Key West hotels. Eden House appears to have many guest who stay there frequently, and I can understand why. Don't forget to eat at Azure, the restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: Marysland
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The free happy hour is a plus. Our room was clean and comfortable. Wifi worked great. The hot tub was heaven, the staff and management were helpful and friendly. We came to Key West to get married but with no plan. We explained that to the staff and they helped make arrangements. The "library" with the hammocks was so gorgeous and the waterfalls and foliage so pretty, we got married right there!!! Thanks to the Mikes, Gina, Fred and all the repeat guests we had a super wedding trip and are planning our first anniversary there already!

Reviews.Title: “I like the concept”
Reviews.Author: HongKongStars
Reviews.Content: Staff is so friendly with zero attitude. Nice people here. True that it is a little bit expensive, but come on guys, you are in the Key West! The hotel is well located (downtown and walking distance for all major sites and Duval street). We have stayed in a room with a shared bathroom for less than $200 per night which was very good. The parking is free which is not common in this area... Go for it! I will go back again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, as always!”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: We think this was our ninth stay at Eden House in the past ten years. This place was an amazingly fortunate discovery to us about ten years ago and it just keeps getting better every year. This is Old Town Key West at its best. Comfortable and friendly, we love love love coming back here every year to simply relax. The laid back and efficient hard-working staff and fellow guests always make for a pleasant stay. As a gay couple, we have visited all the gay inns in the neighborhood just to check them out for comparison. In the end, with no offense to the gay properties, we just felt more comfortable at the Eden House. We have always felt welcome, we can relax and be ourselves, yet at the same time have felt we could invite family and friends to join us from year to year, something not possible or comfortable to do in other places. So many things to highlight: The large heated pool and hot tub, sun deck, outdoor hammocks and private porch swings, morning coffee, afternoon happy hour, walking distance convenience to restaurants and just about everything else, access to a PC & printer, WiFi...just some of the tangibles. Staying at the Eden House every winter is our reward for surviving the holidays and for helping us make it through the rest of a long cold New England winter. Did I mention that we love this place?

Reviews.Title: “Roaches in your room are included”
Reviews.Author: GRtravelMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: I came to my room (matchbox) and I had a roach in the bathroom, the desk clerk said that they were part of the ecosystem..... Helloooooo!

Reviews.Title: “Another trip to Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Keys back in Nov. of last year. As always the staff at the Eden House were wonderful. Helped w/ tips on places to eat and all the great bars to go to. We took a family member w/ us that has been to the Keys multiple times and stayed in various places and he was so impressed he said the Eden House was one of the Best places on the island. The week was just so relaxing, we love just laying around the pool w. a cold drink and enjoying lunch from Azur (they will deliver it poolside now). I read on their blog that they are moving to a "No Smoking" policy and I love it... Way to go Mike!!! We took a Sunset Cruise on the Fury and it was awsome! The band was great and they served enough appitezers that you really could make a meal out of it. Once again we had a great week and already are counting down the days until we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: sar308
Reviews.Content: Just sit back and relax. The Eden house is a laid back tropical paradise with hamocks in the shade, heated pool and hot tub. Returning after a day of sight seeing and bar hopping is an extra treat for the senses. Bubbling waterfalls, soft lights and comfort are right there..It's not cheap but it is worth the experience. .Quiet enough to hear the chimes and waterfalls as you sun.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky and friendly, just like Key West!”
Reviews.Author: BeeceeBeach
Reviews.Content: After over 30 years of visiting family in Florida, we finally decided to venture down to Key West. Don't wait as long as we did---you'll be missing a great vacation! And the Eden House is the perfect place to stay. Beautiful property, pristine pool, sparkling clean but funky restored old Key West building. But the best part is the staff, who are very friendly and helpful. Even the guests seem to catch the vibe. We walked and biked everywhere but thank goodness we were far enough away from Duvall street to have lots of peace and quiet. We hope someday that we can come back---it would be great for a family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Liv111
Reviews.Content: Its always difficult choosing through the internet and reading the reviews makes it sometimes more difficult. I do feel that we hit the "jackpot" on choosing The Eden House a small and cosy hotel. The rooms where clean and well kept. Very relaxing area by the pool. And all the hammocks and seating areas it would be difficult not to find some peace on reading you holiday favorite book. The hotels offer free happy hour between 16-17 every day and coffee and tea is there for you 24/7. And I must say the coffee was super. Your can hire bikes or even sometimes when you stay a for more than 3 nights I think the bikes are free or you can rent them at a low cost and Key West is best to see on wheels. Make sure you have front and rear lights on the bike. Many nice restaurants in walking/biking. One especially an "Italien" just around the corner can not remember the name - but super and very busy which says it all. Also just up the street a wonderful organic cafÃ©, Keys best bakery also just around the corner. What more could you ask for? Authentic or be true in what you do - would be the only down side. The staff sometimes show that its not the most fun in the world to meet and welcome guests. And thats when changes are needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, But Not Paradise for the Price”
Reviews.Author: SFK1
Reviews.Content: I found some of the more "average" reviews on here to be true to my experience. Overall, the management did nothing to offend me; nor did I feel an overwhelming sense of value or comfort. We went at one of the priciest and busiest times of the year, but I think $300+ a night for our room was still steep. I would advise new couples or those squeamish about privacy to stay away from the "Small Deluxe" since you will get the barest hint of bathroom privacy--a shutter-style door and a toilet 4 feet from the bed. No dresser or closet in these rooms--you have to live out of a suitcase the entire time. And while their materials clearly say, "this isn't a bed and breakfast," I don't think a quick run by one of the many staff to pick up some bananas and bagels would kill them. The pool area, lobby, parking, and common areas are way too small to accomodate the number of guests. On another note, Eden House seems to shy away from marketing itself to gays and lesbians. No Pride flag here. Their extensive lobby brochures collection contains no literature about the gay-themed or gay friendly options in town--an omission that was mirrored in the makeup of the guests, which seemed more Carnival cruise than adult vacation destination. I found it odd to be in a town teeming with LGBT visitors and residents yet seemingly the only ones staying in our guest house. Pros: good location; good restaurant, Azur, next door; mostly friendly staff (if you don't mind the occasional grump working the night shift or people who don't look you in the eye). The $1 beer/soda at the front desk is a handy touch. And the cleaning staff did a nice job.

Reviews.Title: “Un buen lugar para estar como en casa!”
Reviews.Author: Judith F
Reviews.Content: Pasa mos el dia 24 de diciembre en Eden House y fue muy buena experiencia. Las habitaciones no son un lujo, pero vale la pena todo lo demÃ¡s. Los empleados son muy amables y siempre tienen cosas para ofrecer (barra libre, comida, ...). Nos sentimos muy agusto allÃ­!

Reviews.Title: “won't ever stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, free bikes to borrow, felt like it was a world to itself! was happy just being at Eden House with the pool, happy hour and hammocks. Restaurants extremely close, very close to Duval and the main sightseeing areas. Perfect location on the Key, absolutely wonderful. Peaceful but close enough to find trouble if you want it. Adjacent restaurant was great. Rooms extremely clean. Staff was wonderful with suggestions for what to do and where to go. I was traveling alone and felt safe, happy, and relaxed. Eden House made any worries go away!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: taffyKamas_UT
Reviews.Content: We didn't plan to spend a night in Key West while visiting the Keys, but we were concerned about how long it would take us to get to the airport from Lime Key Resort on Long Key. I found the Eden House on tripadvisor and called. They had a nice room at a decent price for Key West. The grounds are beautiful and secluded. Our room was very clean, the bed was nice and the water pressure was great in the shower. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It is within walking distance to Duval Street but far enough away to be more quiet and quaint. The houses, shops, etc. near were all nice and well kept. It felt very safe there. A lot of people walking their dogs were very friendly. The restaurant next door is very good for dinner. We did not eat other meals there. The nice thing too is the parking which is free and right next to the property. It was a very comfortable place to be.

Reviews.Title: “The Bomb”
Reviews.Author: nini5
Reviews.Content: Another visit for some R&R in Nov to our fav, Eden house. It is like coming home to family as this is what its all about. Mike and staff run a tight ship to make our vist so much fun. Roms to accomodate all budgets. Not your typical cookie cutter hotel, so if this is what you want, find it elsewhere. All the staff are very helpful and on call 24/7. Love the big screen in the lobby and coffee and tea in the lobby. Be sure and visit the gift shop for EH goodies. I always come out with an armful. We use our robes and towels with EH logo in our condo to remind us of our wonderful times relaxing with old and new friends. Keep up the good work Mike, you have a winner!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mosoles
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere just right for what I expected in Key West. Within walking distance of Duval Street yet quiet and relaxing. Happy Hour was great and I especially enjoyed the Eden House wine. Mike Eden, the owner, shared the story about the Eden House being used as the location for filming of Crisscross starring Goldie Hawn in the 90's. Very clean, great coffee. Especially appreciated the free parking and quality and great price of clothing and souvenirs on site.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!”
Reviews.Author: Trip1003
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean. Friendly efficient staff, especially Nate. We enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and atmospheric small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olli_13
Reviews.Content: Great! Realxed and friendly atmosphere. Helpful staff. Free parking. Good breakfast available in the restaurant just next to this hotel. Nice pool area. Room wasn't that big, maybe even little outdated, but still very nice. And somehow it feels that room in this hotel should be like that. Room was very clean. Location was good. Quite near to bars, etc. But far enough to good sleep... Generally very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Old Key West at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: RaSteve
Reviews.Content: You can't get any closer to the heart of key West than the Eden House. Quiet, laid back and yet close to Duval St. and all the nightlife. The pool and hot tub are an added bonus, and the price is right. Definitely worth a few nights or longer.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is a little piece of Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: Minda L
Reviews.Content: Eden House is Fabulous. The environment is truly "Eden"; the staff is marvelous and friendly/helpful. Even the guests are FUN. Elizabeth's creativity and Mike's ingenuity can be seen everywhere -- from the relaxing pool/waterfall, to the porch chairswings, new/updated accomodations (outdoor showers!), the giftshop (with local artists' wares), bike rentals, livingroom/lounge -- even the friendly front desk! I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West, and if I didn't have to return to reality, I would never leave!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dp122800
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Eden House and was handed a cold beer. After checking in, being shown around by the desk clerk and putting my bags in my room Happy Hour started by the pool! This is a great friendly,laid back,fun hotel. There were people from all over that all got together around the pool and became friends. The staff helped make it a great stay. Don't go if your looking for modern luxury because it is more old style confortable. My room was on the first floor (#109) and was just right for Kew West. Didn't even miss TV, one night I watched some on my laptop by the pool with headphones. It is within walking distance to everything. Just far enough from Duval St. to sober up a little. Not sure if I'll get back to KW but I'd certainly stay at the Eden again

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved Eden House”
Reviews.Author: Leslie724
Reviews.Content: So glad I found Eden House. What a terrific place with a great staff. Thank you so much for making my stay in Key West so enjoyable. I can't wait to come back. Eden House will always be my 'home' when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, a great find”
Reviews.Author: rockymntgypsy
Reviews.Content: What a find! Such a hip, reasonably priced, fun place to stay in KW. The pool is an oasis of R&R, they even have a complementary happy hour every day by the pool. The staff are friendly and helpful. Free tea and coffee, internet and a printer and such ambience. The location is also great, with easy parking and close to lots of great restaurants. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis from the wildness of Key West.”
Reviews.Author: stargazer14
Reviews.Content: I love the Eden House. Been going off and on for many years and it always seems like a home away from home when I get there. The no frills rooms are always comfortable and I feel like I am coming back to a place I know and feel secure and welcomed. It is not the Westin or Hyatt but rather an old Key West hotel with character and history and you are made to feel like you are one of the family more than just a number. The pool and hot tub are very nice and the area is a great place to relax at anytime of day or night. The location is perfect to me -off he beaten path in a quiet neighborhood a few block off Duval, i enjoy the walk, tho there are bikes at the hotel for you to use if you wish. The food next door at Azur is very good, i had one of the best breakfasts I ever had (this coming from a breakfast guy) and it os only a few steps away from your room, a perk after a night out on the town. And dont miss the gift shop, the prices are way more than reasonable with quality goods. In all, its a place you will stay and want to come back to. Mike Eden, keep up the good work. Hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Really wasn't expecting to share the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Vvvania
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad and is in a nice neighbourhood of Key West, 10 minutes of walking from Duval Street but my experience wasn't that good. We booked the hotel on the phone through the visitor center and the price was lower than all other hotels in key west..but surprise surprise when we got there we found out that our room had only 2 twin beds and a bathroom in sharing with other people. Of course nobody had told us at the time of the reservation. The room was really small and hot (and air conditioning too noisy to have it on at night). I'm sure they have better rooms, but not being told about the shared bathroom wasn't correct.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House = Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MamaBear4321
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in to the Eden House to check in, the helpful staff immediately offers you a cool drink. Once you have been given a complete tour of the facilities, with the staff answering any questions along the way, you unpack in a very CLEAN and well ventilated room. The hammocks and porch swings that are abundant around the property really enhance the relaxing atmosphere. WIth the Azur Restaurant just next door, you don't have to go far to enjoy all that Key West has to offer. Poolside Happy Hour (free and self-serve) is an added bonus. We enjoyed a really wonderful experience all around that will keep us coming back for years to come. Thank you Eden House!

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Key West”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Mike Eden and his staff at Eden House continue to provide a Key West experience that is just what we are looking for. The location is just about perfect. Bicycles get you anywhere you want to go. The lovely courtyard and pool with a nice happy hour every evening are so relaxing. The rooms are clean and I appreciate the choices in room size and amenities. Mike's restaurant recommendations are the best. We consider the Eden House to be "our" hotel when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Sets a high standard”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Keys and was lucky enough to stay at the Eden House - great location, great people, and a really special place. We were greeted with a cold beverage, enjoyed a great stay at the pool, and very flexible arrangements for bikes. Since we were taking the ferry to Ft Myers, they were very chill about letting us store our luggage while we enjoyed our bike ride. The front porch is a great place to let the world go by - as are all the special places - library, hammocks, etc. Can't think of a thing to complain about - not my usual style!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome rest-bite :)”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: Eden house is not trying to compete against the big chains. This shows in the little things they do, a free beer at check in, happy hour free bar every day. The location is great, it is far enough away from Duval street to be quiet, but close enough to pop in and out :) I would both recommend & return :) If your looking for a bland room / feel that you get from a major chain dont come here... keep it up Guys :)

Reviews.Title: “A hit everytime!”
Reviews.Author: Islamoradasports
Reviews.Content: I send many cyclists to Eden House and they are bike friendly and love athletes. It's a great place to wind down after a 100 mile bike ride. I have never had a single complaint yet.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back time in key west!”
Reviews.Author: Chathamjack
Reviews.Content: We arrived yesterday, November 16th after a long ride down from ft lauderdale. Was met at he registration desk by Brian, a great host, offered us two cold beers on checkin....very sweet and so very needed. The room we have is an apartment in the back of the property...nothing frilly, just perfect, quiet, clean and a hammock of our own. Just what we were looking for.....highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “All it promises”
Reviews.Author: citapepita
Reviews.Content: Eden House is lovely. In Old Town, one has a sense of place true to the more historic and interesting aspects of the island. Some staff more friendly than others, but all needs were taken care of and I'm not a fan of false bonhomie. The shower was hot and great water pressure. Most of my activities were in a resort hotel so I didn't spend a lot of time there but all my needs were met whilst there. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a life time”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I'm 47 years old And have never been to the keys or any other island. It was better than I expected and the Eden House had a lot to do with it. It wasn't perfect bet if I have a chance to return to the keys I will be staying there again. We stayed from 11/06/11 till 11/11/11 in room 304. Only two things come to mind that I want to mention. One is on the day of our arrival we were a couple hours early and was informed that the room wasn't ready yet but was invited to a tour which was thoughtful. During the tour we were showed where our room was and a staff member was in there attending to it. After the tour my wife and I want to get some lunch and returned about an hour later with lunch in hand. We figured we would sit back by our room at the tables by our door, when we turned the corner we say a staff member just standing in the room watching the tv. Didn't catch his name but he wore ankle weights and had long blound hair. I think we kind of stardled him. Before we finished our sandwiches we were brought our keys. After entering we noticed that the toulet was not flushed, odd!! I would of gave the room a "10" if he would have put a little more effort into cleaning it. "08" on the room being clean. The only other thing I can think of was the tiny ants trough out the room, I know it's a tropical island but you can manage them guys easly with some spray. Don't know if they bite but my wife got bite up pretty good. Don't worry, did an inspection of the mattress and found nothing found :) . But the rest of the staff was great and they made it all worth wild and thats why I would stay there again. One even stopped pool side and chatted for 10 or 15 miniutes and hooked us up with the places to eat. Try next door for breakfast, awsome. I was really sad tyhe day I had to leave, just in five days i felt like I made new friends. Going to miss you guys.. Gena and David Jackson

Reviews.Title: “Great Exerience at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: ersmed
Reviews.Content: Eden House is not like any chain hotel and really unlike just about any hotel I've stayed (and I travel a bunch). It started when we were offered 2 free, cold cans of beer as we checked in! It continued with being given a complete tour of the property, a really amazing happy hour (where you mix your own free drinks!!), a pool with a waterfall, beautiful grounds, quiet during hours of sleep, a comfortable distance from the craziness of the downtown. I think Gina deserves special recognition as she was so helpful with planning what we wanted to do during our stay in Key West. We only had time for 2 nights and days, next time we will come for a week and spend a few days just relaxing at the Eden House, around the wonderful pool and property.

Reviews.Title: “A laid back vacation”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Wife and I needed a no hassle recharge just what the doctor ordered.The staff was friendly and helpful. Like to thank Elizabeth she was very helpful with local recommendations.The shower outside our room on the deck was great plus.Try it you will like it. Wife loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to perfect <3”
Reviews.Author: lotsofdreams
Reviews.Content: My 14yr. old daughter and I had the pleasure of stayin at Eden House this past summer. We had a private bath in an upstairs room that was very comfortable and quiet. The location is wonderful and a short walk from a great organic cafe. Management and staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable too. They helped, well actually did everything but pay for a last minute booking of a seaplane transport to the Tortugas. We will return and will definitley stay again. I wouldn't consider staying any place else in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Pleasures”
Reviews.Author: DaleBob
Reviews.Content: A Euro type hotel with clean and simple accomodations, nice quiet place seven blocks from Duvall St. ,Ammenities included were pool and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home at Eden House.”
Reviews.Author: IndialanticOrchid
Reviews.Content: This is absolutly my favorite place to stay in Key West.Have been going back for years as I am a Florida resident.I pull up, park my car , check in have a beer ,rent a bike and I am set for the weekend.I doint drive my car again until I am ready to leave.Close enough to bike to all my favorite spots on Duval St. Great atmosphere,happy hour at poolside each evening gets me primed for the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay for 2 days”
Reviews.Author: CGoGu
Reviews.Content: Great welcoming atmosphere. Nicely situated in quiet streets pretty close to Duval street. Small rooms, but well equiped. Cold beer served at inchecking! Free coffee, towels, drinks during happy hour. Good advice from hotel staff concerning things to do, restaurants etc. We hired bikes for one day at the hotel and had time to see most of the sights. Very nice breakfast at the restaurant beside the hotel. Good parking possibilites at the parking lot belonging to the hotel or at the surrounding streets.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is the Real Key West”
Reviews.Author: jillyj69
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay in all of Key West! Friendly, helpful staff that treat you as a friend, not just a guest. Many room choices, from small economical rooms to 2 story guest houses, Eden House has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a heart”
Reviews.Author: Anathorn
Reviews.Content: Just a short distance away from Duval, free parking and a great personal touch! People are extremely friendly and customer oriented! The rooms are pretty small, but we never really need a big room as long as a big bed, suitcase and a nice showerroom fit in it right? We had a small deluxe room in the back of the property, which really made us feel like we were in some far away paradise, and not in the middle of bustling Key West! We also really love the personal touch on the guide made by the owner, with his own favorite restaurants/things to do etc. I guess this is really one of those hotels, where seeing is believing:)

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Jenifr
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place with a room to fit anyone's needs. Solicitous staff, great quiet location, wonderful resident cats, privacy, far from the madding crowd. Beautiful location. The restaurant was lovely too. The staff was superb and catered to you. Very much what i would imagine conch living at its best. My friend and I had a room in the back that was fabulously spacious with pretty much a full kitchen. And where else would your room come equipped with a blender for drinks? I'm afraid to rave about it so much because it seems like a well kept secret. So nice a change from chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: beau p
Reviews.Content: We got the smallest room which only had a full bed. It was exceptionally clean. I'm 6'2" so next time we'll go for the larger room. There will be a next time! Quiet, lush well kept gardens with friendly helpful staff. We had a great stay and will return. Location is perfect. Within walking and biking distance of everything. If you're a Marriott person, this is not for you. But if you want the flavor and ambience of old Key West it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Book here when visiting”
Reviews.Author: JanetCampen
Reviews.Content: Richard and the team made us feel like family. Amazing location you can walk to Mallory Square, Duval street and all the best restaurants and bars within 15 minutes. The entire property was extremely clean, the free happy hour poolside gave us the opportunity to meet some new Australian friends.

Reviews.Title: “key west little paradise”
Reviews.Author: kira k
Reviews.Content: We leave in Florida and coming to KEY WEST very often. we did stay in many hotels, but Eden House was the best of all. The hotel has beatiful tropical garden. Swiming pool and surrounding area very cleen and comfi. Every day happy hour with a few free drinks and a plate of fruits makes you fill,that this is private party with a few close friends.Complimentary coffe,tea, ice available all day. Special THANK YOU to Richard and Nate- knowlegeable and attentive front desk staff. They treated every gest like their own family. Come and see for yourself-it is really diffirent. Many thanks, KIRA and ALLAN.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: Joy K
Reviews.Content: Eden House is refreshing in every way.....from the moment you walk in the door to the welcoming lobby with COMPLIMENTARY coffee/tea/fruit/cold filtered water available all day to the competent, knowledgeable desk folks and attentive staff. A combination of an historic hotel paired with several Victorian cottages situated around a palm tree-trimmed pool (with floats and toys), it's relaxing and fun at the same time. They have thought of everything to make guests feel at home: forgot sunscreen or bug spray? No problem, it's there, FREE. Forgot reading materials? no problem---there's a library with fiction, non-fiction and area history plus CURRENT magazines, board games,FREE. The daily cocktail hour lets you socialize with other guests around the pool and hot tub if you want or hide away on the sundeck or gazebo...also FREE. No need to carry a bottle of water around with you---cold water is available around the deck,pool, also FREE. Desk folks know all the good spots to dine or snorkel and are pleasant, even in the wee hours of the night. Got a blister? Get a band-aid at the desk. Need a bike? Rental at the door. Killer bakery 1/2 block away, too (Old Town Bakery?) Some hotels will nickel and dime you to death. Eden House is like visiting a friend with a fabulous house. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else after this visit. Restaurant was closed (low season) but reviews from others were very good.

Reviews.Title: “The best gift ever...”
Reviews.Author: luna c
Reviews.Content: I sent my nephew to Key West as a gift for his successfully quitting and staying off of drugs. The people at the hotel only knew this was a gift from his aunt. They gave me a reduced rate and treated my nephew and his girlfriend like royalty. I am so thankful to the staff, as this was a very heartfelt gift...

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I made a spur of the moment trip down to Key West. We were lucky enough to stumble upon the Eden House just by chance and luckier yet that they had a room for us. The room and the grounds were beautiful. The hotel was just far enough away from the crowds that we felt truely relaxed. All of the staff was great. We are especially thankful to Richard at the front desk. Having never been there we didn't know where to go, what to do, or even where to eat. Richard couldn't have been more helpful. He gave us great recommendations and then followed up with us to see how it they turned out. All on all, it couldn't have been a better get away. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Half the price of the Gay Places and a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tallmarkone
Reviews.Content: As a gay man I try to stay at the gay inns. Howver trying to budget myself this year I found that Eden House had almost all the ameneties of the Gay places like Island House which is one block away but at half the price! For $115 a night they even upgraded me to a nice room with private bath adjacent to the pool. They require quiet in the common areas after 10PM which is great. The price includes free wifi in the common areas. However, if you get a room like mine adjacent to the pool the wifi came in loud and clear in the room too! They even have free parking on site and while they clarify it is limited I never had a problem getting one of the 15 spaces for myself during my entire stay. The hotel is about five blocks from all the hoohaha of Duval Street and the neighborhood is very cool with many fine resturants within walking distance. I usually am very particular about where I stay and usually find something to complain about but NOT THIS TIME. My stay was SIMPLY PERFECT! PS It has been many many years since I have taken a shower in a Claw Foot Tub and that was quite a treat too.

Reviews.Title: “Brief but enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonProvidence
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night as we were staying in a vacation rental for the rest of our trip. The room was small and on the ground floor but adequate and clean.They have a quiet time rule in place starting at 10 PM, everyone really respected this. We arrived in time to enjoy the happy hour - free beer and mixed drinks by the pool, thought this was a really great idea. We rented bikes from the hotel and were able to bike all around the island. I would definitely return to this hotel. We really enjoyed our brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway just a bit away”
Reviews.Author: FLRoadTrippers
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled with 3 couples to Key West. Although we have been to the Keys several times this was our first stay at Eden House. We really enjoyed our visit from the friendly staff, the relaxing hammocks throughout the grounds and the fun and relaxing pool. My husband and I were the only couple that brought our baby and we stayed in the two bedroom cottage which was perfect for the two of us, the nanny and the baby. It was close enough to Duval street to walk yet far enough to be away to be able to relax. I would recommend renting a bike or a car for frequent trips to Duval as it is quite a walk - not necessarily close enough to go back and forth throughout the day. We also really enjoyed many other guests at the Eden House. Everyone was very friendly and fun. I was cautious about bringing my baby to the pool but while people were having fun, drinking a bit and enjoying the day no one was out of control and when I asked if they minded the baby around, people exhibited just the opposite by playing with him and even bringing rafts/floats for him to play on in the pool. The atmosphere is definitely one of fun but also respect and relaxation. We would stay at the Eden House again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Ymohammed
Reviews.Content: Found this place online. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Beautiful house with clean rooms. Nice jacuzzi and pool. Parking off street and free. White flies/bugs left stickiness all over my car and pool should've had a little less chlorine. Happy hour every day!!!! Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully quirky, terrific grounds and staff. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: teresave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often travel on business and stay in the usual hotel chains, so when going on vacation to Key West we wanted to stay in someplace special and unique. We found that with Eden House. Upon checking you are greeted with a welcome drink (I had a beer, my husband a soda) and then a tour of the amenities while being walked to your room. And although the lobby is not air conditioned, the rooms are. There is fresh fruit put out in the morning, and coffee 24 x 7. There is daily happy hour drinks by the pool, and all the fresh pool towels you could ask for. There is a library of books and you are invited to take some and or leave some. And they also provide free sunscreen and after-sun aloe to use. What more could you need? The rooms are all a little different We stayed in a room with a queen bed and refrigerator (and that refrigerator comes in mighty handy to keep drinks cold). The room was air conditioned and had a ceiling fan. The only real oddity / annoyance was the lack of a fan in the bathroom to help with the steam. But even that was ok as the sink and mirror were outside the wet room (toilet and shower). There is no dresser or closet. But there are shelves, a luggage rack, and hooks with hangers. You don't really want a dresser or closet in the Keys anyway...they would just get too musty. The hotel has bicycles to rent, but we didn't bother. Eden House is within easy walking distance of Duvall, Mallory Square, dive and fishing charters, etc. One note...the time we went (the week after Labor Day) is hot, humid, and the start of the off season. As such, some restaurants and shops close until October. We had wanted to try the Azur restaurant associated with the hotel, but it was closed. I am unsure if that was due to off season closure or renovations, but I suspect the latter. All in all we loved the hotel and the staff and hope to be back, although perhaps in a slightly less humid time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden House!”
Reviews.Author: KathyS39
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at the Eden House before but my usual spot was booked. I found the Eden House online and it had great reviews. Upon check-in, the gentleman working was really nice and helpful. I booked one night and wound up staying an additional night. I loved the location as it was within walking distance of the historic seaport where Schooner Wharf is located. I would definitely stay at the Eden House again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Janet M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved the manageable size of the Hotel, our room and all of the amenities. The hotel was very generous offering such things as a beverage on arrival and daily happy hour. It was a quiet and relaxing couple of days. Everyone from the housekeeper Patrick to Richard and Nate at the front desk were friendly and seemed to anticipate our every need. The only dark cloud was the women who worked the front desk. In our first two hours at the Hotel we witnessed three interactions involving her. She was rude and condescending with staff as well as other guests. We tried to avoid her at all costs throughout the remainder of our stay. This was the only black mark on an other wise wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Laid back and pool bar happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: Zman73
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this property are very well kept. The pool area, Jacuzzi and pool deck were a great place to relax when not down on Duval Street. The room was a bit small but I wasnt in there much anyways. The staff was friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for our KW wedding and it was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: knoe
Reviews.Content: Our whole family and wedding party stayed with us at Eden House to celebrate our wedding in Key West and it was a perfect choice. The staff goes way beyond the standard of customer service we normally expect and the atmosphere was fun, quirky and laid back. Our group had a wonderful experience hanging out at the pool together and enjoying free drinks at happy hour. We also loved the restaurant next door, Azur, who did our wedding reception and also provides poolside lunch delivery. When all of our guests left, we couldn't have asked for a better place to spend our honeymoon, especially since the location is quiet, but still close to Duval Street and everything cool in Old Town. We plan to stay here every time we come back to Key West... shouldn't be too long!

Reviews.Title: “Best Find in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I made a spur of the moment trip to Key West and when we searched online for Key West hotels, Eden House stood out among reviews. When we got there, we instantly saw why! The setting is gorgeous - the inside and lobby area has a great bed and breakfast feel and the outside pool area is your own tropical getaway. There are tons of little nooks and hammock areas outside and provided the perfect romantic setting but also was a great environment for families, friends, etc. The staff was so welcoming and nice during our entire stay and even offered us access to the pool and outside areas after we checked out. They have tons of recommendations for anything and everything you'd like to do in Key West. Overall, Eden House really made our stay a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Went to Key West for Duval but spent more time at the Eden House.”
Reviews.Author: LimoJustin
Reviews.Content: I took the GM of my company to Key West on the 22nd-24th of July 2011 for a refreshing getaway. We were hoping for some relaxation but were looking for some nightlife. We rented the lower level of the Conch House which was an excellent choice. We were going to stay in a condo at the Galleon but didn't care for the service we got over the phone. I stopped at the pool bar at the Galleon on Friday evening for a drink and I had rude service, and I couldn't bare the stinch. I nearly got sick. Neadless to say that experience confirmed that my choice in staying off the beaten path at the Eden House was a fabulous one. Richard and Nate were most friendly, from the first phone call to after checkout holding our bags for us. The room was fantastic. Huge bathroom, plasma tv. comfortable bed, private entrance from the side of the resort, and best of all, your own private patio and jacuzzi. I recommend using the pink taxi company. It is approx. 12 blocks or 12 minutes walk to Duval or else a $4 cab ride. Between the wonderful experience we had with the Key West Express, and the above and beyond style service and the comfortable atmosphere we recieved from the Eden House. I am already searching my calendar for another weekend getaway to the Eden House this year. If I had to pick out two things I didn't like about the Eden House I would say I wish the poolside cocktail hour lasted for two, and I wish the Eden House were four blocks closer to Duval. However, it was nice to be away from the car horns, crowds, and street traffic that Duval brings. Thank you Richard and Nate for such a wonderful stay. We look forward to seeing you guys again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: julianas99
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of aspects of the Eden House that make it unique and an amazing place to stay. I would say the first of these is the staff. I knew the staff was special when Nate, upon getting off from work right as a bird was pooping on me, insisted that I wipe it off onto his shirt. Talk about chivalry! Seriously, though, everyone at the Eden House was so knowlegeable, friendly, and eager to make our stay the best it could be. Unfortunately, I'm blanking on some names as I waited too long to write this review, but Richard and Ryan definitely stand out as well! Another great thing is the free happy hour. What a great way to bring guests together for socializing! And finally, I was so impressed by all the green initiatives this place takes- the tourism industry can be so hard on the environment but the Eden House makes a concerted effort to do all they can to reduce this impact- cups made out of plant matter instead of plastic, natural cleaning products, affordable bike rental, recycling containers all over the place, etc. I highly recommend the Eden House to anyone traveling to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “No Reservations”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Nuke-to-You
Reviews.Content: As in "I have no reservations about recommending Eden House to you." If you have never been to Key West, please bear in mind that Key West is not Beverly Hills, though the room rates may make you think so. Rooms are not cheap. Rooms are not particularly fancy. Rooms are not . . . roomy. It's Key West, for crying out loud. Enjoy! Get out and walk around. BTW, if you drive into Key West and you're staying in Old Town, and if you see a free parking spot, park! Do not move your vehicle until you are ready to leave. Parking in Old Town is a challenge in itself, so if you are presented the gift of a parking spot, take it. As to Eden House, I've stayed at several properties in Key West, including B&Bs, hotels, and condos. I'll go back to Eden House, and I can't say that about the others. My room was ready when it was promised, it was clean, it was comfortable, and it was kept that way. The property itself is quite pleasant, and the Eden House has a nice porch on which I sat drinking Mike's designer coffee, watching the wacky, wonderful weirdness that is Key West walk, ride, run, trot, or crawl down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Chiming in to confirm what you've already read”
Reviews.Author: Work2Vacation
Reviews.Content: The staff are great and so welcoming; especially Nate and Ryan. All the little extras like the 24 hour coffee, water cooler, free daily Happy Hour, etc. make you feel pampered. The entire place is comfortably furnished and immaculately maintained. The only thing we'll do different when we go back is to stay in different room. Our small room was in the main walkway of the hotel and not very private. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unhidden treasure.”
Reviews.Author: ambar418
Reviews.Content: I was totally impressed.....the free beer at check-in started my wonderful experience, followed by the fact there is a self serve happy hour! Pool is awesome and open all night. There is even a suncare products table for all guests--I mean really! This place is peaceful, clean, neat, great service, just Awesome. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Keys experience everyone hopes for”
Reviews.Author: LisaBocaRaton
Reviews.Content: I visited Key West for two days with four children, and despite that, I really was able to experience the mystic tranquillity of the lower Keys, thanks to where we stayed. It was the Eden House. From the moment we were greeted at the front desk and offered a cold soda or beverage, the hospitality was over the top. No matter what our need, the staff accomodated. The kindness of people like Ryan ( the evening hotel clerk and all around guy Friday) was only surpassed by the incredible natural beauty of the property. Artistic porches, gazebos, tree-house like apartments, and hammocks were all nestled among the flowering trees and Queen/King Palms. Our room was spacious, with a darling loft with a spiral staircase for access where the children escaped away from the rest of the world. I found my own solace on the porch swing just outside the living room area (visible through the many windows that let natural light in). There were several stained glass windows throughout, and it was hard to believe I was actually staying in such luxurious surroundings. The Air Conditioning worked to perfection. The pool was a work of art (literally), and Happy Hour at the hot tub was delightful. We also were treated to a free barbecue complete with home-made deviled eggs and potato salad for the July 4th holiday. A treat was breakfast at the cafe next door, Azul, where we had Portugues French toast (hint; it has pears and sugared pecans). You could also order Eggs Benedict with just about any type of seafood that you could think of. The Eden House staff were able to recommend additional best tasting, most colorful, and most fun places to eat in town. Incidentally, the hotel is in the historic district, and we were able to walk to everywhere, including Mallory Square for the sunsets The only drawback was that the pool towels seemed to be in short supply; the laundry was always running. That is a complement to the hotel, however, as the guests really enjoyed the amazing pool. By the time we left, we felt like we were saying good-bye to friends, and we hope to come stay there every time we are in the Keys. One other note; although there were plenty of couples staying there, we were not the only family staying there as well. It was particularly meaningful to my 22 year old niece (who found your hotel online), who is still searching a bit for the "meaning of life", and the week-end helped her to realize she was special, and had family. The atmosphere and aura of the hotel really helped her to open her heart, as well as mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Nice and quiet with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: bagdragger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the fourth of July weekend, and while Duval St. was wild and crazy, the hotel was just far enough away to allow for peace and quiet. Nice setting around the pool and hot tub. Internet was a bit sketchy at times, but we were only using it to check the weather!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, will stay again, just didn't like the smoking”
Reviews.Author: diner421141
Reviews.Content: Place was great, CLEAN!!!! This is a make a break for us and we are happy to say it was a make. The staff was great, plenty of amenities, the free coffee in the morning was awesome. Nice big cups with NON-dairy creamer!!! Thank you so much, most places never have that!!! Cold a/c in the rooms and a beatufil place. Quiet, relaxing and friendly. It is a little out of town which we liked, all quiet after 10 perfect for getting some sleep. The only thing we didn't like was the smoking. Nice chairs and seating everywhere but with ashtrays everywhere also. Right outside our rooms was a nice table and chairs so we could relax but we were next to smokers and we must have been on the same schedule because they were always there. If your a non-smoker, walking to and from your room or to the lobby, pool and always walking THRU the smoke stinks!!!! A smoking area would be great, we can avoid that area. Overall, loved this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good amenities - would visit again”
Reviews.Author: JOHO_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Eden Hotel for a couple of nights. Parking available at the hotel. Hotel located in the middle of Key West. Leave the car at the hotel and rent a bicycle at the hotel, you can cycle to all the places to see/be within 10-15 minutes. Rooms are rather small, but you are not visiting Key West to stay in your hotel. Hotel has a lot of facilities to accomodate guests: internet (free wireless and PC+printer), library, free coffee/tea, airco + fan in room, fridge and hotel pool. Rooms are clean. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love love it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ABStephens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House for our anniversary the first week of June. This is our 7th stay at the Eden House in as many years. It was just as amazing this time as the first time we were there. Gina rocked the front desk and was always happy to help us. She even brought veggie burgers to our porch during the Memorial Day cook out. We loved our room and we love Key West. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. Looking forward to our next visit. Your friends from Yellow Springs, Ohio!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds,quiet, peaceful,friendly staff, like i actually lived there”
Reviews.Author: dant42
Reviews.Content: the grounds are loaded with tropical plants, some flowering (plants you cant have in the NE) quiet.lots of shade so your tropical warm but, not hot...........two fish ponds with waterfalls .....staring at the fish is a peaceful serenity of its own........my deck was made of wood boards like you would have at home....hammocks .........swings .........also quiet and peaceful.........we left the property every day because we were first time tourists but, if i could stay longer i would enjoy just sitting on the deck all day long......it was like i died and this was heaven..........i managed to forget all about my job for a few days

Reviews.Title: “Nice small town feel!”
Reviews.Author: KBK24
Reviews.Content: Hi, We had booked this hotel after reading other reviews at Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The front desk staff was nice and helpful. We stayed there for 2 nights and our room was just in front of the pool. The rooms are dated and small but then we were not looking to spend much time in the room anyways. Infact each day after returning back to the hotel we could sit around the pool, enjoy the hot tub n the pool and also the hammocks. The place had a nice feel to it with all the trees, sun deck and a gazebo...Also i think they had free drinks around 4 - 5 PM ..we wernt around at the hotel at that time though. I give it 4 stars for the overall experience at the place..just that rooms could have been little better for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Richard rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yvowoman
Reviews.Content: Quaint amazing little place. Love Richard the guy that helps you with anything you need. Steer clear of Gina though she's extremely crabby. Good times in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: Anitagaribaldi
Reviews.Content: Brian was very nice from the begining til the end. The room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Consider us loyal patrons!”
Reviews.Author: michelem89ny
Reviews.Content: The laid back sense you get from being in Key West is replicated within the Eden House in the best possible way. From check in to check out, a homey feeling pervades. The staff is wonderful and welcoming. They are friendly without losing the attentiveness and helpfulness you expect to receive as a customer. Whether it be for directions to get somewhere or even a suggestion, they are happy to help. There are several types of rooms there and ours albeit somewhat small, was kept very clean and we found we did not lack in space at all. We chose a room without a tv which kept us from wasting precious time in our room and propelled us out to the pool area. They have a free happy hour by the pool where Richard takes extra care to serve the guests with drinks - all the while cultivating a social atmosphere amongst the same group. Some of the best restaurants/ bars/ must see spots were places learned of while hanging out by the pool with long time patrons of the Eden House. Another thing that appealed to us was they try to be â€œgreenâ€� if possible at the Eden House but they never sacrifice customer quality or service in doing so. The only thing I missed was a full length mirror in the room. Outside of thatâ€¦ There were bonuses like the Memorial Day BBQ held at the pool area and the free magnet we took home which featured a picture of the Eden House - it will serve as a great memory to us of a great stay! The personal aspect you experience while staying at the Eden House is so appreciated and something you just cannot typically find while staying with a major hotel chain. I canâ€™t see myself staying anywhere else on the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Big 50th Celebration at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: JanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: OK......returned to Eden House and Key West to celebrate my baby sister's 50th BIrthday with a couple of friends. It was their first time there and I made all the arraignments for the group. This is my second stay at Eden House and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Was just as much fun as it was in July 2007 when I was there last with my husband and two other friends celebrating our anniversaries. The place is so homey and cozy and the tropical gardens surrounding the pool area were as beautiful as ever! We stayed in the 1st Floor Couch House with the private jacuzzi and it was very clean and roomy. We had a bedroom with a queen bed and the sofa was a sleeper with a very comfortable air pillow mattress and it is just a comfy as the queen bed was. It had an extra large bathroom that was perfect with a big walk-in shower and two vanity sinks and with four ladies trying to get ready we had plenty of room to spread out. Staff is excellent there. We especially enjoyed the happy hour with our favorite bartender Richard mixing tropical drinks for us each day at four o'clock. Just like last time it didn't take long to meet the fellow Eden House visitors and there was another large group celebrating a 60th birthday as well as us with my sister's 50th! We had a great time hanging out at the pool in the late afternoon taking a rest from all the hustle and bustle of Duvall Street and the fairly warm temps for May and even making new friends too! Duvall street is a few blocks away with all its late night entertainment, etc. but not a bad stroll and the wharf area is even closer where you can enjoy good food and entertainment as well. Just a couple blocks down from Eden House. If you go to Key West....there are fancier and more expensive places, etc. but if you want a comfortable place to relax and unwind the Eden House is the best! You get personal service, friendly staff and the make you feel at home from the minute you arrive until you leave. Our plane wasn't scheduled to leave until 5:30 PM and they will allow you store your luggage in a secure area even after we checked out at 11AM and hang out by the pool until we had to get ready to leave and they offer you a shower area so you can refresh before you have to go to the airport. Flying directly into and out of Key West airport is great if you have seen the keys all the way down from Miami and getting in to Key West airport is a breeze compared to waitin in long lines at Miami airport. Called a cab at 4PM and were at airport in a few minutes. if you start early you can find some fabulous airfares directly into Key West from Atlanta which saves you the extra time of having to rent a car to and from Miami and assures you a easier flight home and allows you to stay in paradise a bit longer. Thanks Eden House....will see you again and again....until the next adventure!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: carolinewc
Reviews.Content: The Eden House is even more fabulous than the reviews here make it sound. I chose to stay at the Eden House because of the ratings here and reasonable price here on Trip Advisor and was more than pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Beautiful building, quiet, clean rooms. It was its own oasis tucked just of the street. We were only there for a one night stay and were quite sad we didn't have longer to stay. We are planning a trip for Key West next summer and Eden House will be where we stay! Pure delight from the moment the kind staff checked us in, to the time when we checked out. The Eden House comes HIGHLY recommended by me! Thanks Eden House! I'll see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: AJ M
Reviews.Content: t was okay. Rooms are small. There are better and more value-oriented places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: Emilycurtis
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved the Eden House. It's the perfect combination of laid back, old Key West charm but very clean. The staff were all so helpful setting up our activities (trip to Dry Tortugas, bike rentals, restaurant recommendations, directions, beach info etc....) We loved the Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMachine
Reviews.Content: Eden House was great. Everything everyone said was true! Only complaint, sheets were a little rough. If I go back to Key West would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our "House" in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ShruteBeets
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Eden House 5/11-5/15. Some thoughts: More funk. That's how Mike Eden describes his philosophy on the website (really, it feels more like you're staying at a friend's house as opposed to a hotel). Some things that stick out in my mind: The hotel: What a unique place. Again, more funk. The landscaping and pool are stunning. We stayed in the lower conch house, and had one of the larger rooms on the property so we didn't run into the smallish rooms. But as many others have commented, they make it clear on the website that some rooms are small. The grounds are very well kept and clean. I loved the funny signs all over the property....just be sure to not leave your children unattended..... The amenities: This really helps set Eden House apart. Just so you get an idea...free sunscreen "bar', free umbrellas for a rainy day, free fruit in the morning, free cocktail hour with mixed drinks and delicious watermelon in the afternoons, and on, and on... The staff: I only had the pleasure of talking to Rich and Stephanie during our stay, but if they represent the rest of the staff, what a group. From the beers at check-in to helping with pretty much anything during our stay...they are a great group of folks. Rich makes some mean drinks during cocktail hour (even though he had a bad experience with Gin as a young lad...), and Stephanie knows how to pick some awesome poolside tunes. "Genuine" is the best way I can describe all the staff I ran into, and that is a real treat as a traveler, to feel like the staff cares about how your stay is going. I will be going back to Eden House in my future Key West travels. This isn't a chain resort that is immaculate, and it doesn't claim to be. If thats what you're looking for, go ahead and walk on by to the Hyatt/Hilton/Best Western. Leave the funk to the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “The great reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyjo25
Reviews.Content: I have to say.. My trip was cut short becasue of illness. I seem to now get some sort of vertigo when I fly. This is the second time, this has happened and I regretfully had to leave 2 days early. To my dismay, i will be paying a while on a trip i couldn't stay to enjoy. Total bummer. But noone's fault. On to the review: Short but great. Check in was easy -peasy and the room was ready well before the checkin time. A welcome drink and away you go. I stayed in room 502 a large deluxe. This was a great sized room. Clean and bright. I had a porch swing on my own private porch. To get to the room, you crossed a small brdge over the Koi pond to reach it. Really pretty. Plus my door was a straight view to the front desk. Good for security being a solo traveler. Had lunch at Azur. Excellent. Yellow snapper sandwich and orzo salad and a mimosa. walked the 5 or blocks to Duval street in no time to visit a walgreens and pick up some supplies, not allowed in a carry on bag.
