As the dramamine wore off.. the worse I started to feel. Went to bed early. Spent the next morning at the pool. Had a chair under some palm trees next to the waterfall. Really was great. Had lunch delivered from Azur to the pool. Awesome. The front desk staff was really great. Gina, and a young man didn;t catch his name at night and another in the early morning as I was leaving. Helpful and very nice. I ended up leaving the next day... but even though it was short. I really have to say that this was the best hotel experience I have ever had. SO blows a chain hotel out of the water. I so hope that I will be able to get back again and have a proper stay. Driving may be a much better idea next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Retreat”
Reviews.Author: diguan
Reviews.Content: This is a late review... Our stay at the Eden House was during New Years Weekend. The staff was very pleasant from the check-in, to giving recommendations on local tips, and provided a beer when we arrived. The landscape/ environement of the hotel was immaculate and room was very comfortable. Not a large room, but we knew after reading the reviews what to expect and we did not spend any time in the room outside of sleeping and changing. One thing that really added value was the on-site bike rentals. The location of Eden house is in a great spot of the city, close to Duval but not close to all the bustling action and a short throw away from the waterfront. It was only a 2 minutes bike ride to our favorite breakfast spot, Cuban Coffee Queen. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hideaway”
Reviews.Author: BobT44
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night as I was on a cycling tour of South Florida. I arrived at the hotel after cycling from Marathon, and was immediately offered a complimentary beer or soft drink...nice touch! After checking in, I was told there was complimentary water, tea & coffee available in the reception hall, and that there was a complimentary cocktail happy hour at the pool every day between 5pm and 6pm...again, a really nice touch. My room was facing the pool with a queen bed and private facilities. It was clean, simply furnished and had a/c, and wi-fi. The pool and Jacuzzi were clean with plenty of sun beds and hammocks available for use, and the grounds were well planted with flowers and shrubs to aid the cooling effect. All in all, it was a great place to rest my weary body and only a short walk to Duval St, Mallory Sq etc. I'd definitely stay again! During my stay, I found the hotel to have a really relaxing atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convienient location, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mcgb57
Reviews.Content: great location, nice neighborhood setting, couple of blocks from Duval, happy hour every afternoon. Friendly staff. had a great 5 days in a comfortable room .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: orange77Toronto
Reviews.Content: Loved it from the second I walked in! Quirky, clean, relaxed, friendly & accommodating. The grounds are well-kept & the room was perfect for our needs & affordability. The pool is a great place to meet fellow guest especially at "happy hour". I would definitely recommend it to my friends & family & to you as well. Oh, how I wish i could go back tomorrow.!

Reviews.Title: “what can I say”
Reviews.Author: jrmroute66
Reviews.Content: I don't know how they could make Eden House more wonderful. I don't know where to begin. The staff is great, the pool is great, the room was great. Sorry to depress everyone & be of no value whatsoever to the readers but they just shouldn't change a thing. Showers could have a little more flow but they are fine. I like to save water too & am glad they obviously feel the same way. Bicycle rentals are important to us & theirs are great. I love the idea of not daily changing the bed or towels unless we request it it's the green and just fine way to operate. We loved the computer & printer in the library so you can print out boarding passes as well or whatever. We loved the phone at the pool to contact the restaurant next door for delivery. The Azur Restaurant next door has fabulous meals but breakfast, lunch & supper were our favorites. We can hardly wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahmc26
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Eden House around 8pm and were given a quick tour. Everyone was very nice, the pool area was gorgeous, the hotel & rooms were very clean. Just as they say, the rooms are very small, which we expected, and there was a musty smell probably because it's a super humid location with carpet on the floor (I sell tile if you decide to renovate the floors ;-). I would definitely return. It's a 6-7 block walk to Duval, but it was probably good for us in the long run. I did a lot of research and for what we paid, I think we got a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love The Eden House”
Reviews.Author: keysdisease
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the great fortune to once again stay at the Eden House. We were there for 5 days and stayed on the first floor of the Conch house (421). What a perfect room, everything we could have asked for and more. Very clean, lots of room, quiet and private but accessible to everything. Love the pool and the happy hour. Staff were excellent. The free morning coffee (with hazelnut creamer) made my husband's day. We plan on coming back again hopefully a little longer next time and hopefully with some friends. Meanwhile we hope the staff at the Eden house keeps up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: PiaPrehn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden with my teenage son a couple of nights. Truly a pleasure. The garden is amazing - I loooved the hammocks - with my book and a cup of coffee. The location is perfect. Our Key West-experince wouldn't have been the same if we had stayed outside the "old town". We rented bikes and really enjoyed getting around in that way. The staff was very helpfull - they called and made reservations for us to do this and that (-DO try parasailing, by the way!)... The only thing not perfect was the size of the room. It was small (-we had one of the cheaper rooms - I guess other rooms were bigger). Of course you aren't there to be in your room (not with a garden like that) - but yes: You DO live out of your suitcase, while there. Anyway - it didn't ruin our visit. And if I am ever going to Key West again, I wouldn't want to stay any other place. It IS very charming - and clean: no bugs, by the way :-) I loved the "library" (give a book or take a book...), the sun-tan-lotion-bar, the happy hour, the relaxed feel of everything. Oh, and my 18 year old son thought the place was SO cool :-)

Reviews.Title: “This is the Paradise at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFrei
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Nothing to say. Don't hesitate to lunch or to have breakfast at the Azur Restaurant (20% off) close to Eden House. Suncare, Bodycare, Haircare are available free near the Pool and Big Oranges too in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: spatula259
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Eden House, and it was fantastic. I love the location. Everything is within walking distance. One block away from Five Brothers, delicious sandwiches. Two blocks away from Finnegan's - the best pizza! Just a short walk to Mallory Square and Duval Street. Absolutely loved the rainfall shower in the room. Really like how green everything is, including the recycling bin in the room and the shower gel, shampoo and conditioner dispenser in the bathroom. TV has a built-in DVD player, which is nice, but not necessary since you are in paradise. The pool was the perfect temperature. Happy hour was fantastic. One day there was a fresh-cut watermelon. In the morning, there were oranges in the lobby. Liked that there were extra pillows in the room. Room was always cleaned at a reasonable time. The staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. All of the flowers were blooming and the pool area really was a tropical paradise. Staying at the Eden House completes my trip to Key West. I can't imagine it would be the same staying at a different hotel when visiting the island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jsethwitmer
Reviews.Content: Eden House was everything I hoped it would be.....clean, quiet, friendly. I'll definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: elle07960
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Our 20 month old was given fish food everyday to feed the fish and he loved it. We kept the food in one of the coin purses and now when he sees it he says, "fish!"

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kohanatvoia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden house one weekend in April 2011. It was our first time there and I must say I am very impressed. Love the location, not too far, yet not too close to busy Duval, quiet, serene, fantastic people (guests and employees), nice atmosphere. I loved the pool, the spa, the hammocks, the swings, the rich vegetation, the flowers and butterflies everywhere, the coy fish, the tea and honey available at all times in the lobby and of course, the complementary beer as soon as we walked in. Thumbs up for this place! You guys rock! Oh, almost forgot, they called me after we left to ship things that we forgot in the room due to high levels of alcohol and relaxation in our system. Good job, guys!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MooresvilleNC
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night in this hotel while touring the Keys. Like all hotels in Key West, I find it a bit overpriced. We paid $306 for a deluxe room that is very small. The room had a terrible smell that we couldn't pinpoint. It seemed to come from the air conditioning unit. Otherwise, the room and bathroom were very clean. The amenities include a fridge, TV and phone. If you need a hair dryer, you need to ask for one at the front desk. The hotel is extremely charming, the pictures show exactly how the hotel looks like. It is a bit removed from the beach, but this means that it is also quiet. It is a very nice walk to the beach or main tourist attractions, houses and gardens are beautiful. If you prefer, you can also rent bikes directly at the hotel. The pool is on the smaller side, a perfect fit for the hotel architecture. There is a restaurant next door. Only had breakfast there and it was perfect (as a guest at the Eden House you receive a 10% discount). Near the reception there is a computer, lots of books, magazines and board games. They also have plenty of sun lotion for you to use, should you have forgotten yours. The hotel operates on a green policy, which is nice to know. There is also a happy hour at the pool at 5PM I believe. It essentially consists of three different kinds of alcohol and juices, along with some snacks. We found a parking spot on the premises, however, there are only a handful spots. Otherwise you can park on the street. Overall, I am very glad that we stayed at the Eden House and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It certainly is a spot of Eden”
Reviews.Author: IslandManRides
Reviews.Content: The Eden House is a wonderful hideaway. We opted for a â€œLoftâ€� room, which opened to the pool area. It was very nice indeed. The bed was on the second floor of the room, up a narrow spiral staircase. So, if you have any mobility issues you may want a single floor room. The general atmosphere was laid back. Everything was spotless. There is a definite eco-theme throughout the resort. Duvall Street is a bit of a hike, so you may want to hitch a ride on a pedal-taxi. The Key West Express port is a very short walk, about three blocks. So, dragging your bags is a real option. If you chose to have the Porter service deliver your bags, they are waiting for you at the port. There were a few delightful unanticipated surprises that made the stay even smoother. We only had night available for us, because it was a spontaneous weekend getaway. The online booking required a two night minimum stay. Calling 1 week in advance they were willing to waive the 2 night minimum. We checked in at 3:45PM, and to our surprise, poolside happy hour started at 4PMâ€¦ perfect timing. Eden House provides Vodka, Rum, Gin and the mixers for 1 hour. Itâ€™s a nice primer for the evening. And, on check out, we were told that we could come back to the hotel before we caught our ferry ride home to get cleaned up. A hot shower after a day of running around Key West was very welcoming. We certainly want to return and would recommend Eden House to all.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Bluethroat
Reviews.Content: Found it by searching for bed and breakfasts and lodges, as I wanted to avoid the standard, cold, industrial feel of chain hotels. And I was served! The place itself is boasting with greenery, delicious little hideouts, hilarious signs, comfortable rooms, and they actually DO APPLY the green policies they put forward. But the cherry on top is the kindness of staff: I was immediately contacted by email when my booking was received with a special request, and everything was done to accommodate that. Then when we arrived, we were greeted by a most helpful staff member. Here at Eden they will help you organize a sky dive, recommend nice diving spots, or if you're less of the reckless type nice dining, beautiful beaches and things to do. They'll even go the extra mile to negotiate a better price! Two thumbs up! Definitely coming back here if I ever come back to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Shh! Don't Tell Anyone, But This Place Is A Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: We weren't going to mention this because we wanted Eden House to be all ours - even though we found it by using Trip Advisor a few years ago. We thought that if we didn't blab about this place then maybe everyone would quietly forget about it and then we could have the place all to ourselves. But we see that just about everyone else is giving its glorious praise so we figured our little plan was futile. Now we will join in the praise! You see, we live on the left coast and we still fly across the country to spend a few days here just about every Spring. The grounds are beautiful with lush gardens and hideaway hammocks. The rooms are very attractive without the cookie-cutter layout of chain hotels. When our taxi drops us at the door we feel that we are at our new home - that is a tropical home. The pace is about as laid back as one could imagine. Get up, have coffee, walk a couple of blocks to Harpoon Harry's for a huge breakfast, walk to the wharf and visit the sea turtles and manatees and head back in time to catch the best sun rays of the day and Eden House's 80 something degree pool and hot tub. Then at 4 o'clock comes the pool side Happy Hour. Then more sun rays and some great conversation with our like minded lazy co-inhabitants of this peaceful nirvana invoking garden. Then the taxing time of the day befalls when decisions must be made as to where to dine this evening. Then comes the quiet. No loud frat boy parties allowed here - Mike Eden, the owner and proprietor of Eden House, runs a quiet and very peaceful establishment - just the sounds of the crickets and the rental scooters zipping down Fleming Street. Then sleep. Other guests have described the details of Eden House more eloquently than I, so I will leave you to their descriptions. But if you succumb to our powers of persuasion and visit this garden of Mr. Eden I ask only that you not return and go blabbing about this place to everyone else in the world. Let's just keep this place our little secret. OK?

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: nini5
Reviews.Content: We have been coming back for 10 years for our annual Nov. visit. The grounds are just beautiful and I can always find a relaxing quiet spot to read or nap on the well cared for grounds, be it a lounge chair, swing, front porch or hammock. It is small enough to be very personal. Mike has the perfect crew now to keep things running well. Pasha spoils us shamelessly. How many places can you stay and know the housekeeper on a first name basis, and she always remembers our family and puts a few extras in the room to make us more comfy. Happy Hour is always fun to meet new folks before a stroll down town for dinner. Please don;t change anything. the beds are wonderful. Anxious to try the Azur food poolside. Can you tell we are enamored with this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “No place like Eden house”
Reviews.Author: Smbob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go here before anywhere else. We can relax and enjoy the sun by the pool. A nap in one of their great hammocks always helps too. We got back 3 weeks ago and I already want to plan our next trip. The staff is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision I could have made!”
Reviews.Author: RSColket
Reviews.Content: Quiet, tranquil, pleasant! Had a great time, staff was excellent. In house suggestions for local resteraunts and sights were the best. Great Job... Looking forward to going back in the future

Reviews.Title: “Hands down THE best, funky, classy, affordable, most awesome place to stay in KW.”
Reviews.Author: TASZKA
Reviews.Content: Hands down THE best place to stay in Key West. It's old school Key West with a funky little vibe. Don't stay here if you're looking for a chain hotel experience. $1 beers at the front desk. Free happy hour. This is what KW is all about. Eden House has class, culture and spunk. I would really like to meet Mike Eden one of these days... and give him a big ol hand shake. Who needs a large room in KW? You're supposed to get out and enjoy the island. We've been back 2 years in a row and plan on returning for the rest of our lives. You have to go experience it for yourself. Sleep in a hammock outside under a palm tree at Eden House. Seriously I can't say enough good things about this cozy home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Management”
Reviews.Author: Tanishaa
Reviews.Content: With utmost dissappointment I have to say this, that EDEN HOUSE is the most unprofessional hotels I have ever dealt with. God-forbidden you have a booking with them and you are stuck in a horrible HURRICANE or a SNOW STORM or a deadly EARTH-QUAKE and you cannot make it to the beautiful KEYS, they do not have the courtesy to understand the situation and refund the money back. I would never recommend anyone to go to this hotel. There are thousands of other Hotels in KEY WEST who I'm sure have better proffesionalism. To the OWNER of EDEN HOUSE, If you are reading this, I hope you would mend your policies to attract some guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hospitable, and absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Cat10101
Reviews.Content: A friend and I selected this hotel for our two-day, one-night stay in Key West, and anticipated a very nice stay based on the reviews and the hotel's website. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it was even better than our expectations. The front-desk staff was very friendly -- morning, afternoon, and night. They gave us very helpful advice on where to eat, which beach we would enjoy, and gave us directions and called cabs for us to get to our destinations, even providing us with maps of the area. At check-in, we were given a tour of the facilities, and it was absolutely gorgeous. The pool area is fun, but not too loud, and there is a happy hour in the late afternoon with free cocktails that we partook of. There was also a hot tub, which is a nice little luxury many hotels don't have. The room we stayed in, with two single beds and a private bathroom, was not very large -- a little more on the cozy side. If you are traveling with children, I believe they have larger options, but our vacation was not intended to be spent in a hotel room, so it was perfect for us. There was also nice tv if you have a little time to kill, but we never used it. Instead, we appreciated the mini fridge and microwave they provided. The beds were also very comfortable, and it was extremely quiet all day and night, even with the busy activity that hotels usually experience at check-out in the morning. To me, peace and quiet is one of my highest priorities in a hotel, and Eden House's quiet hours rule is very effective and reasonable. In addition, we found the hotel to be very clean and pleasant. The tile floors were nicely kept, the bed linens and towels were very clean, and in general the hotel was very tidy. A computer was available for guests' use, and they even had a large selection of sunscreens and tanning lotions at hand for beach and pool excursions -- now that's looking out! They also provided complimentary coffee and tea in the mornings, and a 20% off card to the Azur restaurant next door, which was very lovely and conveniently located. Overall, we loved the Eden House. During the spring break season, some hotels are a mad house, but this one was really a nice little haven. If it's within your budget, I'd definitely recommend it over any budget hotel to make your trip just that little bit more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing but staff able to help in case you get energetic!”
Reviews.Author: barbie541
Reviews.Content: Hammocks for resting, books for reading, pool with both sunny and shady areas. Perfect spot for getting away but only blocks away from marina and restaurants and sights. Best for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel, great staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: trvlagnt2long
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at Eden house, and will go back at the first chance. The location is great, walking distance to Duval St while still being in a nice quiet neighborhood. Staff is very friendly, helpful and their greeting upon check in is 'bud or bud light". How ever it wasn't a wild party hotel. The room we had was very clean, with a nice TV, and fridge. Ours was a standard room, which was small but ample if you just want a place to sleep and shower. The outside had a nice covered balcony, very nice pool, hot tub and the nice hammmock nap spot. No reason to sit inside with these options.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise of a bygone era”
Reviews.Author: WilliamSGee
Reviews.Content: A place like Eden House is not possible everywhere. Necessary to its function is that all of its guests adhere to a single, central tenet: don't be a tool and ruin this for everyone. A beer when you walk in the door, a pool open til 10, but available 24 hours for inocuous dips ("If we can't hear you, we can't see you"), a poolside self-serve happy hour beverage cart...all of these can be yours, provided you're not a [--]. The staff is welcoming, helpful, and understands that part of the attraction of Key West is forgetting about the details and stresses of the "civilized" world. And they're there to help you do that. It may not be for everyone - it's a throwback to more communal accomodations (many of the rooms have shared showers, there's a downstairs fridge for everyone, and the rooms might be small for some), but if you want to kick back and properly submit to Key West's charms, this is a great place to call homebase.

Reviews.Title: “If Miami is God's waiting room, then the Eden House is heaven”
Reviews.Author: TuxieGoldman
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel that has not been said already. It is clean, friendly, warm, comforting, happy, quiet, tranquil, charming, quirky, and yet it is not for everyone. If you expect a cookie cutter hotel experience, do not stay here. This hotel is for the person who welcomes a nap in a hammock, enjoys and celebrates the independent spirit of a hotel that is run with love. I would encourage anyone who is entertaining a stay here to try to stay longer than a couple of nights. Why? Because it is fun, and life is short.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for the soul”
Reviews.Author: Krismom
Reviews.Content: We are repeat patrons at Eden House, and each time we stay there we find new things to love. This year we thought the music playing around the pool area was especially enjoyable! The peacefulness of the hammocks allows you to let go of stress and just appreciate the greenery and the blue sky. Also, the happy hour is a great way to meet other patrons and make new friends. We can't wait to return or should I say "this place is terrible"...we want to keep it to ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “EDEN House is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: havepasseswilltravel
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Eden House and it was AWESOME! The staff is super friendly. (They give you a beer on check in!!) The rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed in a room that shared a bathroom with the room next door, and it was fine. They give you a tour of the property, which includes a very clean and beautiful pool, hot tub, hammocks, porch swings, and a free happy hour by the pool everyday. I had a BLAST, and cannot wait to go back. I will stay at Eden House from now on when I visit Key West, take my advice and do the same!

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ELREY123
Reviews.Content: A wonderful surprise in an equally delightful spot, Key West. Situated in Fleming Street, this small, privately run hotel is exactly what you want and need if you want the Keys experience to the max. We were lucky enough to have one of the bigger rooms, a small apartment. I spent hours in the hammock on the Porch, listening to the nightly sounds of birds and laughter. The distance to Duran street, the lovely harbor and other sights is easy to walk. You can leave your car at the parking lot during your stay. Shops are closeby and you feel like a villager the moment you check in. The pool is small but warm and set in a courtyard surrounded by flowert trees. At 4' pm it is happy hour with free (got it right) cocktails ! There is also free coffee & tea all day long and the management goes out of their way to help you with trips, food and anything that you might need. The boss is around and he is sort of a local legend, and has a vision on hospitality which is rarely seen these days in a money driven industry. I would not even consider any other hotel in KW. There are other small hotels like this one though, and all beautifully located. Do not opt for the all in resorts in this town, it spoils the feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Key West”
Reviews.Author: DaveB_150
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, it's location is perfect, within walking distance of the tourist stuff (Duval Street, Mallory Sq etc) but also a nice quiet area. Also the pool area and hammocks are the most relaxing place I've ever experienced, the setup is perfect. The rooms are great, not fancy but very clean and the beds are good. Staff are really friendly and the atmosphere is great, far better than any of the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany225
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there last year over Thanksgiving. What a great place! Ryan met us at the door w/ a cold drink and then checked us in. The whole place was so quaint and peaceful. Spacious enough that if you wanted to be left alone to relax you could yet cozy enough that if you wanted to be social and make new friends (which we did) you could. Happy hour everyday at 4p was awsome. It was located just close enough to Duval St that the walk was no big deal. The staff were very helpful with tips on where to eat and what to do. The rooms are nice and "cozy" not terribly big, but who cares... Your never in the room, theres too much to do and see. And breakfast at the Azur is awsome, try the Key Lime Pie stuffed french toast! We can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to kick back and get your island attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: luvglobetrottin
Reviews.Content: When I was researching hotels for my first-time visit to KW, I knew from exploring the website & owner's blog that this would be the perfect place to stay. It met our every expectation: clean, comfortable, great location, superb staff who provided spot-on tips on where to go and what to do. This is a place I will definitely return to!

Reviews.Title: “great cozy guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: gerry383
Reviews.Content: Eden house is what the best reviews state it is, A comfortable , super clean , cozy little hideaway in the heart of Key West, located a comfortable (even late at Night) four block walk to the liveliest part area on Duval street , The staff were great , the up keep was terrific, the pool and sundeck areas were quiet and cozy. We met great people in the other guests of whom all we met were multiple return guests to Eden House and without question would return to Eden house on our next trip .

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jensam98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a couple nights at Eden House during our trip to the Keys last weekend. We were impressed. Eden House is aptly named- we felt as it were a refuse from the madness that is Key West. Before I made this particular reservation I took the owners advice and did my homework. We knew going in that the room was going to be small (we were in the smallest type) but we didnâ€™t plan on spending time in the room. Eden House worked for us because we wanted peace and good, personal service and that is what we received. Notable things we appreciated/enjoyed: The pool/courtyard area- this was truly Eden and I was loathe to leave. The neighborhood- I would compare EH to a buried gem set in a beautiful neighborhood that (I don't think) the cruise shop crowd would experience. Walking around the back streets appreciating the architecture was one of the highpoints of our trip. The staff- really great to us in every way- we felt at home before we had room keys in hand. All and all it was among the best staff experiences I have yet had in my travels. In summary I would recommend this to anyone who wants beautiful surroundings, a friendly staff and a non chain experience. Just do the research and consider also reading the owners postings on the hotel site- his philosophies appealed to me and were a factor in my making the very good call to try the EH. We will return when back in Key West. Also- loved the kitty!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: StianO
Reviews.Content: the sign said, and it didn't lie. A place for relaxation. Hammocks, palmtrees and pool with waterfall. No breakfast, but a really nice place close by. Just 20 min walk to Mallory Square. Friendly staff, no problem changing rooms when a roach decided to pay us a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always!”
Reviews.Author: Smokinjoe999
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th stay at Eden House, and everything was Great as usual. The place is spotless, and the facilities are top notch. Jennifer, Gina, and Ryan at the front desk were more than helpful, and Pasha is the best housekeepper ever. Eden House is the only place I stay when in Key West, and I recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Eden House is great place to stay for not only an excellent location, but also to just relax.”
Reviews.Author: JPHughes
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Eden House. My wife and I were completely satisfied with everthing. Although the private room seemed small when we first walked in, it really had everything we needed and worked perfectly. It was extremely clean and comfortable. The friendly staff made sure we were comfortable at all times. Stated simply: we will return to the Eden house and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a well run, well kept hotel - B/B type place.

Reviews.Title: “best place in key west”
Reviews.Author: clevergennaro
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Key West. Happy Hour, great pool. Cute Rooms. Fab location. The suites are unbelievable. Rent one with a bunch of friends and have a blast in the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MDHotelier2
Reviews.Content: The Eden House is a tropical hideaway located near the center of downtown Key West. It's within walking distance of Duval St and to a number of dockside bars but far enough away from the crowds. The staff will go out of their way to make you feel at home. The rooms are large and most open directly to the inner courtyard of the hotel that is full of palm trees and hammocks. When you check in you are offered a complimentary drink and they host a great happy hour as well. I travel all over the world and would definitely return to the Eden House - it's a gem of a hotel! The only people who would not enjoy this hotel are high end, high maintenance, 5 star only tavelers - but who wants them in your hotel anyway??

Reviews.Title: “If amenities and amazingly kind, attentive service is what you crave, Eden House has it all.”
Reviews.Author: tdprestridge
Reviews.Content: I came to Eden House as part of a Ragner Relay race team. We chose to stay at Eden after we completed our 191.1 mile race from Miami to Key West. The staff and amenities were just what we needed after such a hard two days of running and no sleep. The beds were incredibly comfortable, the jacuzzi and heated pool were perfection, and to top it off, there is a free happy hour pool side every day at 4pm! Additionally you are able to order sandwiches for lunch and have them delivered to you at the pool as well. If all these amenities aren't enough, the staff are some of the kindest, most helpful people you wouldn't want to take care of you! I highly, highly recommend this place. They rooms ranging from a semi-private which is perfect for just one person, or entire suites that can be shared with 4, etc. When I come to Key West, this is the ONLY place I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Part of the Key West Experience”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: First reaction on seeing the pool area and the balcony and view from our room> Wow. This is Key West. Yeah, the rooms are small with tiny closets and the price is no bargain and carrying suitcases up two flights of stairs is a negative, but Eden House hums. All the other reviews refer to how helpful the owner was, but we never met him. Stephanie gave us all the welcome information and sightseeing and dining tips we needed and the rest of the stay kind of took care of itself. Free coffee and tea, and wireless internet add to the "help yourself" attitude. There is limited parking, but by leaving the car untouched and walking everywhere, we got exercise and the full Old Town experience. There are lots of places to stay in Key West, but we'd book here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Maaaavalous”
Reviews.Author: Lifegoesfast
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot to stay in the keys. The place has that laid back carribean feel to it. Took my wife on a surprise trip for a few days and this place is perfect. Even though this December was record low temps, we were still sunnin our buns by the pool & sun deck during the day, hopped on our bikes (just outside the front door) and hit the town in the evenings. If your after the cookie cutter style place to stay, then this is not for you-but if you like the places you stay to be the ones you go back to over & over and tell others to go there also or bring them along, then this is it. Cant beat the value, ride your bike down the street & pick up you fav drinks & some breakfast/lunch/snack type stuff and you can save a bunch of $. Then spend all that dough on dining out at nite. Be sure & get to the Fort state park for an afternoon. Great beach for $5. They got a snack bar with good food/drinks and bathroom facilities. Pretty decent snorklin and fun to watch the cruise boats go in & out. Get out & see the island. Lots of cool stuff if you go do it. Cemetary, light house, heck you can ride around the entire island in about an hour (we did it) Butterfly place is pretty cool (kinda a chick thing). Rent a boat and find your own beach for the day. Must go to the Cuban Coffee Queen for breakfast/Cuban Coffee & a couple espresso shots. Cant beat the food or the price. Oh yeah-the places look Maaaavalous at christmas time with all the lights & decorations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...staff is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jjreadyro
Reviews.Content: Only two down sides to this place. The first is the price, but every place in Key West is expensive. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. The only other problem was our room was alittle small for the price, but yet again everything is small in Key West. Overall I had a great experience here and would recommend Eden House to others.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stress free get away”
Reviews.Author: vacationermn
Reviews.Content: after arriving in miami and geting lost ,[ thanks to the police officer that gave us directions, plus advice '" don't stop in this neighborhood again".] wife and i spent two days at eden house. mike gave us good tips where to eat. didn't need the car for those days. staff were very friendly and helpful. location was great. place was perfect. next time we will fly into key west. thanks to all the staff and mike, see you again. calvin & cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue”
Reviews.Author: ONRoss
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights with my brother and a friend from Florida. I have stayed in high end and chain hotels in Key West. The Eden House was great value for the money. We reserved a budget room that shared a bathroom. The room was small but offered everything that I required on my stay. The location is central to all the restaurant's and nightlife (minutes to Duval). The staff are very courteous and helpful. The hotel had everything I required for my stay. I enjoyed conversing with Michael after my late nights on the town. I'm planning on returning in the new year with my wife so I'm told!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ehess78
Reviews.Content: The room was small but beautiful. Lots of thoughtful touches. Warm pool towels, heated pool and jacuzzi that never closes. Hammocks and swings oh my. Friendly fantastic staff. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmtuck
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Eden House with another couple for Fantasy Fest 2010. Let me summarize our stay: Booking: We were fortunae to find this great location for the dates we wanted...arrived on Saturday and left on Tuesday. That was a little different for this special holiday but sine they had a room available for those dates they accomodated our needs. Of course it was expensive, but everything is at that time so they were actually reasonablly priced. Service: from being greeted with an offer of a cold beer, to help with taxi's, scooter rentals, happy hour, towels, etc...the staff was wonderful!!! Accomodations: we stayed in a 2 bedroom 1 bath suite since it was all that was left available for Fantasy Fest by the time we booked. I was sceptical...until we saw the room. The location was fantastic, very private with decks to sit outside on, and the shared bath was no problem as it was quite large. The Pool and pool area was awesome! warm water, great hot tub, and the other guests were regulars, and quite friendly! All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would definately reccommend and stay again! Thanks Mike!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandief
Reviews.Content: I am usually a Marriott girl, but would chose this again over a branded hotel again (and I am in the hotel biz!). The rooms were extremely clean, and the service was fantastic! We were greeted on arrival with a cold beer, the front desk clerk gave us a tour of the house and showed us our room. When not out enjoying the sites of Key West, we enjoyed lounging by the pool, on their sun deck, and took a nap in a hammock. Although hard to get an internet signal in the room, I just went to the swing on the porch outside my room when I wanted to get online! Next trip to Key West, I will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Tried n True”
Reviews.Author: K8tecarlo
Reviews.Content: We ended up in KW between Fantasy Fest and The Parrot Head party....having to leave our little haven we had been staying in for the week we stumbled upon Eden House. The property is lush. The rooms are clean and updated. The property is inviting and tranquil. We fell in love with the porch kittys ; ) Funny enough upon arriving home and consulting with my good friend and former Conch head, she told me Eden was the first place she stayed upon arriving in KW back in the 1970's. Clearly they know how to maintain a sucessful busingess and I would suggest it to any and all. P.S. note the webcams above the pool and hot tub...he he he

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuPineapple
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during FantasyFest 2010. The staff was fantastic, and the guests were great fun! Thanks, Mike, for making your hotel a great home-away-from-home.

Reviews.Title: “Best "hotel" I've ever stayed at, period.”
Reviews.Author: protocoldoug
Reviews.Content: Seriously. The best stay I've ever had at any range of hotel-type establishment, be it hotel/motel/inn/b&b/anything, the best stay. The Eden House is something above and beyond. Firstly, their website gets you seriously pumped for your stay, I kept going back just to get pumped. And just when I thought I'd get myself over excited? They surpass every expectation that I had! My fiance and I went, and we spent the majority of our vacation elsewhere in the Keys, but... Our only regret was that we didn't book more time at the Eden House! ...We even considered trying to get another night's stay and eat the cost of our other reservation. And Mike will tell you on the website and in their marketing materials, the Eden House is about "the funk", it's just funky and cool. It's different, and that makes it neat. Very relaxed, very fun, very cool. Great neighborhood, good times, nice people, man! ...I just can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great rate, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: RyanBud11
Reviews.Content: This inn was great. The staff met all of our needs and are very accomodating. They are ok with whatever you want to do as long as you are not harrassing other guests. I could go on about other great things too, but no need. There was nothing bad to say about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel in the downtown of key west”
Reviews.Author: siobhanonthehill
Reviews.Content: This place is really cute and a nice concept. The welcome was good and the reception staff were always friendly and helpful to us. The pool area is clean and well kept and the jacuzzi is lovely and warm. There is a happy hour from 4-5 with as many cocktailas as you can drink (although by the end of the hour some guests did look a little too happy!!). There is a deck area and a grill if you want to buy your own stuff and cook. The hotel is green and you are encouraged at all times to recycle and re-use, which I liked. It is also very quiet and I loved the peace. The only slight down point is that the rooms are extremely small and the double bed tiny, so it was difficult for my 6 foot plus boyfriend to sleep! Overall I really liked this place and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: KyHillbilly3
Reviews.Content: Fantasy Fest 2010. Loved being on the path of the Masquerade March! Clean, friendly staff and laid back environment. 6 blocks from Duval partying! 2 blocks from wharf. Already booked room for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is definatley the place to stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: threepercenter
Reviews.Content: We were there a couple days at the end of September through early October and everything was just great. The first floor of the Conch House we rented was perfect. The grounds were even better than the pictures on their website. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Heck, my biggest complaint for the whole stay was that I didn't get the chance to shake the owners hand and tell them in person how much we enjoyed our stay. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with charm and character in spades”
Reviews.Author: Milo1234
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Eden House. It's a lovely old Key West house which has been nicely updated with lovely landscaping and a restful courtyard. The service is accomodating and friendly, the pool is great, rooms small but comfy, and there are quality books and magazines galore to pick from. The hotel is very well situated for exploring the downtown and the great local architecture. I will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable accommodations & location”
Reviews.Author: goldwing2500
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. You're greeted with a beer on check-in, which is a plus for me since I walked from the airport. My room was small but very quaint and comfortable. I had a private room with no TV or phone and loved it since I'm quite content with a good book. Duval Street was within walking distance and the front desk staff was awesome. There is a pool and jacuzzi and I have every intention of returning. This is now my official spot when I go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “An Eden-esque Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JLandBR
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoyed our stay at the Eden House. Staff was exceptionally helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and genuinely interested in our well-being. Always willing to go well out of their way to make our stay unique and memorable --- from making last-minute reservations for us to scootering down to the docks to return our left-behind sunglasses. Grounds and rooms are delightfully tropical, comfortable, and clean. Especially nice is their 'green' consciousness and their 'enjoy life' philosophy. Very conveniently located and within easy walking distance of most points of interest. Can't wait to go back and will highly recommend to those who want a refreshingly different (and non-corporate) hotel experience. Definitely reflects the best of the Key West lifestyle. Azur Restaurant next door was equally memorable. Many thanks to ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Charm”
Reviews.Author: Cazbee
Reviews.Content: We were charmed by Eden House. We had booked from Australia on the recommendation of other Trip Advisor travellers and were delighted to find the Hotel just as described. To start with the Hotel itself is so pretty and located in a quiet residental street. We were welcomed warmly and informally at reception and offered a cold drink straight away which was very much appreciated and then showed around the property and taken to our room which was right by the pretty pool. Our room was extremely clean and furnished with a double bed, TV, airconditioner, ensuite bathroom and even a fridge and microwave (which is usually standard in Australia, but not always so in the USA!). But the room facilities came second to the atmosphere, we felt like part of a large family rather than guests, encouraged to grab a cup of coffee or take a book from the library and relax by the pool. We had only one brief night to spend in Key West unfortunately, but would not hesitate to stay at Eden House again. Well done to the team - we loved our Key West stay!

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff we've ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: las-otg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House for the first time this past week. The friendly staff â€” primarily Gina and Stephanie â€” couldn't have been more helpful. They recommended places to eat and things to do and we were never disappointed! The standard room that our friends stayed in was REALLY small. Our deluxe room was a bit bigger, but still small. Considering we didn't spend a lot of time in our rooms (even with two days of continual rain!), this wasn't a big deal for us. Everything is clean and well maintained. The stained glass throughout the property was a nice touch. The only disappointment was that we were supposed to be in a room with a porch swing but that somehow got messed up because there were no rooms with a swing available when we arrived. Oh well ... next time. And I'm guessing there will be a next time!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Key West!”
Reviews.Author: cbps58
Reviews.Content: Great Key West atmosphere! Super nice and helpful staff. 7 of us stayed in the Conch House - 3 private bedrooms and a pull-out sofa in the living room - private house with all the amenities of a hotel attached. No need for a car -- from the hotel we walked to/from the Key West Express boat dock and Duval Street -- rented bicycles and went everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At Eden House”
Reviews.Author: frankoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our second trip to Eden House. I know that it is considered a hotel but it really feels more like a B&B. The Eden is laid out like a compound of several building with the pool and hot tub being the central meeting place for all of the guests. Each of the buildings has rooms with their own unique charm. The staff is the best in Key West!!! Seriously. At the 4:00 happy hour, sponsored by the Eden, you will meet wonderful people from all over the world. When you hate going home as much a we did, you know you have been someplace special!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lish_tish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a weekend getaway to Key West and stayed at Eden house for 2 nights. Upon checking in, the front desk attendant offered us drinks, and even upgraded our room for free- just because she had the room to do so. She showed us back to our room, and I have to say, I wasn't expecting that much from the pictures that I had seen on tripadivsor/their website. When we got to our room, the room was a little small, but not as small as I was expecting and really nice! It had a flat screen tv (which offered HBO and other premium channels for free), king size bed, nice size bathroom and seemed to be recently updated with new fixtures and furniture. There was a private patio for us to sit on with a hanging swing right outside our door. There were hammocks to lounge in nearby also. The pool and hot tub areas were very clean and well kept. In fact, the whole hotel was nicely kept and clean. In addition, the staff was very helpful and friendly. They gave us recommendations for restaurants based on what we were looking for, and booked activities and rentals for us. All in all, it is a very laid back place to stay, not too far away from all the nightlife and shopping. I hope to go back again in the near future, and will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic... and I do mean basic...”
Reviews.Author: okvomit
Reviews.Content: About as basic of a room that I've ever had. No alarm clocks to bother you. No pesky telephone to bother you. Not even one of those pesky TV sets in our poolside room to bother you. "The teachings of Buddha" on the nightstand in our probably 100 sq ft. tiny room. If you are a traveler that wants to "get away from it all" in the real sense of the word, then this hostel is for you. Friendly staff and a dollar beer can be fetched from behind the front desk. They admit the hotel is not for everyone, and I'm sure if I would have complained they would have accommodated us with a room with at least a TV set. Nice relaxing pool area. Quiet time from 10 PM to 10 AM.

Reviews.Title: “The very best!”
Reviews.Author: telly1975
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the EH for a total of 11 years, (though not 11 years in a row, sadly) and I will NOT stay anywhere else! I just got back two days ago, and I am already plotting my next trip. If you have read the rest of the reviews, you know that the rooms are small (but very nice, clean, and ooohhhh, the beds! The bed is reason enough for me to come back right away...) and they do offer a range of choices for rooms depending on how big you want and if you need a TV/Fridge, or etc. The grounds are amazing, more like your own yard if you lived in paradise rather than a hotel property, really. With lush tropical plants, palm trees, koi ponds, pool, jacuzzi, hammocks, porch swings, great music, and free happy hour, really, what else could you want?? They'll also set you up with dining recommendations, reservations, bookings for charters, etc. What I can't quantify is how you'll feel staying here. We stayed at EH 7 years in a row, and then haven't been back since Jan '06 because we've been busy having kids (and how that kills the travel budget). When we arrived last weekend, it was truly like coming home. Not much had changed, except new beds, furniture, some new faces at the desk, new TV in the lobby and rooms (I assume...we didn't want one in ours). The relaxed and funky vibe was just as prevalent as it has always been, and the complimentary beer at check in actually stepped up a little in quality as well! We saw our favorite "international sanitation engineer" almost immediately after arriving, Pasha, and she remembered us from years ago, and seemed genuinely glad to see us, like a long lost friend. That feeling is what you get when you stay at (and return to, like you will want to) the Eden House. I didn't get to see you, Mike, but I know you read these reviews, so THANK YOU for making my weekend amazing, once again. The EH is not a chain hotel, nothing like one, so if you want a cookie cutter nice bed, nice room, nice pool, et cetera, bland, anonymous type of vacation, fine, stay in new town, and leave the EH for those who will cherish it, because that is what this kind of place deserves. We love it there, truly a home away from home for us, and though it may be a while before we get back there, we'll think of EH and all the staff with a smile and a wistful pang. See you again soon! Thanks again for a great weekend! Chantal and Kevin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: stevengp70
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eden House in mid September and had a great time. The pool is a great place to relax and the happy hour in the afternoon was an unexpected surprise. Rooms are clean and tidy and are more than adequate. Only wish I could have stayed longer. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, to the point of one going of his way to walk us to the corner to point us in the right direction for a restaurant (sorry I have forgotten his name) Would definitely recommend staying hereand if I ever make it back to the Keys will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Braindead”
Reviews.Author: peng4711
Reviews.Content: is the nicest what we can think of. We were so relaxed thanks to the warm service and atmosphere. Leave your shoes at home feeling. Yeah you say, but thats Key West! Well yes and no. You can do the Stroll, eat en drink well and have the Funny Stuff Tshirts in your reach. What makes the Edenhouse special is in our opinion the following: The people that own and service the place, The people that visit the place, The extra laid back atmosphere( if you want to get out you can, If you don't want, its ok) Almost step back in time but with the comfort of today. Actualy it is Southpark in the Tropics, okay dude. Oh.. and last but not least;" You feel like at home"

Reviews.Title: “It lives up to its name, it IS Eden!”
Reviews.Author: CynWell1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful, lovely and relaxing place to be. From the moment I arrived the staff made me feel most welcome and cared for. Sitting by the pool - both day and night - is truly healing. Although it's in the heart of the old part of downtown Key West once you are esconced in its walls and hear the water fountains and see the gorgeous palm trees you swear you are in another world. Also, the staff knows all the good restaurants, and the good vendors for attractions (i.e. dolphin/snorkel tours, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “love this place!”
Reviews.Author: windycityfan
Reviews.Content: been coming here for years 'cause it exemplifies the atmosphere of the keys... not for everyone though! like others have said, if you need to be waited on hand and foot, please go elsewhere! i, too, do not want to share happy hour with you! this place is so relaxing and soothing for the body & the mind... our hardest decision of the day is always where to eat... now that's a vacation! almost hate to write this 'cause i love this place & don't want it to change... mike eden (the owner) does a great job with picking his staff & keeping the place like a home away from home...

Reviews.Title: “Our KW Reunion”
Reviews.Author: allykat11328
Reviews.Content: Every year for the last 4 years my boyfriend and I make the pilgrimage to "The Rock" and stay at the Eden House. We've enjoyed sleeping in 3 of the types of rooms they offer from the semi-private shared bathroom to the private room to the Loft type room. Every year we leave super thrilled. If you're looking for a fancy schmancy hotel, forget it. The Eden House is not meant for the high maintenance type. Rest assured, The EH provides a clean, beautiful, friendly spot to lounge near a pristine pool equipped with a cascading waterfall, hammocks, beautiful foliage and COMPLIMENTARY happy hour. Who could go wrong? The joke among the friends I travelled with was "what time is it?" response "who cares!" response "we can't miss happy hour!" This year 4 of us stayed at the EH. We shared a bathroom between 2 semi private rooms. This set up would be ideal for any 4-some looking to save a buck who only needs a place to rest their head before enjoying the sun & activities on the island. Although it was tricky to coordinate shower times before heading out at night, the convenient "public" shower served its purpose. Plenty of room to shave the legs or rinse off before heading out on the town. The shower is impeccably clean and right across the hall is a private toilet with a sink. I cannot rave enough about the staff, every year I am impressed with how nice and easy going they are. The 4 of us got to know Ryan & Gina- the day clerks- who helped us out immensly. Rent bikes, its the easiest way to get around, and conveniently enough, the EH offers bike rentals with your stay. I could speak volumes about what a great place the Eden House is but I could never do it any justice. Do yourself the favor and enjoy Key West by booking a trip and staying there. They have a ton of specials that I'm sure would fit your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: belleviewtravel
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out our stay was fabulous. We walked in and was greeted by a very nice gentleman who offered us our first beer on the house. He then took us on a tour of this beautiful resort style hotel with beer in hand ; ) Right away you can tell this place was taken care of with pride. It is small but homie which is what we like. He showed us to our room, we got the deluxe with the patio and swing and queen bed. Our first impression of the room was that is is small but when we got in and started relaxing it was just enough room for 2 and was perfect. Everythiing was newer and clean, the bed was made, nice flat screen tv hanging on the wall. The bathroom was roomy especially the shower, it was definitely big enough for 2. Our last day there we were greeted with a bottle of champagne after the owner found out I had just graduated school (VERY NICE GUY)! All the staff was very friendly and helpful with whatever you needed including the mainttenance man. We can't wait to come back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Key West”
Reviews.Author: 75CJ
Reviews.Content: Awesome B&B style hotel....great location, nice rooms, amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another Visit 'Home'”
Reviews.Author: conchfever
Reviews.Content: Yes, Home. My wife and I have stayed at the Eden House an easy 15 or 16 times over the past 12 years, most visits for at least 10 days. If this isn't enough to say to give the Eden House a look, I say check it out yourself. I will say the Eden House is not everybody, If you need to be waited on hand and foot and expect everyone to drop everything to attend your every need... PLEASE don't stay, you are not the type of guest I want to spend my pool time with, and besides you wouldn't fit in. If you are someone that is looking for an easy going, relaxing atmostphere stop by at relax. Happy Hour is waiting...

Reviews.Title: “Modest accomodations with charm”
Reviews.Author: AshevilleGator
Reviews.Content: The pool area was very nice. Expect older, smaller rooms. Everything was clean with no evidence of any insects. The only real complaint we had was with the inside of our room. There was only one small mirror over the sink that was hung very high. We are short people and could only see from our chest up! It would have been nice to have had a second mirror (possibly full-length) so we could both get ready at the same time. Otherwise, it was an overall nice experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: scotteach
Reviews.Content: We visited the Eden House at the end of July. We were expecting a 'hostel' experience from the description on the website we booked. Finding a resonable priced hotel room in old town Key West was a task so we took a chance and went for it. THE EDEN HOUSE WAS AMAZING! Not much to look at from the street but as soon as we got inside and were shown around the grounds we were in awe. The pool area and surrounding hammock / swing areas are beautiful. Our room was small & basic but very clean & adequate. It had a seperate bathroom that had a cool old roll top bath with shower. The AC & fan worked great too. There was also lots of nice touches like the public water cooler, a beer on arrival, the comp happy hour & library. Overall enjoyed our two night stay so much that we were reluctant to leave and are even thinking about returning next year for our honeymoon. You will love this hotel if you want a real Key West experience and not a 'hilton' chain where you could be in any part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice Place! Can't believe it's only 2 1/2 stars.”
Reviews.Author: gmujake
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Eden house and instantly were super impressed with the front desk staff. Mike welcomed us (not the owner, there are 3 Mikes. He was the dark haired gentleman.) Mike is from key west and knew a lot about the area. He took the time to circle areas of interest on a map for us and told us about a few local secret spots too! He also helped us to set up a snorkling trip!!! We were offered a cold beverage of our choice on arrival which was nice. There was a cute relaxed cat sleeping on the floor who let up scratch his head. He purred but barely moved and was so cute! The room was small but that is ok. It was comfy and clean. The pool area is immaculate and so relaxing. The whole atmosphere is quiet luxry with a homey touch. I wil go back again for sure. There were so many wonderful things about the place that I could go on and on but take my word for it. This place is a 10!

Reviews.Title: “The Eden House: an Oasis inside an Oasis. . .”
Reviews.Author: Mugzy6o9
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, that the service, friendliness, and overall quality of our stay at the Eden House was GREAT!!! My fiance and I were down in Key West researching wedding venue information and we stayed @ the Eden House. It was our "anniversary" and when we got to the room, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us, not to mention the free libations at check-in! We read a lot of reviews, but decided to go at it on our own & did we LOVE IT - we did not want to leave! Everyone working there was all smiles, answered all of our inquiries, and gave us tips and info we couldn't have gotten at those big chain hotels. We stayed in a nice, quite room in the main house and never had any trouble sleeping. In fact, the sound of the running waterfall in the pool was very helpful in getting us to sleep. Mike Eden's little Oasis in the oasis, which is Key West, was a pleasant, relaxing, and great stay. The bike rentals are great, if you don't want to take the 6 or so block walk to Duval & Simonton, but hey, you're on vacation right?! Why not burn those extra calories or drinks off by walking! All in all, we could not say anything nicer about this place - IT WAS GREAT! Thank you everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, nice retreat and home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl12
Reviews.Content: Having never spent more than just a few hours in the Florida Keys, we needed a place to stay for a few nights after a 2-night cruise and tour in Miami and Ft. Lauderdale. Looking for a quaint accommodation in Key West that could provide a central location, with easy walking/bike riding to Duval Street, we found Eden Houseâ€¦and WOW, were we glad we did! Eden House is a guest house style of accommodation located in the Old Town area of Key West. It was built in the mid 1920s (but has been renovated, of course!) and is one of just a handful of Green Lodging properties on Key West. Itâ€™s an easy walk to Duval as well as the Seaport and Mallory Square, the perfect spot to view Key Westâ€™s sunset. Eden House rents bicycles on-site, and while we had planned to rent them, we found that it was just as easy to walk around town. We also had a rental car since we had driven to Key West from south Florida, but really only used the car once after arriving to Eden House. Eden House provides limited parking, though it was ample while we were there. July is considered low season, so we had no challenges finding parking. During high season, I can see that parking may be an issue though there is plenty of street parking around Eden House as well. The staff at Eden House is among the most friendly weâ€™ve encountered during our travels. In advance, they provided us with a list of sights to see, things to do, and places to eat while on our drive from Miami to Key West. We chose to stop at the Key Deer Refuge Nature Trail, just slightly off our Highway 1 path, but worth the detour. We saw 3 deer just wandering around, not afraid of us or traffic. Street signs in this area are clearly marked, â€œWatch for deerâ€� and theyâ€™re not kidding! The speed limit is 15 mph for good reason. Eden House has a â€œhouse catâ€� named Miss Kitty. Miss Kitty lounges freely in the entrance and the front porch of Eden House, and loves to be rubbed. She purrs and just hangs out, giving a true â€œhomeâ€� feel for the place. Our room was a Large Deluxe with a porch swing out front. The room was clean and just as described on their website and in their email communication. Our room was on the side that bordered Fleming Street, but we never heard any noise or were bothered by our location. The only drawback is that the hotelâ€™s free Wi-Fi was out of range for us. Not a big deal though as we liked having the corner room that was private and just went to the pool if we needed Wi-Fi. The grounds at Eden House are lush with native plants and flowers from Florida, and provide a nice addition to the pool area which hosts a daily Happy Hour from 4 to 5pm. Donâ€™t miss that! They even provide complimentary sunscreen. The 3 nights/4 days we spent on Key West were educational (there is so much history on the island!), fun, and relaxing at the same time. Genuinely friendly residents greeted us on sidewalks and along the pier. We were lucky to strike up a couple of lengthy conversations with locals who told us their â€œstoriesâ€� of how they ended up on the island, providing some encouragement and guidance toward our goal of someday living out our lives on Key West. Time will tell, and we have Eden House to thank as an integral part of our visit to this beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “A different chill-out place worth considering”
Reviews.Author: emboman
Reviews.Content: We booked a small private room (with bathroom) for two nights the 4th of July weekend. It was the most expensive room we've rented in ages, but given the general prices for good locations on Key West that weekend, it was worth a try. Staff was polite, helpful and down to earth. We arrived relatively early and got one of the few on-site free parking spots. So we left the car there and allowed ourselves to sink into the Key West + Eden House atmosphere. Upon arrival we got a complimentary beer each. In the evening there is a Happy Hour where you can help yourself at the bar (vodka, rum, gin, juices, soda, ice, nuts etc. was available), free of charge. At the pool. Sweet. On 4th of July there was even a BBQ at the poolside with burgers, hot dogs, chips, which was really a nice addition to the Happy Hour that day :) The place itself is nice and cozy, and relatively small. The pool was perfectly OK, though probably not the biggest you have seen. There is even a jacuzzi. There are also hammocks, swing benches and pool chairs for you to relax in. At night, the hotel policy is "If we can't hear you, we can't see you", which is sort of perfect for everyone. You can take a night swim or do whatever you want as long as you are not waking up the other guests. We had a small room on the second floor. Certainly not the size and standard you would expect for this price in most other towns in the US, but we were not disappointed, since we had studied the room details on the web site before booking. The room had a queen bed, some shelves, a sink, a shower (and various soaps) and a toilet. Not much room to move around, but we managed (more than a couple of days in such a tiny room is not recommended, I guess). There was even a fan above the bed in addition to the room's AC, which we appreciated (we don't like leaving the AC on too much during the night). We figured that a large percentage of the cost of our room was payment for for the happy hour, pool, water, food, service etc. and not the room standard. This way of thinking made it possible to say to ourselves that it was worth the expense. It was possible to rent bicycles from the hotel (price example: $10 for 12 hours), so we did. This is very much recommended, it is a good way to get around Key West. Extra kudos to the hotel staff for providing a water cooler for everyone to use (no need to go buy those water bottles for once), sun lotions, for taking care of postcards/stamps, and answering questions we had. There was no breakfast/dining in-house (apart from the 4th of July BBQ), but the Azul restaurant next door was available (you get a 20% discount as Eden guest). We tried eating breakfast there once; the food was very good, prices on the high side. Eden House is perfect for couples / friends looking for an alternative to the big chain hotels. We felt very comfortable and relaxed while staying there, and would have stayed longer had we had more time and not to mention money.

Reviews.Title: “Once again another amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: liviaschwartz
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Eden House and from now on, this will be the only place we will stay in Key West. Amazing place with a homey feeling. The rooms are very clean, beds are very comfy. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Lots of small details, such as hammocks and drinks (alchohol cart from 4-6 was a plus!). We took the ferry down and the staff was most accomodating after checkout. Provided a place for our luggage and allowed us to use the pool until our departure. Great that they rent bikes, as this is a must in Key West. I can't wait for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful environment, Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: FranS55
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Eden house. We had an apartment for my husband and I, and a deluxe room for my niece and her husband. Both rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The staff could not have been more helpful. I made the original reservation on-line, but the staff called me almost immediately to confirm exactly what type of room I was looking for (as I had added a comment about wanting a swing outside the room). We didn't have hot water the first day, but that was fixed quickly the next morning (even though it was a holiday weekend). The happy hour by the pool each afternoon was fun, and a free 4th of July BBQ was provided. The deluxe rooms are very small (really just room for a bed and a dresser). Also, it's a bit of a walk from Duval. It wouldn't be a problem under normal circumstances, but in July it made for a hot, sticky end to the evening. The grounds are beautiful. Truly an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kcolaluca
Reviews.Content: I was at the Eden House for 8 days and it is great! I love the pool, the decorations, the signs, the ambiance. The landscaping is great and it makes you feel like you're on a tropical island somewhere. The staff is very sweet and helpful, and fun to chat with! The rooms are just the size that you need for your vacation - we were only in the room to sleep anyway. I cannot wait to stay there again, I honestly can't imagine staying anywhere else. Mike Eden, the owner, is awesome, and can recommend some great things to do on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Always great visits”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrav-7
Reviews.Content: This past trip was my husband and my fifth visit to the Eden House. We have also stayed at the Island City House, Santa Maria Suites, and rented on Key West, but we always seem to keep coming back to the Eden House (though the mentioned places were lovely as well). We have stayed in the loft deluxe four times and this past time went for an apartment. I really liked having the (very basic) kitchen in the apartment for a longer stay. The Eden House has a funky vibe that some may not like, but we love. There is always incense burning and hammocks to be had, and the focus is on relaxation and/or alcohol, depending on the time of day. The low-end rooms are rather basic (like hostel type rooms, but hey, they are cheap and clean!), so if you enjoy spending a lot of time in your room relaxing, I recommend upgrading to a deluxe or apartment room. The staff is (usually) lovely, and the owner, Mike, is cool. Everyone is always happy to help you. The residential setting is great, and the hotel rents bikes with big comfy seats - this is a must for getting around KW. You do not need a scooter or a golf cart, KW is completely flat so even the most out of shape will never be out of breath. We also highly recommend Azur, the restaurant next door, for any meal but especially for breakfast. Get a coupon for 20% off at the front desk. Great fresh Med-inspired options and lots of cool things (like variations on eggs benedict) that you have never seen before and should try. So those are most of the pros, now for the cons. The beds suck. Mike, if you are reading this, PLEASE get new beds. The existing ones are way too hard (well, some of you may like that, but we, and the people we have spoken with about it, don't). This is not a deal breaker for us as we love the place otherwise. The pool area can fill up with people quickly (it prob isn't big enough). Every hotel has its own culture, and a lot of people who stay at EH seem to hang out by the pool all day, or at least reserve chairs all day. Awesome if you like that, but not the greatest when you are coming back from other things and want do jump in the pool. We go to Fort Zach to swim mostly. And it has gotten a little pricey for what you get lately. Look for specials (like the one I am seeing above from Tripadvisor!) to help keep the cost down. Overall, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We stay at the Eden House every time we are in Key West”
Reviews.Author: clemail2389
Reviews.Content: The staff is top notch. The common areas are well maintained. It's several blocks off Duval St. and in a quiet neighborhood. The only downside is that the rooms are small for the price. We upgraded and it was well worth it. We went just to relax and hung out by the pool and in the hammocks and porch swing on the premises. They also get two thumbs up for their "green" efforts...recycling, water conservation, etc. Awesome place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMonet
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location; staff was hospitable and kind. Character of hotel enhanced the visit to this beautiful little community.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the Key West”
Reviews.Author: lisamarievda
Reviews.Content: The Eden House was amazing. It is perfectly situated within walking distance of everything you would want to do but is still tucked away on a quiet street so you can get away from it all and relax. The pool area is beautiful and we loved the hammocks and patio swings. The staff is very helpful and attentive. I don't think there is any other place I would rather stay in Key West

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: annieski327
Reviews.Content: May 2010 was my 2nd stay at the Eden House (the first May 2008) and in two years when I go to KW again, I'll be staying at the Eden House. I love the Eden House because of it's location, value, and atmosphere. I believe it's 6 blocks from Duval and 4-5 from the wharf. So very close to all the main attractions yet quiet when you need to get some shut eye. I personally am a huge fan of renting a bike during my stay and riding where I want to go. You can rent from Eden House if you desire. You can also walk - I just prefer a bike. The room I was in this past time was a private room - no tv, fridge, microwave and had a double bed. A friend did stay with me so it was a little cozy, but the price was right. It's amazing how much some of the hotels cost down there. One thing to be aware of is the shower in the private rooms is in the bedroom part. I'm sure this would be fine for couples, but a little awkward for friends. The room had plenty of space for our things too. There was a desk with shelves above and also a bookcase with I think 5 shelves on it. We did spend one day in the pool - they provide towels and floaties/noodles if you need them. They have happy hour every day and I believe this includes beer and I know there is vodka too. Outside of happy hour you can purchase beer for $1. Pretty cheap for KW! Our rooms were clean and staff was pleasant. Even ran into one of the girls down at Finnegans Wake (Irish Bar just 2 blocks down - excellent pizza) and talked to her for a bit. There isn't continental breakfast, but the Azur restaurant is right next door. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and can't wait to come back in a couple years.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem with relaxing tasteful setting for small money”
Reviews.Author: dmackey80
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. My Fiancee and I booked this as guests who were attending a weekend in KW. We chose Eden House based on the very strong reviews on trip advisor (some of the highest I've seen for accommodations anywhere) combined with the very good entry price. I would have given it 5 stars but there are a few minor issues that prevented that. There is no 4.5 so it gets a 4 from me. This was the first time we've stayed at a small intimate "bed and breakfast" (for lack of a better term) type place rather than a larger name larger hotel. Upon arrival we were greatly by friendly and helpful woman at the front desk who offered us a free drink (beer or soda) which we came back for after we got settled. The woman who greeted us and checked us in took us for a brief tour and showed us some of the amenities which included: free use of assorted sunscreens, a spring water cooler on the porch that we used frequently, the wonderful pool, hot tub, hammock area, and every day from 4-5pm "happy hour" with free self serve mixed drinks by the pool. On Fri and Sat this included live music entertainment. Beers were available for purchase for $1. Wow!
