Another highlight was that they rent bikes right there, we paid $10 for 12 hour rental and got around key west this way. They also rented for 24 hours or longer. The setting was beautiful with little fountains, lots of plants and flowers, lots of shady areas to get out of the sun, and tons of porch chairs, swings, hammocks and other areas to kick back and relax. The guests were friendly and communed around the pool each day. All of this with a great price means a trade off, at least on the room we booked which was very small, even with with a double bed. No closet or storage for furniture other than hangers and hooks on the wall, plus some good shelving. No alarm clocks or phone in the room. None of these things mattered for our purpose and we knew this coming in, so no surprise. Only downside was it could be a little loud occasionally (since we were right at the pool, and we had to get new sheets as the ones they put on for day 2 were dirty. The hotel has different room price points and some are larger with more amenities and even include kitchenette areas. If we go back to Key West this is where we'll stay, we loved it. Do not consider anything else without at least looking into this place.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: desmondo84
Reviews.Content: Positives: - clean - nice gardens/pool with hamocks to chill out in - great coffee! - good location: nice quiet area, not too far from the main sights. Negatives - rooms are pretty small with no wardrobe and VERY little storage space - communal area is very close to the rooms, hence, it can be a bit noisy - so if you're after a relaxing experience this may not be it - limited parking - we had to park a block away which isn't the end of the world but a bit of a pain. overall, not a bad place by any means and many people will really like it but not my cup of tea (althought the coffee is good... )

Reviews.Title: “A real piece of paradise.”
Reviews.Author: CherryDaiquiri
Reviews.Content: Eden House is more beautiful tahn the pictures. The room was large and clean, with great amenities, eg, a large fridge. Our room also had a swing outside and it's own small patio area. The shower was brilliant. The service was good and personal - they seemed to have thought of everything, even providing sun cream for by the pool. Unfortuneatly we missed happy hour, but that seemed like a nice touch too. Eden House seems quite environmentally concerned, which was good to see. We only had one night here, but we wish we'd stayed for a second so we could have enjoyed the peaceful surroundings of Eden House more. I loved the pool, and the pool toilet was pretty perfect! Eden House is not just a great base to explore Key West, but worth going to as a destination itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but five stars???”
Reviews.Author: gfak
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say that I am somewhat surprised by the number of 5-star reviews. I personally believe 4 stars is more than enough in most cases, and five should be reserved for only THE best combination of quality and value. I would give EH about a 3.8 score. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained, the staff were all friendly, and the location is fine. On the downside would be the cost as I do not feel it is fully justified. Then again I donâ€™t own anything in Key West, so I donâ€™t know what it costs to own/maintain a place there. Full details are below. The Room The room we had, 503, was fine. Nothing wrong with it in any way, but nothing I would drool over either. I saw some of the other rooms that other users have described, and ours was certainly an improvement over those. It was a 2nd floor unit, and it had a loft bedroom. It has a dorm-fridge, full-size coffee maker, micro, toaster, and ice-mixer, all located around a small sink. It had a minimal number of utensils, and the basic dinnerware. It also had an LCD TV with expanded cable (a few pay channels), a pull-out couch (which according to a sign had an inflatable mattressâ€¦pump in the closet), and a small patio that overlooked the pool area. A spiral staircase led to the loft, which had a single queen bed. WiFi was included. A little slow but worked fine. The bathroom was fine, with an ample shower. We had no problems with hot water in the shower, but I couldnâ€™t get hot water in the bath sink unless I ran it a long time. Could be I was just doing it wrongâ€¦I found the control confusing. The overall room size was fine. There wasnâ€™t actually any coffee table, which added to the open feel, but some might not appreciate the inability to â€œput your feet upâ€�. The deck is very small, so only 2 people max. The railings seem to be built to very strict safety standards (which is probably required for Key West partyers!), so itâ€™s not actually easy to sit and â€œlook outâ€� as much of the view is blocked by railings and balusters. Still, itâ€™s very nice. I see some have complained about the beds. I actually slept fine, which is rare. We have a king at home, and I move a lot, so for me to stay still in a hotel bed is a minor miracle. The bed was very firm however, so hopefully you like it that way. Of course the booze consumption could have contributed to my sleeping like a baby. I was not disturbed by noise. It *is* Key West, so you will get the occasional Harley going by, or a delivery truck. The A/C isnâ€™t central, so you get the â€˜advantageâ€™ of constant humming noise that, for me, helps to negate other outside noise. But again, my blood-alcohol level may have contributed to my ignorance of external noise. I certainly did not find the noise from other guests to be an issue. Smoking Weâ€™re convinced that Key West is a smokerâ€™s paradise. It seems to be the local pastime. So when we come here we just expect it. The problem with a place like EH is that the overall layout pretty much means that if one person smokes, we all smoke. Thereâ€™s just nowhere for the smoke to goâ€¦it tends to drift around and linger. It was a game at firstâ€¦weâ€™d smell the smoke and think someone was right below us, but then weâ€™d realize they were across the way. It didnâ€™t seem to matter where they were. Itâ€™s the ironic twist of having non-smoking rooms â€“ once you force smokers outside, then we all partake. So, itâ€™s just a reality. It wasnâ€™t bad, just realize that you wonâ€™t necessarily escape it. Then again if youâ€™re a smoker, youâ€™ll do just fine. The Staff Never met Mike, at least not that I recall. We mostly dealt with the front-desk staff, and they were fine. They always seemed to be busy, so itâ€™s good to see them keep a smile on their face amidst the constant onslaught. I give them high remarks for thisâ€¦had anyone been less than friendly, it would have immediately made the place seem to be more expensive than it was worth, if you understand what I mean. But that was not the case at all. Everyone was very friendly, very helpful, and very patient. Kudos. The Location We have stayed at the lower end of Duval before, and the long walk to the north end can be a slog sometimes. But even though EH is somewhat far away as well, you can very quickly get to the waterfront just a couple blocks to the north. Once there we found the walk to downtown to be nothingâ€¦it just seemed to go by faster. So I think location is fine. It gave us plenty of opportunity to explore side streets at night. We did run into some local guys now and then who looked like they have seen the inside of a few too many bottles, but they were always fine. Loved this one guyâ€¦said hi to him and asked how he was doingâ€¦he just smiled and said â€˜Casualâ€� in a slow drawl. We plan to steal this response for our own use! Pool and Grounds The pool was fine. Only time it was ever crowded was at happy hour, which we never took advantage of anyway. There is also a Jacuzzi. Way too hot for us to use that puppy, but plenty of other people hopped in. Some reviewers complained of the overall size of the pool area, and that there were not enough lounge chairs. Guess I could see this as an issue, but it never seemed to be a problem while we were there. The grounds were beautiful. Two fish ponds, plenty of plants, etc. People were fascinated by a family of woodpeckers in one of the treesâ€¦bet a few hummingbird feeders would be well received. Dining Thereâ€™s no on-site restaurant per-se. Azur is a property on the grounds that does breakfast, lunch, and dinner, but it is leased by a separate group. We had breakfast and dinner. There was a 20% off discount card in the lobby of EH we used for breakfast (itâ€™s also good for lunch, but not dinner). All our meals were excellent. Expect dinner to be pricey but worth it. The only hassle was they sat a couple right next to us when the place wasnâ€™t even fullâ€¦if you guys read this, donâ€™t EVER do that!!! Misc The crowd was mostly older. I would not consider this a place for children. The â€˜freeâ€™ beer at check in is a nice marketing ploy, but for the cost of our stay it certainly was not free of course, and I would have preferred a very chilled Sam Adams (maybe next time?). And of course they do have the free happy hour. I canâ€™t vouch for this. I didnâ€™t hear anyone complaining, but I am sure thereâ€™s no top shelf stuff involved. They have reasonable bike rentals right there on the property. They offer free coffee and stuff in the lobby, and I *think* itâ€™s there all the time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, as always”
Reviews.Author: crochetcpa
Reviews.Content: We are repeat travelers to the Eden House...and it never fails to amaze us how happy we are each and every time with our stay there. Mike and his staff were outstanding, as usual, especially Pasha and the front desk staff. Any question or concern is always dealt with in a professional manner and with a smile. We brought "newbies" with us this year, and they are sure to be repeat customers!! We'll be back next April, if not before...and we'll bring the cookies with us!!! Thanks Mike and everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, with character to spare.”
Reviews.Author: boilermaker66
Reviews.Content: I spent some time on the internet looking for a hotel in Key West that would fit our budget and would be convenient to to downtown Key West. I selected Eden House because of its excellent reviews. I had no expectations when we arrived, other than a bed to sleep in and a shower, but we were absolutely charmed from the moment we met Jena at the front desk and she showed us around. More like a cozy inn than a hotel, Eden House proved to be exactly the kind of intimate, fun, and comfortable place that my wife and I hope for when we travel. Our room was small but not claustrophobic, and it was clean and quiet, with a great shower. Plus, we had our own front porch swing! The pool and the poolside happy hour were exactly right after our drive from Miami, and we finished up later with the hot tub before turning in for the night. We liked the privacy of the pool area, surrounded by trees and the hotel buildings with everything connected by wooden decks. Hammocks are everywhere! We made friends with a sweet little cat, Ms. Poolie, who was happy to swing with us on our porch. We parked the car for the duration and, as we enjoy doing, we walked everywhere. Our only regret is that we didn't plan to stay longer - but now that we know about this charming hostelry, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House Experience”
Reviews.Author: dbwhitehouse
Reviews.Content: I will admit that this was not my first visit to the Eden House but it was my best. I've been down 22 times over the last 19 years and every year Mike and his staff continue to amaze. The place is clean and quite, the staff are fantastic and Mike is still crazy after all of these years.........see you next year Bubba

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: CayoP
Reviews.Content: Third time here, central location, quiet for KW. easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel and I am so glad we found it!”
Reviews.Author: Ron_WestSussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a the best place to stay in Key West. Mike the owner is a great host and his staff reflect his laid back but helpful approach to life. Nothing seemed to much trouble. The hotel also has its own restaurant next door. We went for breakfast each day and the food was great, the yellow tail snapper with poached eggs should not be missed. We stayed for our 40th Wedding Anniversary and as soon as they knew, a complimentary bottle of Champagne and two glasses were left in our room the next day. The free Happy Hour is a great idea as it gives all the guests and chance to meet and being English it gave us a chance to meet our American counterparts and swap stories. On our anniversary we were meeting our friends for a night on the town to celebrate and not only did Mike recommend and book a great restaurant for us, overlooking the Marina, but invited our friends up for the afternoon for a swim and happy hour. My wife and I both agree that this was one of our GREAT holidays and our stay at the Eden House was the highlight. What more can I say but thanks to all at the Eden House for making our holiday one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an "Eden" in Key West”
Reviews.Author: TwoFromIowa
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West & our stay at Eden House was great! We chose a "large deluxe" room. It was spacious with a queen size bed, mini fridge, microwave and very nice bathroom with large shower. Right outside the front door was "our own" porch swing! There is a gorgeous pool & jacuzzi area. And a tranquil spot with 3 large hammocks. Every afternoon there is a self service happy hour at the pool area. The public areas are open 24 hours, but quiet time starts at 10PM and it was definitely quiet. The location was perfect - a quick 10-15 min walk to Duval St or the waterfront, but once you stepped on the property, you felt a million miles away from the action. We are hoping to return to Key West JUST to stay at Eden House again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Eldudarino
Reviews.Content: Have been here two years row and we absolutely love it. We went down in December 09 to get married and the weather was not good for a beach side wedding so the day of the event we ask to move it to the pool area. They were more than happy to have it there and it could not have worked out better. This just us one example of how great the service is here. The also have complimentry happy hour everyday and free coffee and tea all day long. Each room is unique and the come in all sizes. The Eden House is just a few blocks from Duval st so when you want some quiet it is just a short walk back. The pool and hot tub are open all day and night and are now solar powered. Every other guest we have meet has been very cool with great attitudes. The Azur is a great place for breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Slice of Heavenly Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JFYDumfries_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eden House for 6 nights. At check-in, Mike was very helpful, showed us the property and amenities, and explained the house rules. Our room was small, but very clean, with a queen sized bed. No drawers available for clothing, but open shelves instead. I prefer to put things in drawers to keep it looking more tidy, but this system worked. We had windows that opened, an air conditioner and ceiling fan. No heat, but with any luck in Key West, that won't be needed anyway. The hotel is in a flight path for airplanes arriving at the airport. With the windows closed, the planes could not be heard. The bathroom was larger than I'd anticipated. I'd expected a tiny shower, but it was decently sized. It would have been nice to have a shelf in the bathroom large enough to hold personal care items. Only one very small shelf was mounted and that was where they provided tissues and cups. There was a separate trash can for recyclables, which I was glad to see and used appropriately. Until I saw housekeeping co-mingle trash from that can and the regular can one day! Oops, nice thought, but obviously not practical from the housekeeper's point of view. We did reuse towels and sheets throughout the stay, but those that we wanted replaced were. On the property were many comfortable verandas, with porch swings, chairs and tables. A secluded area in back had hammocks, although I found them to be hung a bit too low. The pool was small, sparkling and pristine. There was a hot tub, but we didn't use it. WiFi is available, but limited in area. We couldn't access from our room, but could from the library area and a back veranda. Every afternoon, the hotel provided a happy hour by the pool with music, drinks and a light snack. There is a small gift shop. Bicycles are available to rent and will be discounted if you rent one for multiple days. We asked the desk to reserve tickets for us for a cruise, and they were happy to oblige. Eden House is in the heart of Old Town Key West, and thus very peaceful. It's easy to get to the more crowded and raucous parts of town (walking, biking, cabs, pedicabs), but I appreciated being able to get away from the noise and into the quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LARRYANDSALLY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying a few days at The Eden House in Key West recently. The staff was very friendly and helpful - our first room was very small and when we complained to the front office staff about it they upgraded us to a bigger room with no hassle. We were impressed with the detail given to all aspects of the hotel - the grounds are landscaped beautifully - the rooms are tastefully decorated and very clean and a calming atmosphere prevails throughout . We look forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced 'motel' with Prison-cell sized rooms: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!”
Reviews.Author: Ellpeas
Reviews.Content: Eden House: if it cost less than $100 a night (as most old, low-grade motels do) - I wouldnt have minded. I've stayed in plenty such places in the past. But the price of this place is ridiculous - unbelieveably bad value for money. We booked 4 nights at Eden House after reading the rave reviews. Total cost came to $979 (inc taxes) so $244.75 a night. Its quite a distance from the pier - a good 15 / 20 min walk but they have free parking. We noticed that the place looked a bit tired at check-in. I dont mind 'kooky' / bohemian but this place just looks run-down. We were shown to a room on the ground floor, just next to the pool and informed that they have 'happy hour' drinks outside our room at 5.30pm. The room doors all open outwards - which goes to show just how tiny the rooms are. The bed (no more than a queen size) was pushed against the wall (pet hate). There was no actual bathroom: just a sink on the wall at the foot of the bed, a toilet in a cupboard and the shower cubicle opened right into the room. No TV / radio. No wardrobes etc. Just a small desk with a rail & some hangers. Bedding was very old and musty. The only window in the room was next to the door and looked out onto the walkway where people were sunbathing and would gather for happy hour so if we wanted any privacy we wouldnt have been able to open the blinds - ever. We complained and were moved to a room upstairs - this room was just as bad. We noticed in the guestbook that the owner would be happy to give a full refund to anyone who didnt want to stay so we cancelled, got our money back and went to The Westin which is right on the pier, gave us a beautiful room 4 times the size of the one at Eden House with white fluffy robes etc - all for $305 a night. The extra $241 was the best money I ever spent - we had a great time. Beware the creative photography on this site and the over-zealous reviews from people I assume to be friends of the owner. Shop around - you'll see that you can get far better value for your hard-earned cash.

Reviews.Title: “Definite repeat customers!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarynDave
Reviews.Content: We heard of the Eden House through friends of ours, and decided to give it a try when we booked our trip to Key West. We are so glad we chose this hotel. Basically everything about the Eden House was perfect - from the heated pool and hot tub, to the "library" (outdoor tree-shaded area with hammocks), to the complimentary happy hour. The hotel was within walking distance of just about everything there is to do in Key West, and out of the way enough where you could just relax in a quiet environment. The staff were very courteous and friendly - Mike Eden even sat down with my girlfriend and I and a map, and circled all of his favorite spots for food, the sunset, and nightlife. We will definitely be coming back to the Eden House. In fact, we may never leave the premises on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Key West”
Reviews.Author: NicoleL3
Reviews.Content: The smaller inside rooms are not as nice and the Loft we stayed in. If you stay there you have to go for the loft. Or one of the rooms on the veranda. All in all it was a great place to stay and the friends I was with made it even better. Drinking in the hammock was so peaceful and fun.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to get back to my favorite vacation spot.”
Reviews.Author: advantage10
Reviews.Content: Eden House is such a great place to stay that it's hard to make yourself leave the property to go anywhere else in Key West. I always love starting my day on the porch with coffee from the lobby, maybe chatting with other guests who are doing the same. Then order breakfast from Azur next door and maybe a swim and relaxing in a hammock for a while in the morning. When I do pull myself away to go explore or to the beach etc, it's close to walk or there are bikes to use and the busy part of town is just a few blocks away. After lunch in town, be sure to get back in time for the free happy hour at 4 by the pool. There are usually lots of friendly guests to mingle with and this trip there was live music too. What a delight. I can't wait to go back. I may go again in March for a long weekend. Many people return often so maybe I will see some of the new friends I have met on my next visit. Oh and did I mention the Jacuzzi in the evening?

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quiet, charming and convenient to many things in Key West”
Reviews.Author: all0verthemap
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. The staff is amazing, nice and knowledgeable. You don't need to plan anything in advance of your trip. They can help you choose what to do and where to go. My room was really comfortable and had a balcony/deck. There is a room for everyone's taste so feel free to call and they will help you select it. Great personalized service. It feels like a B&B although it's not one and it is walking distance to pretty much everything yet in a quiet neighborhood. A great place to relax and get away and still go have fun around Key West. For food, I recommend Azur next door for a fine dining experience. One block away is Help Yourself, a great organic place with delicious quick food.

Reviews.Title: “Mike and crew made this our second home.”
Reviews.Author: Lokila
Reviews.Content: Get a Eden house bike- Park your car and enjoy Key West @ its best.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about Eden House”
Reviews.Author: ctmmd2000
Reviews.Content: From the very first, I felt at home. My room was perfectly comfortable and very clean. The staff were lovely and welcoming. The other guests were very friendly without being overly intrusive. We were given great recommendations for dining, site-seeing and entertainment. The location can't be beat, either - it is within walking distance of just about anything you want to see or do but far enough away that you have peace and quiet at night, when you want it! Overall it was a perfect vacation. I just wish I could go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.......”
Reviews.Author: SUENCHAZ
Reviews.Content: Due to some unforeseen circumstances we ended up staying at the Eden House for 9 days in January. We were very pleased with this choice. We stayed in a large deluxe room equipped with a microwave, flat screen tv, refrigerator and coffee maker. There was a porch swing and chairs right outside our room. The rooms are very basic, but clean. The cleaning people came and went without ever being seen and they are QUICK!!! If fact, the entire property was immaculate. There were always staff members around tidying up/fixing up/painting up the place (without being intrusive). The 24 hr coffee was wonderful. It was nice to sit out on the front porch, petting the cat, while drinking my coffee. The pool area was very nice, clean and had a tropical feeling. The entire staff was very professional and friendly. The free happy hour was a very nice touch. This is a very quiet and calm guest house and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. For others who have complained about the size of the rooms, "you get what you pay for". We've already made our reservations for another stay in March.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go when it is cold...but location is great”
Reviews.Author: frequent_traveler061
Reviews.Content: We unfortunately stayed in Eden House during a cold spell but there was no heat in the rooms! As others described the rooms are small, furnished sparsely (ex: no bureaus), but the grounds are wonderful and clean, and there are several places to find some quiet place. 24 hour coffee and tea is wonderful. The location, in town but several blocks from the hustle and bustle, is excellent. Superb restaurant next door, Azur.

Reviews.Title: “The Garden of Eden is alive and well in the Florida Keys”
Reviews.Author: zephyrAlbuquerqueNM
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a week at the Eden House. If we didn't have children, grandchildren, pets and jobs to return to, we would still be there. I would be on the front porch in the sun petting Cleo the cat, Annie would be sleeping late peacefully. I would be drinking Baby Brand coffee and visiting with the front desk staff or walking the peaceful residential neighborhood. Annie had been there before but it was my first visit, and boy did she pick the perfect spot. Over the age for Medicare, and a world traveler, I have never been so impressed with an entire hotel staff as I am with those you have working there. I hate to single out any individual, but one front desk woman is the one we had most contact with. Her infectious laugh had us all in a positive mood, she directed us to excellent places to eat and visit and how to get there, she did it all. From the pool cleaners to the landscape people, the cleaning staff and the scores of others who work there, everyone was friendly, helpful, and delightful to be around. You have really chosen the right people for the right jobs and they really enjoy their jobs with many working there a decade or longer. An unusual combination. Thank you. I plan to see you all again later this year. I could go on and on but I need to catch up on my sleep. Martha Cushing (--)

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel - tiny and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: HermannDune
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel at all, because of the rooms. They are VERY small, tiny and the furniture and the paint are very old. would not recommend booking a room in this hotel. the rest of the hotel is nice, but the rooms are awful, awful, awful !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: hwwesq
Reviews.Content: A great owner, who mingles with his guests, has a staff which always goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and accommodate you. A truly relaxing place, where the charm of Key West is always felt.

Reviews.Title: “Too small!”
Reviews.Author: KC_Fun_in_the_sun31
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was because we stayed at the beautiful Avalon Bed & Breakfast the night before, but this place was not what we were looking for. It was a bed and that was about it. The bed in our room blocked part of the door to get into room and from that moment I new we should have picked another place. There was no bathroom....a small room with a toilet, a shower that looked like it was previously a closet, and the sink in the middle of the room. Staff at check-in were a little stand offish at first, but warmed up slightly to tell where to go get a good Bloody Mary. If all you need is a bed then maybe, but not for a vacation where you want a little class. Also a little off Duval so not as convenient as some. Woudl go back to key west, but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Darmstadt98
Reviews.Content: We booked a very small but affordable room so we knew in advance that the room would be small. The house itself is very charming and the premises are very nice (the pool, trees, etc.). The room was small but clean and so were the bathrooms. We really enjoyed ourselves at Eden House and would come back. It is indeed a very quick walk to Duval Street (5-7 minutes) so the location ist great. The staff were really nice people and did all to make you feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Adam and Eve Would Have Loved This Eden”
Reviews.Author: jdhdc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at the Eden House. From the moment I arrived and was offered a drink, it was a wonderful experience. The staff was helpful. The surroundings were relaxing. The location was great. Our apartment sized room was spacious, comfortable and clean. I was very pleased. Thanks for the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back Key West with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: photomom89
Reviews.Content: We just got home from spending five nights at Eden House and cannot wait to go back again. We had our three children with us (ages 17, 14 & 8) and the fact that they had as much fun as we did says a lot about this hotel. We were greeted with a cold beer (soft drinks for the kids!) and warm smiles and this attitude continued for our whole visit. We stayed in a deluxe loft room which was large enough for our family and our luggage. There are shelves located throughout the room, which worked perfectly for keeping our "stuff" out of the way. The room was well thought out, and all the ammenities are supplied. The hotel thought of things we might need before we did (such as coffee filters!). There is also coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby 24 hours which our children greatly enjoyed (hot chocolate, that is!). The staff is the secret weapon of this hotel. They all go out of their way to be helpful. For example, when we were trying to rent bikes and the island was running short on children's bikes, they were able to find us the last one available. There was no one who did not greet us with smiles, and this was beyond the front desk crew, this was truly everyone we encountered. I was a bit worried about how our children would be viewed by the other guests but they were treated so kindly and warmly that I got over this worry in a hurry. Our children are well behaved but this is a predominately adult hotel. I realized quickly that this was not going to be an issue. Our kids were able to use the pool, hot tub and wander around the grounds without any worries they were in anyone's way. The location is perfect, walking and or biking distance to every place we wanted to go, we were able to park our car the first day and not use it again until we left. And if you wanted to just hang, you could so by the pool, in the lobby, on the front porch or one of the hammocks around the property. This was exactly what we wanted to do so this vacation was a huge success. Thank you again to everyone, we wil be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccazibbel
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Eden House over Christmas and LOVED it. We had never been to Key West before so of course we were nervous about going over the holidays, but the minute we walked in the door and were handed a free beer we immediately relaxed and were smiling the rest of the time. We stayed in a Deluxe room that had its own porch swing and hammock. Bed was comfortable and room was amazingly clean. It wasn't very big, but we really didn't care since the rest of the place was fabulous. We loved the daily happy hour by the pool where we were able to meet and chat with the other people staying there and the service/staff were not only friendly but willing to help with ANYTHING - directions, reservations, etc. For location, you couldn't beat it if you don't mind being set away from the tourists (which we were aiming for anyway!). Duvall St. and Old Town were only a few blocks away in either direction, but Eden House was far enough from the hubhub that you still get a true taste of the "laid back Keys". We had a Christmas Package that gave us dinner at nearby Azur (which we highly recommend!!!) and a sunset catamaran sail with booze included, so our trip was pretty amazing. Thanks Eden House! We hope to be back soon. The one thing I don't recommend is families with children. Although I'm sure they would still have fun, it is definitely a more adult-friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West - Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: chippy224
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Key West. We spent the entire stay at the Eden House and were so sad to leave. The hotel has so much charm and vintage atmosphere. We felt comfortable and relaxed the entire time. Pros: Fantastic pool, hot tub, and outdoor areas. Beautiful palm trees and landscaping. Exceptionally clean rooms and common areas (I'm the kind of traveler that checks for smudgy fingerprints on light switches - this place passed the test with flying colors), very friendly and accommodating staff (from the front desk to maid service and maintenance), comfy beds, 24/7 coffee and tea in lobby, and the overall atmosphere of "relax and no worries," Vickie - the best front desk person ever, Cleo the cat, happy hour, and the Champagne and snacks in the lobby on Christmas Eve. A home away from home. Advice: Eden House is not for everyone - I believe their web site mentions this. Do your research on the web site to clearly understand what kind of accommodations you are booking... which you should do with any hotel! EH is a charming old hotel and the room sizes reflect that. We stayed in a modern Large Deluxe room for 5 nights and loved it - tile floors, large bathroom, queen bed. Our last night we switched to a Small Deluxe room and there were absolutely no problems with it, but we knew when booking that this was not the type of room we wanted to stay in for a whole week. Hence, we stayed in it for one night only (for cost reasons). Thank you to EH and their staff for making our first vacation at Christmas truly memorable and completely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel with Paradise Atmosphere in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kohlster
Reviews.Content: A repeat stay for us in this piece of paradise in the heart of Key West. The friendliest staff to greet you to ensure a great stay. When we get back to Key West, this is the only place we will stay- a 5 star Garden of Eden. Our friends went with us again and love it as much as we do! Awesome place :)

Reviews.Title: “won't be back”
Reviews.Author: snoobette
Reviews.Content: hotel really pricey for what you get. many other small hotels/b&bs in key west offer more for less. we found 6 in just one afternoon. housekeeping staff very nice; management rude and uncaring

Reviews.Title: “It is Eden”
Reviews.Author: linll
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our 9th November visit to EH. It is such a relaxing place to visit with quiet nooks and crannies to read and relax before the 4pm daily happy hour to make new friends and greet old friends also. Mike is a great host. The staff are great, we are especially fond of the head housekeeper, Pasha, who keeps the place exceptionally clean. Elizabeth has instututed green practices throughout the hotel. We will be back in 2010. There is a room here for every budget. Check out the website, the rooms are very well described and photos alsol.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be going back!”
Reviews.Author: DebiMissouri
Reviews.Content: Waterfalls, koi ponds, pool, jacuzzi, hammocks, picnic tables, swings, sun deck, gazebos, and a porch... you'll spend very little time IN your room, and probably alot of time at the Eden House- particularly for their free daily happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful As Always”
Reviews.Author: nini5
Reviews.Content: Just back from our 9th Annual Visit with friends at the Eden House. It is a November tradition with us. This is a sparkling clean home away from home that is maintained in top notch condition. We have stayed in numerous rooms at all price points, so there is something for everyone if you desire a quiet, peaceful home away from home. the pool area and spa are the best. Quiet spots also with hammocks to chill. Or just sit out on the front porch and watch the world go by. Had breakfast next door (Azurs) which was very good. Remember to get your 20% off coupon from the front desk. Pash is the best housekeeper and trains her staff well. Management is always looking to improve and make the property the best ever. Wonderful, relaxing week around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: edspider
Reviews.Content: This is collection of special rooms meticulously maintained by a collection of caring people. The Eden House is what Key West is all about. It is the perfect location for a Key West vacation. You can walk to Old Town up quiet side streets. The water is near by. If this is your first time in Key West, the staff will tell you what to do and where to eat. The pool gets more sun than most pools. The rooms have many price points which are fair and all great values.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kabloona54
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect. Staff is excellent and VERY guest friendly. This is customer service at its finest. The spa is clean and well maintained and the pool is beautiful. Rooms are extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: ThePr0fess0r
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love this hotel. This is my second time--the first was in 1994, and it's better than ever in 2009. I was travelling alone and the staff was super friendly and helpful, making me feel right at home. It is nice to get a room with a porch and porch swing--you really feel like you're in your own little house. The free happy hour at 4PM is fantastic. Recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: “'PERFECT'”
Reviews.Author: Nellienooo
Reviews.Content: a gorgeous guest house, the grounds are perfect, very well cared for. Mike who owns the house is great for any tips or advice on anything in key west. the rooms are all well maintained we stayed in the room with the hot tub, which is gorgeous, plenty of space their were 4 of us including 2 x 17 yr olds and we had enough space (even a washer and dryer should you need it). happy hour was great just what your ready for after a relaxing day under the palm trees or laying in a hammock. never stayed in a guest house or such a small hotel before so it was nice, more personal, the music round the pool is just right!!! great resteraunts and bars around duvall street, go to sunset bar and just watch the sun set with a nice glass of wine!!! would definatly stay their again!! if you do go you must try the jet ski, took the kids to all the parks in orlando and the high light of the holiday was the jet skis!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: WalesAled
Reviews.Content: I meant to write a review as soon as we returned to Wales because this hotel was so good, but I did not get around to doing it. However we are going back to Key West in November and have just booked the Eden House again so I guess there can be no better recommendation than such a swift return! We liked this place as soon as we went to reception and got really good service, a cold drink and a helpful tour of the hotel with useful advise on local facilities. The setting is brilliant with the rooms, hammocks and loungers set around an inviting pool. We had a small room with toilet and shower, everything was clean and tidy and we walked out onto the verandah overlooking the pool. Next door is Azure where we had superb breakfasts and just a few yards further up the road is Finnegans Wake serving a great selection of beers and food. If you want a big impersonal hotel with rooms to match then this is probably not for you but if you are looking for an intimate hotel that really captures the essence of Key West then look no further. We can't wait to get back to Eden House in November when we will introduce my sister and brother-in-law to this special place.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven...”
Reviews.Author: jessica_1983
Reviews.Content: Eden House really is a little bit of heaven on earth. The gardens are lush, the pool and hot tub wonderful and the rooms spotless. The best hotel I have ever stayed in and cannot wait until we can return again. Key West is a place like no other and having Eden House as a base made our holiday even more special. Full of like minded people who are looking for a relaxing but fun time. The staff are always there to help and have all the information you could need including where to eat, drink and watch the sunset. Thank you to you all for such an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “great value in an expensive place”
Reviews.Author: gribbo78
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great value compared to others in key west. Its about a 5-7 minute walk to duval st. The service is great and they have free drinks between 4-5 each afternoon which always is welcome. The only negative points are , thr rooms dont have any wardrobes and we had to live out of our suitcases. We also asked for an iron and iron board but was only given an iron , we were told they couldn't find the board so we had to iron on our bed. Also the car park was closed whils we were there. The lady on reception was very helpful and directed us to a parking space around the corner. I ended up getting a fine for $35 because I parked the wrong way in the street. All in all it is a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awsome!”
Reviews.Author: deadhead1
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Mike and your staff at the Eden House, everything was splendid. Your website and anniversary special made us choose The Eden House. We celebrated a 50th birthday party and booked 3 different rooms for our party of 8. Each room was just as the website pictures it, no surprises and each room was most accomodating for our needs and very clean and well equipped. We enjoyed your daily happy hour and the party for your 35th anniversary was perfect. We will certainly choose only The Eden House the next time we visit Key West. Next time I will rent one of your bikes on day 1 instead of walking every where and also we will spend more time by your lovely pool area rather than hanging out on Duvall. Thanks again you have a great place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a little peace of heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: tatg
Reviews.Content: as our whole trip in key west, the hotel was fantastic a little comfortable room, a beautiful pool, but the best thing about that hotel is the crew (and heather is an angel, didn't you know that already) the atmosphÃ¨re is quiet and fun altogether a perfect place for a few days in key west, not too close and not too far from the center, and with the bikes you can rent at the reception, you can fully enjoy you trip! (hi from france guys) tatiana and patrick

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up to TripAdvisor Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mile156
Reviews.Content: First trip to key west. Spent a few days at the Eden House. Booked entirely based on trip advisor reviews. Stayed in a second story loft room. Only negative would be I had to keep all the window blinds closed if I wanted privacy, and there were lots, but not an issue for me. Casual hotel, with great desk staff who go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable. I forget their names, but all the ladies were wonderful and informative. I'd book this again if I ever make it back. Did one day snorkeling locally via "Sunny Tours"? at sand key, the dock is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Wanted to see dry tortugas national park and had prebooked a trip on the Yankee Freedom II which was a blast and their dock is in the same spot. I think the FURY vendor had a slightly faster cat, but a lot smaller. If the weather forecast is good, and you're into anything outdoorsy, this is a great trip and the yankee freedom has my vote. The Mel Fisher Maritime Museum was also a good spot if you're into buried treasure and ship wrecks .

Reviews.Title: “Nice environment”
Reviews.Author: Mad-Vce
Reviews.Content: Though the room was small and basic, the hotel environment, the pool and friendliness of staff worths sleepint there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Beautiful, Friendly Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Harley7733
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Eden House twice now and we thoroughly enjoyed it both times. In 2008 we stayed in the Deluxe Conch House room on the lower level (Room 4669). Four of us stayed in this room. There was one bedroom and the living room had a pull-out couch. The living room, kitchen and bathroom were all very spacious. We really liked the private hot tub that was just outside our door! After staying a few days in room 4669 we moved upstairs to the upper level (Room 3639). We thought it would be nice to have separate bedrooms. While this room was nice, we definitely liked the lower room better. The upper room had two separate bedrooms and decent size bathroom, but it did not have a kitchen or a hot tub! And, the wicker furniture in the living room was the most uncomfortable furniture we've ever sat on. Hopefully the furniture has been updated since we were there. In 2009 we stayed in a small deluxe room (# 304). This room was small, but it did have a private bath, a refrigerator an a tv. There isn't a dresser or much room to store the suitcases, but we didn't mind because the room was very clean. There was a swing outside our door and hammocks near by. The Eden House has a nice pool area, an upper sun deck and a complimentary "Happy Hour". The staff is so friendly and they really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. A complimentary beverage (beer!) was given to us when we checked in. They took the time to give us a quick tour of the property too. I can't say enough about this place. It's a great place to stay if you want to be away from Duvall Street (to avoid the noise), but yet close enough to walk or bike there when you want to enjoy the fun! I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends and I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELERSNewEngland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful & quiet accomodations; waterfall; koi ponds; hammock outside our room; upon check-in the staff gave us a full tour of the facility and served us w/a complimentary beverage (nice touch); w/in 4 blocks of Duval Street; bike rentals on site; binder in our room w/write ups of great places to eat; would definitly stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is the best!”
Reviews.Author: PK777
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from 4 days in KW. It was our first time down and to be honest I wasnt sure about booking a place that didnt have an ocean view or even beach near by. But just from the website I could tell this place was something special and it was! We stayed in a small deluxe room. It was small and we shared a bathroom with the room next to ours. None of that was a problem. The cozy room was very comfortable and perfect for us. Oh yeah, the room rate was pretty good as well. The grounds were very well kept, lots of plants, hammocks and waterfalls. The entire place was quiet and relaxing. We never saw kids there the entire time (no we're not kid haters but sometimes you just need the quiet :). The free happy hour each day at the pool was the perfect way to get ready for an evening on Duval street. If you are someone who only travels luxury first class, I'm sure there are many other high priced hotels around for you. But if you are looking for a place with lots of character where you really feel at home, you owe it to yourself to check this place out www.edenhouse.com.

Reviews.Title: “Suggestions for a great Key West trip”
Reviews.Author: PK777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from KW and had a fantastic time. Here are some highlights that I would recommend to anyone planning a visit there. Transportation: We flew in to Ft. Lauderdale which for us was much cheaper than Miami and really not that much farther away. We rented a car and drove 2 half hours to Islamorada for the night (we had a later flight). The Hampton was fine but a bit pricey and had I know how much better KW is, I probably would have finished the 4 hr drive and gone straight there. As far as the drive goes, it was neat, but not something I'd want to do more than once. We spoke to a local who suggested we fly to Ft. Myers and take a boat to KW.. no idea how much that would cost. Once we got to KW, we parked the car and didnt use it again until it was time to leave. Where to stay: We stayed at Eden House which was entirely different than the type of place we're used to staying in Florida. There was no view of the water and no beach close by. The room was small and we even shared a bathroom with the people next door! Some would view these a negatives but we would not have changed a thing. The people were incredibly nice, the other guests were adults, lots of quiet relaxation at the pool. Oh yes and the free happy hour each day is a perfect way to get ready for Duval in the evening. Eden House is amazing... check out their website edenhouse.com and do your self a favor and stay there! Things to do: We really enjoyed riding bikes all around KW. We rented them from the hotel. Most everything is just minutes away. We actually rode the entire loop around KW in about an hour and a half. Take full advantage of the quality and variety of food available. The best breakfast we had was at Blue Heaven - great food and very cool atmosphere. Same goes for lunch at B.O.'s by the marina. It's a toss up between a burger or fish sandwich. We ussually got both and split. The beer is the coldest! For dinner, you can't really go wrong. Do a search on KW dining and take your pick. Some great seafood! We took the day trip to the Dry Tortugas. It was pricey, I think around $300 for both of us plus another $40 for a tip at the end. It was totally worth it. The fort was cool, beach was nice, and snorkeling was awesome. The crew were great and food was very good. It's a full 8 hour day. Nighlife: Mallory square around 7:30pm kicks off the sunset festival. It packs a good crowd on the weekend. Check out the crazy cat guy and get a mojito from the the drink cart at the far end of the walk. At least one night go up to the top floor of the Laconcha hotel on Duval. This is really the best view of the sunset. They have a bar so go early to get a drink and a seat. We always cut through the Starbucks to get to the elevator, I'm sure there's a more direct route. You will have no trouble finding cool bars to hang out in on Duval. If you want to get off Duval, check out Louie's Backyard. They have a neat bar looking out over the water. We didnt eat there but the food looked good. As far as the beaches go.. check out Higgs or Smathers. When we were there, big dump trucks were pouring on lots of new sand (beaches are man made). There is a large concrete pier here as well. The water was pretty clear but some seaweed. We didnt spend much time around the beach but it didnt look too bad. The other beach areas are pretty small and not great for swimming. We stayed 4 nights which was ok but we were not ready to go. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value! We wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: kennaleigh
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly! The free happy hour was trouble but we loved it! We stayed in the semi-private room where you share a bathroom with another room. We never once heard our neighbors use the bathroom so it felt like a private room. It was by far the cheapest room in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Just one word...wow”
Reviews.Author: GlassFrog
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Eden House. I went on vacation to relax, have fun, and work on my writings. It was a perfect place for all three. I relaxed in the pool, had fun on the island, and finished my latest writing, one that had been in my mind for two years. The hotel is a perfect place to bring art to your vacation. The ladies up at the front desk are real sweathearts and they were always so friendly and so helpful, and knew all the right places to go. Approach is at least 50% of the outcome in life, treat the ladies nicely, and they will make your stay wonderful. Regardless, treat the ladies nicely. The hotel is really peacefull at night and I got the best rest I've ever gotten at a hotel. The pool is great, it is all great. You may even meet the neighbor from across the street, Maggie, who came over to use the soda machine one night as I was talking with nice local people in the small front lobby, and was so incredibly friendly. Once you park it is in a very nice location for whatever you want, yet not so close to the busy streets like Duval to keep you up at night. Don't fret with a car just rent one of the bikes, beach cruisers, outside and you will have an open passport to the island. I really could type on and on but I think I have made my point. This hotel, with its romantic feel and peaceful and qaint nights, is a pleasure. No need to look further, you would not regret a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: Astephens
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 8 day vacation at the Eden House. This is our 4th trip to Key West and everyone of them we have stayed at the Eden House. We can't get enough of it. We totally love it and hated to leave. Our room was great - we stayed in 403 and the staff as always, is great. They always have wonderful recommendations for where to eat and what to do. They are very accomodating and make you feel at home. Thank you guys for making it our best trip yet. We can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Unmissable and quirky, with great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidGodf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, in one of the "large deluxe" rooms. Just about everything was perfect, the rooms are great and much more charming/individual than what you would experience at a chain hotel. The hotel is small enough that it doesn't feel crowded, the pool and jacuzzi are nice, and free drinks at happy hour every day is a great idea!! We had driven down from Miami, and I was worried that we might not be able to park. Fortunately we were, but there is limited parking (as stated on their website) - now I realise that the hotel is really only ten minutes walk to many of the places we wanted to go to, in future I would avoid bringing a car and find a different way to get down to Key West. I really can't recommend the hotel highly enough...the place is run with a friendly attitude and the management and staff both seem to know what real customer service is - nothing was too much trouble. On check-in we were offered a drink, and then given a tour of the property. The front desk staff were really great and only too happy to book restaurants and activities for us. Free wi-fi was also available. In summary, we will definitely be returning at some point. Don't bother spending your money at the bigger / more well known chains in Key West, the Eden House is streets ahead in terms of value for money, quality of accommodation, and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet place to stay in KW with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: enigmuh0
Reviews.Content: Eden House is a lovely place to stay. Quiet, with nice amenities like a swimming pool, Jacuzzi, plentiful greenery and a calm, cheery, and helpful staff, Eden House exceeded my expectations for quiet affordable lodging in Key West. I would both recommend Eden House and stay there again if traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heart beat!!!”
Reviews.Author: needwarmweather
Reviews.Content: So many nice things to say about Eden House, I don't really know where to begin!! We stayed here once before, and were looking forward to coming back, this time for a longer stay. The location is wonderful, walking distance from most things, and bikes to rent if you want to go a little bit farther! The staff is SUPER helpful, from keeping things clean to recommending great restaurants and tours (and they'll even call and book things for you!). So many relaxation options for those who just want to lounge around (and for a pregnant girl, that was top on my list!!!), from chairs poolside to swings and hammocks, many options to just take it easy. They really try their best to take care of you. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: purljamber
Reviews.Content: A beautiful property in a great location within walking distance from everything you need to get to. It was pretty expensive, but surprisingly the least expensive I could find in the area. Our room (the cheapest) was very small and didn't even include a TV (pretty lame), and at times was kind of loud because it faced the pool area. The front desk staff didn't have recommendations or tips for restaurants or things to do, which was a little frustrating. However, I loved that they were eco-friendly, their website had a ton of tips for visitors, they had a house cat, and they had a daily happy hour and 24/7 free coffee in the lobby. And the grounds and pool area were practically a vacation themselves.

Reviews.Title: “So nice that there's a part fo me that doesn't want everyone knowing...”
Reviews.Author: mnamna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in an apartment overlooking the pool and hot tub area. Beautiful vantage point and a great room overall for a long stay. The staff is wonderful, always ready to help and very friendly. The grounds are beautifully kept and provide a very romantic setting. I don't recommend bringing children really, though. Breakfast at Azur is terrific and you can get a coupon from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “If you weren't relaxed, your weren't at the Eden House.”
Reviews.Author: jackanddawn
Reviews.Content: I specifically e-mailed EH after we got home this time because the mattress we had last > week was so awesome, we'd like to buy the same one for our home. However, > there is WAY MUCH MORE to the EH than the mattresses! We have been coming > to EH since 1996 and feel it is our home-away-from-home. The EH is a very > cool place. You really should go there to make your own review.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the favorable comments”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: I can't relate to any (of the very few) complaints that I can relate to. It was far nicer than I expected & I am sorry we did not stay longer. The price is a little stiff but it is Key West & bargains are not to be found. The prices here are on the low end of the market. Parking is tight & if a lot of people bring cars the lot will be full. Look out on the street! Most spots are marked in old, faded, barely visible paint on the pavement "residential only." It would cost about $20 to repaint them such as to be seen but it would eliminate the $35 parking violation fines. The City appears to have made the obvious economic decision. Before you go out to eat stop by the front desk. They have coupons for most of the better places. We loved the Cafe Sole, just a little over a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Unique/modern - yet old fashion flavor”
Reviews.Author: TheDeltaDog
Reviews.Content: Loved the porch swing - a romantic touch - don't park on the street - you'll get a ticket. Enjoy the walk to downtown - just a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel With The Worst Mattresses I Have Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: CozysTraveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but I just couldn't sleep because the mattress was the worst I have seen in a hotel, motel, bed and breakfast place; and I payed $180 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: zebstriped
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Key West four times previously, but since this was the wedding/honeymoon we decided to upgrade our lodgings. I booked Eden House solely on the reviews here at TripAdvisor, carefully reading the bad reviews as well as the good. We were not disappointed! We booked deluxe room (401) with a porch swing and found it was on the first floor right in front the jacuzzi and pool. (Initially I didn't like the first floor location, but I thoroughly enjoyed being so close to the action.) The staff also surprised us with champagne and glasses, I guess I let it slip we were getting married when I made my reservation. Very thoughtful staff here! The grounds are beautiful, and with hammocks all around, there are plenty of quiet places to nap, read or even work if you had to bring it. I also enjoyed hanging out with resident cat, Lobby, on the front porch. We even decided to stay another night and the front desk was able to keep us in the same room. I'm positive we will be back to celebrate our anniversary, and I cannot even fathom staying anywhere else. The Eden House truly is paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: adventuring3
Reviews.Content: My stay at Eden House was thoroughly enjoyable. The hotel grounds are beautiful - lovely trees and plants. The pool is great. The rooms are very nice. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Key West

Reviews.Title: “Problem CORRECTED - FABULOUS 1st Floor Room - Breeze & Swings”
Reviews.Author: Professorshours
Reviews.Content: We love TripAdvisor! We even love Hoteliers who READ TripAdvisor and respond to client concerns!!! I have begun to use TravelAdvisor the past year to find wonderful restaurants, local haunts, and ESPECIALLY for searching out great hotels by reputation. We were very unhappy with the tiny size of our room at Eden - we kept bumping into each other. Fine for me when I was a college kid, but not for a middle-aged, young at heart gal traveling with a college child. Nonetheless, when we returned from lunch Sunday afternoon, Jenna had left us a message apologizing and offered us a lovely room, with a fabulous breeze, a large (yes LARGE) porch and swing on the first floor. Dave, very kindly, accompanied me to help us pack and move to the better room. While it's sad we weren't offered this the first night - we'll gladly take the offer extended. There was no ROH upgrade charge, and for the inconvenience, Jenna gave us Signature Plush towels, a bottle of champagne and ROH. This is hotelier treatment reminiscent of the Ritz Carlton before Marriott ownership! We are now sad to leave this lovely, shaded spot - there are two hammocks in the trees right outside our porch as well. The Pool (still tiny), and a raised Southern-style gazebo with more cushioned swings are just around the corner. A lovey room - be sure to pay the extra and avoid the shared rooms - ask for the rooms with Traveler Photos along 116-114... For Brunch, we'd recommend you avoid Pepe's, and head for the 50's throwback, further up on Caroline Street, "Harry's".

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Key West”
Reviews.Author: MIwreckdiver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I set a trip for 5 days to celebrate my 40th birthday because I am not a suprise party type person. My wife snuck behind my back and sent a boxful of decorations ahead of us for our room. Jenna was great at predecorating room 301 for my suprise. When we were planning our trip I ran across the Eden house website and after reading through the entire thing I knew this would be our place to stay in KW. The check in starts you in the island mood with the offer of a cold cocktail. The well kept grounds were a relaxing home away from home after exploring oldtown all day. The daily happy hour was such a blast it had us rushing back from our activities every afternoon just so we could get the free cheap booze and great company. The 10 to 15 minute walk to Duval was just enough to justify the deserts we had with dinner every night but far enough away from the spring break party crowd that we could get restful relaxing downtime. In short, we've found a new favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: margie4
Reviews.Content: Eden House was everything we were hoping for and more. Comfy tropical ambience, gorgeous pool/spa area, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff, lovely rooms. We also appreciate the socially/environmentally conscious approach to business. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Herdfan_9
Reviews.Content: We spent our anniversary at the Eden House to get away from the weather in Kentucky. This place is surreal. Just a few blocks from the wildness Duval Street and the Marina was complete tranquility. The room was great, the complimentary happy hour was a fantastic time to mingle with other guests, and the staff were all accomodating. I would not hesitate to stay at Eden House again.

Reviews.Title: “Overated, overpriced?”
Reviews.Author: LitchfieldLucy
Reviews.Content: We were here for the US President's week. First we will state the positive: The happy hour is lacking as one would typically expect in a "Guest House", but in their favorite it was dead on with their description on their website along with the free drink at check in. Although the compound itself is beautiful.. pool, gazebo, hot tub, etc. It is just too small to accomodate the number of rooms. I know this is not a management problem, but you cannot get in or around the pool in the afternoon into the evening. The chaise loungers are all taken early in the day. There is just not enough space for all guests.(also true with parking, not enough spots for all the guests). (And don't be fooled by Mike's response, most boutique hotels, guest houses, etc accomodate each and every guest with parking on Key West, my husband and I have stayed at nearly 90% of them thus far). The week we were there it was so filled with cigarette smoke in the back compound the smoke was actually lingering under the trees and balcony canopies. Besides the smoke, the stench coming from the adjoining restaurant was nothing short of horrible. During our stay, 2 rooms checked out early due partially to this smell and partially to tiny dirty rooms. If you're paying 99bucks a night, not as big as a deal, but this place is very high priced. The street noise is constant and after speaking with other guests during our stay, you can pretty much hear it throughout the night no matter what room you are in. Now, being my husband and I own property on Key West and are down here every 6 weeks, we do have to STRONGLY disagree when personnel told us......(every place in Key West is very noisy due to the streets being so small) eh??? Onto the rooms, the are EXTREMELY small (again, same special person told us "all rooms on Key West are small" I am now thinking this person has probably never been out of the Eden House). Rooms were dirty...housekeeping did come each and every day, but I have no idea what they cleaned in our room (and they are some rude people). The sink area was filthy as was the floor, not dirty, just plain filthy. We have our own test to check to see if housekeeping actually cleaned the bathroom, low and behold, they did not clean thoroughly our entire stay. I know Mike try's his hardest to have that laid back Key West attitude, but when your guests are not happy and his only response is to see the "unhappy disclosure" on the web site, it's just not funny. I have seen the real laid back Key West attitude at many many other "Guest Hotels" on the Island and Mike should take some notes from his competitors. If you happen to check out of the Eden House early and go elsewhere, PLEASE mention this place, it's pretty incredible to hear what other owners responses are. Laid back is great, pompous is not. This guy just can't pull it off. Ok, in closing I will say.....after staying here and reading all the RAVE REVIEWS of this place, I can't tell you this....if you are a person that seeks a higher standard than some, this place is not for you. (keep in mind this place is expensive, I probably wouldn't mind if Mike realized this and lowered his prices to meet his standards). If you travel and are used to motels, hotel 6, truck stop Inns. that this is your kind of place. You will be giving the Eden House 4 stars!!! If low expectations are your desire, have a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, serene, and perfectly comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: JimBIII
Reviews.Content: My wife and I joined 2 other couples for a week of relaxation and escape from the midwest winter. Following the high recommendations from one of the other couples in our group, together, we booked three deluxe rooms at the Eden House. After calling ahead to inquire about vacancies, my wife and I and one other couple actually arrived a day early. The very accommodating and courteous staff booked us into two rooms in the upper level of the main house for one night, then moved our luggage to our new accomodations the next morning. Rooms 114, 115, and 116 were secluded on the lower level at the rear of the main house and were very comfortable. Each of the rooms, while not overly large, contained a single queen sized bed, were extremely clean, well kept, and featured very recent amenities. The new flat screen tv's w/dvd players open up additional space on top of the chest of drawers. The showers in each of the rooms had instant hot water and plenty of it. The maintenance and the cleanliness was impeccable. Not a rusted nail, flake of paint, scratched, chipped, or cracked board could be found either inside or outside our rooms. For those of us who can't quite leave work at home, cell phone coverage as well as wireless internet strength were great. Each of our rooms had it's own back porch which featured a padded porch swing and a patio table with chairs. Just off the back porch several of the many hammocks, shaded by towering palms and coconut trees, beckoned us each afternoon. As others have said, this is a quiet place to relax. This is not a headquarters for tweenage spring breakers or for a family with young children. It's designed and marketed towards couples looking for a place to spend some quiet time together and Mike Eden has created a little piece of paradise that meets that goal in spades. No ice machines or elevators outside your door. No late night party animals running through the hallways slamming doors. No neighbors waking you up through paper thin walls. Quiet time from 10pm to 10am is recognized each evening, but as the saying goes, if they don't hear you, they don't see you. The hot tub is open all night if you're quiet. The front desk is staffed 24/7 so there is always somebody available to meet your every need or wish. Each of the staff members we encountered were very helpful, informative, and very very courteous. I've never been at a hotel where the staff has had such a strong desire to fulfill your desires. The walk to and from Duval Street isn't bad, in fact, it's rather relaxing (see the theme here?) The best route leads you down to Schooner Wharf with a great look at the boats and the harbor. There is plenty of old town architecture and greenery to be seen along the way and ample amounts of food and drink to be found between the Eden House and Duval. For those staying several days, a coin laundry is only a block away. Eden House also rents bikes and has ample parking should you drive. I can't say enough about the hospitality and the accomodations. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly Visitor with siblings”
Reviews.Author: BOBBOCT
Reviews.Content: We come to the Keys every year and stay at the Eden house because the staff / accomidations and location to down town. We are within walking distance of downtown and all the best resterants. We will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0130
Reviews.Content: This was my 16th or 17th stay at the Eden House and again it did dont disappoint. If you want a quiet, relaxing get-a-way in Key West - stop looking and start booking the Eden House. From the cold beer/drink you are given upon check-in to the heavenly quiet hammocks in the back of the property, you'll not want to leave. I've never stayed in any other property in my 17 years visiting Key West and am not looking to change. Mike Eden keeps the place in top notch condition (for a 1920's hotel), the staff very attentive, the 'rules' to a minimum and the relaxing atmosphere very consistent. The private rooms are not fancy - but they are clean, quiet and all you need - a place to shower/sleep. The larger rooms are better appointed but stay away from the rooms in the front of the building - unless you fancy street noise. Take a simple private room along the pool area and you can hear the water fall outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Baaack!”
Reviews.Author: capngeo
Reviews.Content: The place is paradise. Exactly a 10 minute walk to Duval St. and even shorter to the Old Historic District but the hotel is so inviting you'll probably not spend as much time in town as you had planned. Immaculate and completely relaxing atmosphere. Met many "regular" guests and we'll probably become the same. We're active 50-somethings and it was perfect. Might be a little too laid back for teens or younger folks. Cuban grocery a block and half away for breakfast sandwich and Cafe Con Leche. You don't need a car to stay here but we had a rental and had no trouble getting one of the free-parking for guests spaces. We were "upgraded" without being asked and had what the regulars said was "The Best Room in the House".

Reviews.Title: “Chilly Weather at the WARM Eden House”
Reviews.Author: Jackandlouann
Reviews.Content: January in KW was suppose to be warm. We found our warmth within the staff and surroundings at Eden House. What a surprise when you walk into the beautifully landscaped pool area. Hammocks, swings, spa, fountains, fish ponds and pool will all warm your heart and toes. We upgraded our small room to a deluxe pool-side room and we recommend this to all the readers. Get a package deal too, so you can get out on the blue water in a boat for drinks and dining. Use the bikes and the staff who know KW and can suggest the best places to go to see stuff and eat the best meals on the island. Off street parking was a big plus as well as a free cocktail hour. We will be back...when it is warmer. Remember KW homes don't have heat so make your own...we did. Thanks for a great vacation memory. XOXOXOXOXO... JA and LAH Millersville, MD

Reviews.Title: “There's good reason they call it "Eden"”
Reviews.Author: tullwriter
Reviews.Content: We found Eden House almost by accident 10 years ago and have been going back ever since. We would NEVER stay anywhere else in our beloved home-away-from-home of KW. Clean, comfortable, laid back, convenient by bike and feet to everything we could possibly want... except we never want to leave poolside or the hammocks. Mike and Pasha and the rest of the staff have become like family to us. This is a wonderful place for couples who seek peace, quiet and a non-commercial resort feeling, We've met wonderful people from all around the world there. George Hillow and Judi Tull

Reviews.Title: “heaven on key west!”
Reviews.Author: cherylm
Reviews.Content: our 2nd stay at eden house- can't wait for the 3rd! it's peaceful, it's funky, it's immaculate, all the employees are treasures of helpfulness....really, can you tell we loved it? far enough away from duval to be quiet, close enough to walk there, or anyplace else on the island. hammocks under the palms, shelves of vacation reading material, fabulous hot tub, pool that encourages peaceful floating at any hour. and happy hour! every afternoon at 4pm. are you packing yet?

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved it! Missing it Already”
Reviews.Author: tkjms
Reviews.Content: I wish I had provided my review earlier. In addition to going in Dec '08 this was our 2nd time to Eden. First time was May '08 - we just couldn't stay away. We've been going to KW for 20 years and always rent a house or stay in a condo. Once we found this we decided no more searching for the right place - we're going to Eden every time! The staff make the difference, very welcoming and always helpful. The quiet time is great and you can still stay poolside at night if you like or on a hammock its just a peaceful time. And actually all day its like that. Thankfully when we've been there we've only seen one kid - although she was extremely loud, it wasn't bad. But I would not recommend this personally for children b/c it is a small resort and only has the pool area for them to play. Plus KW overall is an adult destination. You can rent bikes from the front desk, the taxis are easy to call, you can easily walk to Duval - about 5 blocks and of course lots of other local places around the corner. I would recommend that you ask for the details of your room when you book it. There are very small rooms at the poolside that are great if you are looking for a cheaper room and just want a bed. But those rooms are tight. There are mutliple types of rooms - private hammocks, porch areas that fit all budgets. The rooms are clean and beds really comfortable. We've stayed in room #114 which has the hammock outside and is private - plasma TV - great room (pics are attached to the view from that porch). There are three like that. I've also stayed at one of their larger rooms when we had a group and that was the 2nd floor of the cottage room #422. My only recommendation honestly for the Eden at all is that there are so many private areas and foliage, beautfiul flowers/fish, etc except when you take the steps up to go to #422. You look down into the next door area (which may be where some of the staff live - I'm not sure) and its filthy. Looks like a trailer park next to this beautiful resort and outside the windows from the downstairs cottage (don't know the room number) you can see bags of trash, misc garage items, grilles, etc. And although the trash you can see is clearly separated as being part of the "green" for recyclling it should be hidden. Even at home I wouldn't want to see anything like this. Its a small complaint and will certainly not keep me from recommending Eden or going again - I would just warn you if you select the cottage to close your eyes on the way upstairs. I won't stay in that room again but I think they can easily fix this with a higher fence or trash boxes. And who knows, Eden is also one of the few I've seen on Trip Advisor that respond to the reviews which I think is great so maybe they can do something soon about this. Also, the cottage is also a little louder than the other rooms b/c it is located on the side street. The trolley comes by in the morning for the local tour ringing its bell - its cute but not if you want to sleep in ;-) One of the rooms to ask about if you can get it - its always booked when we've been there is room #511! Its larger, right off the pool and lots of space inside.
