And also don't forget to ask when you make your reservation for a discount - sometimes during the year they give you the 4th night at 50% off or your 7th night free, never guaranteed but worth checking - depends on time of year of course. And back to the other good stuff - location, staff and the pool is just restful and beautiful. We can't wait to go back this year and bring more friends with us! Don't forget the amazing restaurant next door called Azur and you get a discount as a guest at Eden - I think it was 20% which is great and its wonderful food! While we were there the chef was also featured on the local KW tv channel. Thanks Mike for great hospitality - it was great meeting you this time too and the staff are always welcoming. Love the happy hour and the welcome bee. ;-) I've attached some pics of the grounds for people to check out.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: OMEXICO
Reviews.Content: Didn't get around to writing a review in August when we were there, but they really deserve to hear we loved our stay there. We've gone to Key West for 20 years; first time here. We loved the pool, the hot tub, the parking, the happy hour, and the staff. We received lots of helpful hints, and even coupons! And the restaurant next door was fabulous. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “It's Almost Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mateenNewportNews_Va
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to the Eden House was every bit as good as the first--friendly welcome, great service, absolute relaxation. Mike Eden and his staff are laid back but competent, and the grounds are gorgeous: a pool and jacuzzi surrounded by palm trees enclosed perfectly: good by, outside world! Favorite things: the hammocks for reading, and the drink cart every day at 4. We'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House was just "OK”
Reviews.Author: ALKDewitMI
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a fabulous pool and spa area with evening happy hour. There was even a sun deck for those times when the sun was not around the pool. The rooms appeared to be clean, but walking barefoot on the tile floor left us with filthy feet (yuck!). Twice we had to go looking for toilet paper because it was not restocked in the daily cleaning. The hotel was smoke free inside but walking into the front door from the porch always left you with smoke filled lungs, as that was the gathering place for workers and guests who smoked. While the hotel claims to be green, we followed instructions and hung our towels up for re-use and each day they were taken to the laundry anyway. The location is a ways off Duval, but quiet and secluded. We might stay here again (did I mention the pool and spa area was fabulous?), but it would not be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Tearitup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eden House for a week in November. We werenâ€™t quite sure what to expect but were not disappointed by what we found. Eden House was a nice change from the large resorts in the area that we normally visit. The check in process was easy, and yes we did get a welcome drink which is a nice touch. Our room was great. It was one of the apartments which was nicely located beyond the pool at the edge of the property. We had a huge porch area with a swing and a nice table and chairs, very private and a nice place to relax. The pool area is a standout. It was nice not to have to jockey with anyone for a lounge by the pool. I spent a lot of time in the pool and the hot tub and also on the sundeck. I canâ€™t comment on parking as we go car free when we vacation in Key West. That said, the property is within easy walking distance to many restaurants and places to shop. It was an easy stroll to the Historic Seaport area as well. If you are staying in Old Town there really is little need for a car. Overall we had a really great time at Eden House and will be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews on this site, I went to Eden House with high hopes and it may be that was the problem - I expected too much. I've been travelling to the States for quite a few years and have been to a variety of hotels from superb to at best mediocre and this was ... unique. Take that how you may, it simply wasn't what I had expected from the review or the research I had done. The hotel was clean and looks fantastic. The members of staff I saw were pleasant enough and checking in was easy. The off street parking is a real bonus. I'd booked a poolside room and it was literally on the poolside. The room was compact and the bed was extremely uncomfortable and small for what I expected. It had no entertainment facilities e.g. a tv or radio except in a communal 'lounge' which was used as a corridor. The hotel has a request that quiet is observed between 10pm and 10am and I was therefore extremely disappointed to be woken at 7.30am by a suitcase being dragged along the poolside and the lively chatter of a member of staff directly outside my room. The restaurant next door was extremely good if expensive. I'm probably not being particularly eloquent but I was disappointed in the Eden House experience - not as relaxing or of the quality I had led myself to believe.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: AHF_7
Reviews.Content: Was expecting something a lot better. From outside looked like a cheap motel, but inside quite different, more like an old people's home with rows and rows of white plastic chairs. Room a bit strange. Seems to have a very loyal guest list who come year after year. But there are so many other hotels nearby with more interesting and comfortable rooms. A lot of the hotel notices made me feel intimidated like no noise after 10pm or before 10am, yet the noise from the constantly running waterfall features and from the garbage trucks at 6am where far worse than any noise `i could make. Swimming pool area was attractive enough, but its all bit faded and needs renovating in my opinion. No food on site but take aways and cafes close enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Flashpacker2008
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Lovely secluded courtyard pool. Great location for exploring Key West on foot. Liked the welcome drink and happy hour. Met many returners to the Eden House and can understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrumpy
Reviews.Content: We couldn't find a hotel in Key West, and passed Eden House just by accident. And what were we happy we passed it. We had a small room at the end of the corridor, very quiet, and cosy, 2 single beds, which were along the side wall, with a cosy shower/toilet. We used the swimming pool during the day, and after we went out and came back. Sitting in the hot tub, under the palmtrees in the middle of the night was just magical! The next morning at bit more of the swimming and lying in the hammocks, just enjoying and relaxing. Just a short distance from the centre, a great and friendly place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, frivilous, and just a bit out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Kautostar2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eden House during a visit to the Keys in Oct 2008. Key West alone is an extraordinary experience, and well worth the fabulous drive down the Keys to visit. Eden House added infinitely to our enjoyment of our trip to Key West. The rooms are basic, yet scrupulously clean, and the beds are comfy! The pool area is gorgeous, and clearly a huge amount of effort goes into keeping the grounds, and surrounding areas easy on the eye. Staff are great, and couldn't be faulted in any way. They were happy to help with all the regular assistance and also to go the extra mile to add to your stay. I highly reccommend trying the restaurant at the hotel out for breakfast or an evening meal. The Blueberry pancakes are excellent! In essecence, if you're looking for big hotel chic, this is not the place for you. If you're looking for friendly, relaxed, and charming surroundings. Don't look any further than Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Word of Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: JAKY
Reviews.Content: This is not so much a review of the property but a review of Mike, his employees and the compassion they extended to us. My husband, our daughter, son-in-law and I had reserved the 2 bedroom conch house for a week in September, it was a trip we had all looked forward to for some time. In late August my father was diagnosed with a very aggressive form of cancer and needed care. The Eden House has a 30 day cancellation policy, we were well inside of the 30 days. After explaining the circumstances we were told that we would have a credit and could use that credit at any time during the upcoming year, we thought that was great. Later that week my husband received a call from Mike who after hearing the reason for our cancellation refunded our deposit in full and extended his condolences. My dad was a small business owner and always believed that people were more important than money, clearly this is also the belief at the Eden House. So thank you again and it will be our pleasure to see you some time in 2009 to thank you in person! Jaky

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fantasy Fest and more!”
Reviews.Author: SwedAmer
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit to Key West and Eden House and our first Fantasy Fest. The staff, especially Lee, made the stay at Eden house even more enjoyable. Pasha and her fellow staff members were also so nice and helpful. Except for the weekend third shift night clerk, the whole staff was so great. We will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “EH was exactly what we had hoped, and better.”
Reviews.Author: Woburnbeachlady
Reviews.Content: We wanted to thank the entire staff at Eden House, for making our Anniversary stay, a wonderful experience. They were very gracious in taking time to help us choose the right room for us over the phone when I was booking, and we loved #302, a very nice apartment with a very spacious master bedroom with a queen, an enormous living room/kitchen combo with a huge flat screen TV, leading out to a semiprivate deck with table and chairs for 4 with a hammock...it rocked. The bathroom was very well laid out with tons of storage space. All the staff was very helpful and went above and beyond several times: a chilled bottle of champagne was waiting in our fridge, I lost my bike key and Dan and Elizabeth could not have been nicer in dealing with me, the night-guy even had a Bud for my husband in those late night forays into the pool. This was our 5th trip to Key West but our first time at Eden House, with any luck, it will not be our last, that if for sure. It was our first time away from our kids in 10 years, and the quiet pool area provided the tranquility we were looking for: perfect for devouring lots of books. The atmosphere during Happy Hour transformed into a very friendly exchange of nice dinner places, catching up on the changes on the island and just sharing life stories. Lots of interesting people from all over the world. Once cool thing about this place was the cleaver use of space, every nook and cranny had something wonderful hidden in it, and was hidden with lush tropical vegetation. Just a paradise. So thank you all for making our 24th anniversary memorable, relaxing and a really nice Key West experience. Dinner at Michael's was just fabulous, definitely try eating out on the back garden, very romantic. Liz and Mike from Woburn, MA 10/15/08 - 10/20/08

Reviews.Title: “"Mind-Soothing Hospitality!" Absolutely true!”
Reviews.Author: UNCMickey
Reviews.Content: "Mind-Soothing Hospitality!" is The Eden House slogan, and a very accurate description of the atmosphere there. Our biggest regret is that we were only there 4 nights...next time it will be much longer! My H and I stayed in the 2 bedroom apt. with friends. It is the upstairs of an old restored/remodeled conch house; very nice & simply decorated, well maintained, very comfortable, and extremely clean. It is by far the cleanest place that any of us have ever stayed. They've recently become a "Green Lodging" member so their cleaners are "green", too. The place just smelled "clean", not chemical like most hotels do. The staff was super friendly and casual, it was like staying with old friends. Their friendly suggestions on where to eat, drink, snorkel, etc. were all right on. We were 1st greeted at check-in with our choice of several kinds of drinks (both alcohol & non-alcohol); the beer choices were budweiser and miller lite, we chose one of each, they were ice cold and much appreciated after our drive from Miami. The free daily happy hour (liquors, mixers, soft drinks, and snack mix--watch out for the larger green ball in the snack mix, it is pure wasabi, and is EXTREMELY Hot) was a lot of fun, a great way to meet others staying there. The atmosphere there is so relaxing and casual. The grounds are beautiful and echo the atmosphere. There are porch swings that are part most of the accomodations there, also hammocks all around under tropical tree canopies, and waterfalls with beautiful Koi fish. We stayed at the 4 star National Hotel in South Beach Miami, the night before driving to the Keys, and while that hotel and it's famous grounds were great; the Eden House is tops in our book. Totally unforgetable, totally genuine, totally unique, a great experience. The REAL Key West. The location is great for a walk to the Bight, or to Duval. We enjoyed our late night strolls back to the Eden House passing by all the beautiful old homes and gardens and stopping to talk to all the cats along the way. Our favorite beach, (Ft. Z. Taylor) is an easy bike ride away. You see, I could go on and on.... One last thing, if you are interested in the Eden House, please read through their website, all the way to the bottom of the page; hotel policies, and the owner, Mike Eden's opinions. It is quite humorous, and filled with great info. You can really get the "vibe" of this unique place, by looking at the pictures and reading all through the website. It was truly "Mind-Soothing Hospitality" to us, but if you prefer fancy accomodations, formal staff with their hand out for every little thing they do for you, etc. .... This isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gngr311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Duval St. but far enough away to be able to relax in the Eden House's pool and hot tub. The staff is extremely friendly. This is a beautiful old hotel that has been renovated to be simple yet exactly what you need (relaxation). I recommend taking advantage of there happy hour by the pool. You can't beat free drinks. I will definitely come back to stay at the Eden House again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Grandmothers House @ Key West”
Reviews.Author: picpertv
Reviews.Content: The charm and grace of the Eden House is like staying at your Grandmothers place in Key West. This is pure Key West from the charm of the wrap around poarches to the gazebo swing. We looked forward to a relaxing late afternoon with the friends we met while staying there and sharing stories and adventures over a drink poolside. The staff was wonderful and truly made us feel like their personal guests, We have found our Key West experience and need not look any further. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is great!”
Reviews.Author: wbs2418
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend were making our first trip to Eden House and Key West about 3 weeks ago. We drove and had heard bad things about parking in Key West, but when we arrived at Eden House, we did not have trouble parking in their little parking lot next to the property. When we arrived, we were promply shown our room and directed to happy hour out by the pool. The property and pool area is absolutely fantastic. We loved it. Early the very next morning, we were called and informed of a family tragedy and our vacation was cut very short. When we informed them of the situation, they were so kind to us telling us the last thing we needed to worry about was money and promptly refunded us the money for the entire length of our stay except for the night we stayed. From reading a couple of the negative reviews (and their aren't many of them) here about this place, that was not what we were expecting to hear. We were not there long enough to learn any of the staffs name, so i will just say "thanks" to Mike and the staff for keeping up such a beautiful place and being so considerate during hard times. We did not make it back to finish our vacation this summer, but we will definitely be going back to Key West next summer and we will be staying at the Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation in Key West”
Reviews.Author: USAGUY27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple, our two best friends, truly enjoyed our stay at Eden House. The entire staff was extremely helpful recommending local places to see, great restaurants, and even set up a fantastic fishing charter for the four of us. The comfortable home-like Inn atmosphere was great. Thank you Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: jenny1123
Reviews.Content: A group of seven of us just stayed at the Eden House over an extended weekend. It was the weekend of the Hemingway festivals and activities, so it was quite crowded. The hotel remained relaxed and surprisingly quiet. The property was beautiful and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would have enjoyed a larger pool and a lounge or bar, but those things did not put a damper on my trip. I would stay here again and hopefully, I will, someday.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Key West Charm!”
Reviews.Author: princessphillly
Reviews.Content: I have spent much time in Key West and have visited many guest houses and I have to say that my experience at the Eden House was second to none! We had a beautiful room (granted, one of the larger ones) with a lovely porch on which to relax. The grounds were lush with foliage and koi ponds, dappled with sunlight and hammocks, perfect secret places to read or cuddle with a loved one. Despite the oppressive heat the pool somehow managed to stay miraculously cool and refreshing. The staff was extremely helpful, well informed and accommodating to our every need. My only regret is that we did not stay and additional week. Thank you Eden House!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Azalea140608
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the states and Key West. On ariving in Key West we were a little overwhelmed by the commercialism but as soon as you step in to the sanctuary that is Eden House the tranquility hits you. The staff were very friendly and helpful and they have quirky little signs around the place which make it clear that they want you to have fun and relax. And relax we did. We had a deluxe room so had our own private veranda with a swing seat outside which was bliss for reading an relaxing. I'd go again and would recommend it to those on honeymoon as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eden House!”
Reviews.Author: leymac
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Daughter and I recently stayed at the Eden House and Loved it. We will definately be staying here everytime we return to Key West. The rooms are very comfortable, the pool area is relaxing and I loved Happy Hour! But most of all the staff is so accommodating and friendly! Thanks to everyone there, we will see you again soon! The Sena Family

Reviews.Title: “A long weekend at Eden”
Reviews.Author: CapmanTennessee
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West and we booked the Eden on the advice of a friend of our daughter. The Eden is clean and laid back. The grounds are conducive to relaxation and reading which we did. The staff was accommodating and gave us a lot of information about Key West. The major drawback to the Eden is the very small rooms. We were not able to open our suitcases except when we put them on the bed. There is no place to sit inside the room so you were in bed or standing up. We spent little time in our room and sat mostly out on the porch so it was not a major issue. The hotel is convenient to downtown and most attractions. We took our car out only once the entire stay. There is a daily "Happy Hour" from 4-5 but we missed it the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Key West and very cute.”
Reviews.Author: sangrialady2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Eden House for 2 nights in a very small room. We should have upgraded, but since we had never stayed there before, we really did not know. The grounds are well kept and they make a point of making the guests feel comfortable. I would recommend this place, but I would suggest to avoid the 3 smallest rooms, not unless you like shoeboxes...

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Paradise without leaving the US!!”
Reviews.Author: xandergomez
Reviews.Content: Being a Miami native, I have visited Key West on NUMEROUS occasions. It is an ideal weekend destination for me. I had always stayed at the larger hotel chains up until now. I will never go back to them!!! This weekend was supposed to be a little extra special and intimate for me and my girlfirend (...well...actually....my fiancee), because I was planning on proposing. So after seeing some of the excellent reviews here, I decided to give this hotel (it's not a B&B!!....because I don't like B&B's) a shot. Boy...did the Eden House deliver the wow!! When I contacted the Eden House to make my reservation, I had a brief conversation with the front desk manager, in which I mentioned how important this weekend was to me. Upon check in, the front desk knew exactly who I was and were gracious enough to give me one of their more "secluded rooms". The property is gorgeous. It is nestled amongst some beautiful foliage tucked a few blocks back from Duval. It's close enough to walk and far away enough to be completely peaceful. They have a beautiful pool area, countless hammocks and swings, a free happy hour, a tanning deck, and free wi-fi!! Jeez, what more could you want? The hotel also has a neighboring restaurant (Azur), where we had an EXCELLENT breakfast that we enjoyed at a 20% discount because we were Eden House guests. The hotel is VERY conscientious about its cleanliness as recycling bins and trash cans are located and labeled everywhere. The room was impeccable and greeted us with a pleasant clean and fresh smell (the first impression of smell is so very important to me in how I percieve a hotel room). So the room was immaculate. And even more astounding than that.....was the fact that even their small rooms are pretty big for Key West standards. I stayed in the "small deluxe" and thought maybe that it would be so small, I'd bang my knees against the wall when I woke up. Not the case. Ample room space to sleep, store your bags, change, etc. I even had the manager show us some of the larger rooms and we were astounded as to how big they were. There are many details that just shows you that the hotel is thinking. Complimentary, and variety of, suntanning products; rags (other than normal face cloths) that you can use for shoes or clean up (as not to dirty your face cloths); pool toys and inflatables; self locking doors (which I personally like); and "un-policed" pool hours....I believe their slogan was: "If we can't hear you, then we can't see you!". I will definitely be back, and I recommend this hotel to any traveler that wants to avoid a tourist trap. This place is the real deal and is truly an affordable gem.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BuckRutledge
Reviews.Content: Superb staff and great location (close enough to Duval to walk, and far enough to avoid the crowd and noise). We look forward to our next stay. Thanks for the free WiFi and 24-hour coffee service!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is UNBELIEVABLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: davidfort
Reviews.Content: My new bride and myself arrived at the Eden House in Key West on June 23rd, 2008. Upon arrival, we thought 'hmmmm.....I wonder how this is going to be'. 'Sue' greeted us with open arms, showed us the property (which is stunning), and lead us to our room. We decided to stay in one of the smaller rooms right off the pool. It was perfect for us since we were hardly in the room at all.....accept for a few hours of sleep and honeymoon 'activity'. The Eden House is friendly, relaxing and a lot of fun. Happy Hour from 4-5pm each day really gets things going...and going....and going! Sue even extended Happy Hour by 30 minutes for us one night....which made everyone 'happier'. It's quiet at night with all the amenities that you will need on a vacation, honeymoon or weekend getaway! We will go back and I will recommned the Eden House to everyone I know that is planning a trip to Key West. It's people like 'Sue' and the other staff members at the Eden House that make you want to go back! Thanks to everyone at the Eden House for making our honeymoon as special as it turned out! Any questions, I can always be reached at davidfort@cablelynx.com Thanks, David

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Gem”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaPeg
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely gem. Close enough to everything to walk, but far enough to be a quiet getaway. Our "deluxe" room was not large but comfortable and nicely situated near the pool. If you will be in the room alot, spring for a large deluxe. We had planned to but one was not available all the nights we were there as a wedding party had booked almost all of the rooms, and we were not in the room much anyway. The parking leaves a bit to be desired as they don't have enough spaces for the number of rooms but that they have any at all in this tightly packed historic area is an advantage. We did find street parking without a problem. Once there you don't really need a car anyway, you can walk or rent one of their well maintained bikes. We did both. Getting a poolside chair was a bit of a challenge as the inn was full and the guests all hanging out there, but we didn't spend much time at the pool anyway. Hammocks and porch swings held my attention, and I spent a fair amount of the time "swinging away" in the porch swing library. The staff was helpful and friendly and went out of their way to be sure we enjoyed our short stay. Every time we went to the desk someone asked if we were having fun and if they could help with anything. The food at the Azur restaurant next door was wonderful as well, making it an easy dinner location for those who are tired from their trip to the inn, as we were. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay-Key West flavor all the way”
Reviews.Author: A_Light_Sleeper
Reviews.Content: First visit to Key West, Eden House was the perfect place to stay. Reflected the local flavor, not too pretentious, very laid back. Staff were very friendly, room was comfortable, pool and jacuzzi an ideal way to end a day of walking/biking around town. Hotel is located close enough to everything to walk but far enough away so we didn't hear any night crowd noise. They have nice bikes to rent pretty cheap, great way to get around town. Azur Resaurant next door had some of the best food (bfast and dinner) we ate while there, they gave us an Eden House courtesy discount which a pleasant unexpected surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Your in Eden”
Reviews.Author: brugesgae
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautifull, with a very nice Garden were one can realy come to rest and relax in one of the hammock or swings that are availible in the Garden. There is also a small swimming pool and jacuzzi and a free drinks happy hour between 4 and 5. what can one ask for more, this is realy eden ... We Booked a standart room what is somewhat small as are the beds to lay in with two, but then who wants to sit in a room when you have a great garden to sit in on this fab. Island. The staff if very helpfull and friendly and are there for you with all of you questions. Rent a bike for a low price at the hotel and your of to have a great time. I hope to return someday to the eden house.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden House”
Reviews.Author: keysrn
Reviews.Content: went to the Eden House for the first time for a 40th birthady celebration. What a great time and can't wait to return to the serene atmosphere. Was welcomed with a smile and tour then to the room where we were given a complimentry bottle of champaine and glasses. I can not say enough about all the staff members ,each one always had a smile and greeted you like you were family. Each day we started at the pool and always met wonderful guest along with music that soothed your soul. Me and my husband exteded our stay by another day and were so sad to leave. If you get a chance any staff will show you around to all the different types of rooms which all were clean and beautiful. We choose a large delux and it was such a pleasant surprise not stuffy like chain hotels are, and the size of the room was perfect. If you get a chance to chat with the owner, he also makes you feel at home and his version of the history of the Eden house definatly makes you envious and also very lucky to have stayed at his creation and interpretation of being in paradise. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a piece of mind, and wants to have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Floridafans
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews sound great but we were very disappointed. We booked a deluxe room months in advance but when we arrived we were given a tiny room on the ground floor. There was a fence so close to the bedroom window that the room was almost in darkness. There wasn't anywhere to even open our suitcases (never mind store them) and the 'wardrobes' were 2 small wall cupboards (which you could only reach if you stretched up and over the bedside tables). It was our honeymoon and we'd had great expectations which weren't realised. In fairness, we complained and we got our money back so we checked out and went elsewhere. The rest of the hotel looked lovely, the staff were nice and we would have loved a different experience but unfortunately it didn' t happen for us. When booking, make sure you don't get room 106 like we did!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Someones_Sunshine
Reviews.Content: My one suggestion to the owner - designate scooter parking. When we arrived, we had to find parking elsewhere because 4 scooters took up 3 parking spaces. We asked inside if they could do something about it, and the clerk said no. We weren't the only guests who were unhappy about that. Otherwise, the grounds are lovely and charming - I wish we would have had more time to enjoy them. Hammocks everywhere! I could have slept outside that night!! Our A/C was plenty cold and the room was larger than our cabin on the cruise we took the next day - and we spent a week in it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: LovingKeyWest
Reviews.Content: Eden house was absolutely the best hotel we have stayed at in 4 years coming to Key West. We will never stay anywhere else. Clean, excellent staff, beautiful pool and the Hammocks are the greatest. Thank you all so much for making our stay one of the best ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jcburns216
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Eden House every memorial day weekend, this will be our 4th year. It is such a great place to stay. We enjoy the atmosphere, the people, and the very accomodating staff!! Excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereWorcester
Reviews.Content: Eden House was a great place to stay on Key West. Away from the hustle and bustle of Duval but not too far to walk. Staff was fabulous and went out of their way for anything you asked for. Pool area was busy every day (Happy hour starts at 4) You never heard any street noise at the pool, like your own secluded spot. Rooms range from large to small, but they were clean, clean, clean! Would definitely recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeKey
Reviews.Content: Eden House provided the perfect laid back atmosphere for our mid- February visit to Key West. It is located within walking distance of everything but just far enough from downtown to provide a tranquil escape. The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff went out of their way to make us feel like a welcome member of the family. The rooms can be small but they are very clean and comfortable and have the necessities covered. The beautifully landscaped grounds are a well balanced combination of sun and shade. We took advantage of the pool, hot tub, porch swings and hammocks. The free happy hour was also a pleasant surprise. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: fig_mar
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, my wife and I decided on the Eden House for our trip to Key West. We landed in Fort Lauderdale and took the shuttle down to Key West. The shuttle dropped us off at the hotel. The shuttle is a good way to enjoy the ride down US1. The reviews said that the standard rooms were small but I didn't believe they would be so small. I could sit on my side of the bed and brush my teeth in the sink. Don't let the size of the rooms deter you from booking this property. You really don't need a large room because the grounds and pool areas are so inviting. The grounds are well cared for and spotless. Everyday there was a happy hour and I'm not talking about cheap wine and beer. Rum, vodka, gin were available to make your own cocktail. The location of Eden House is very good. We walked everywhere we need to be. Breakfast at Harpoon Harry's just 2 blocks away, lunch at the Dock Cafe on the water, dinner at Azur which is next door. Also try El Siboney for something different. Don't miss the Hemingway House. La Te Da has Randy Roberts who puts on an excellent show. He appears as Bette, Cher, etc. Eden House and Key West are an excellent choice for a winter weather getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: rink23
Reviews.Content: I was at the Eden House from March 21-24 and greatly enjoyed my stay. The location was great. A quiet part of town, but only a 10-minute walk from the heart of Duvall and 5 minutes from the harbor walk. Rent a bike, I did, and you can cut those times by over half. While my room was small -- it was one where you had a television, microwave, refrig and own bathroom -- it fit my needs just fine, because other than to sleep, change clothes and shower, I was hardly there during my stay. I also have to commend them for the room TVs. A nice wide screen -- probably a 36-incher -- which was great for the brief time I did sit down to watch the NCAA Tournament. The front desk service was great. They were courteous and any questions I had were quickly answered and the few problems I ran into were quickly resolved. The highlight of my trip was when I asked the girls at the desk soon after my arrival if I could test ride a bike before renting one, considering it had been 25-plus years since I had ridden with any consistency. They had no problem with that -- and renting a bike was the best decision I made the entire trip. A bike is definitely the best way to get around the island. (I'm actually thinking of buying one for my own use at home, I enjoyed it so much. Imagine, exercise being fun). I also liked the at your own risk policy regarding the pool and jacuzzi. After getting back from Duvall Street at 2 a.m., it was nice to sit in the jacuzzi (although the temperature seemed to have been turned down from what it was during the day) for a little a while -- and having 1-2 more cold ones -- before hitting the sack. The only major issues I had were: 1, The pool: It was not heated and with temperatures in the 70s and gusty winds while I was there, the water was just too cold. 2, The Wi-Fi.: It did not work well. You could be sitting right next to the router and you would lose your connection. For many people, the internet is a vital part of their life - I was even using it during my stay to find place to eat/visit while I was in Key West -- and to have a poor internet hookup -- when it's supposed to be high speed -- can be a real pain. 3, One of the mornings my shower was too hot/scalding, something you can rarely complain about while staying in a hotel. But I talked to the front desk and the problem was quickly resolved. Final verdict: Eden House is a great place to stay and I could easily see myself going back.. But if you're a person who is looking to party hard (i.e., spring breakers, which are not allowed there), this is not the place for you. Even me, at the age of 43, felt a bit out of place because it seemed many of the guests never left the grounds and were the go to bed at 10 p.m and get up at 8 a.m. types rather than the get up at noon and go to bed at 4 a.m. type which I tend to be. (I work nights in my professional life), But no one complained about my nocturnal lifestyle, and staying there did keep me away from the spring breakers, which is the primary reason I'll probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric!”
Reviews.Author: prusling
Reviews.Content: Eden House is a beautifully-maintained traditional Keys building with excellent modern amenities close enough to the happenings of Key West but also a haven for relaxing by the pool, spa or in a hammock. Having made use of the free parking, we were warmly welcomed by the friendly staff and shown to our ground floor room with porch swing (114) close to the facilities but not on top of them; we walked in to the well-equipped room and were met by the scent of lemon â€“ a great touch. The ambience is great â€“ an abundance of plantlife and trees, great music in the background, wind chimes, hot drinks on tap, and of course their famous happy hour with complimentary drinks at 4pm each day when you get to meet and make friends with most of the residents! We amused them with waving sessions to the webcam for our family who were watching back home! When we felt more energetic we hired bikes from the hotel and toured the old town and its amazing old houses, finishing up with the must-do sunset at Mallory Square. We hadnâ€™t realised that the hotel is famous for being the location of a Goldie Hawn film "Criss Cross" which weâ€™ve now ordered. We made a number of friends, had an excellent time there, and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming oasis of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MakeupI
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here in March 08. We had a great time at this very cute and charming hotel. It is a real oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the town but within easy walking distance of everything. The room was pretty small, didn't have a seperate bathroom, just a seperate toilet and a shower that came into the room. There wasn't much in the way of storage. However it was very clean and in good order (esp. air con which was very welcome). The real beauty of this place is the pool / jacuzzi area. Very attractive with loungers available. Plus there are hammocks and comfy garden chairs a plenty. Happy hour is worth coming home early for! We hired bikes from the hotel which is totally worth doing, very reasonably priced and a great way to explore Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than we remembered...”
Reviews.Author: elizjean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Eden House the past three/four years, and have had a different room each time. This year was definitely the best of the bunch. We were in a "deluxe" level room, which is slightly larger than the "small deluxe," and definitely worth the extra cost. We had a beautiful porch overlooking the hammock area. The grounds are maintained on a daily basis...no detail is overlooked. The housekeeping/maintenance staff are wonderful. The restaurant next door, Azul, is great for breakfast. We ate there several days in a row, and the food was consistently tasty. Eden House guests are given a discount there as well... The pool is small, but that only becomes a problem when the hotel is completely full. We had a few fellow guests that didn't follow the clearly stated rules (drinking/smoking IN the pool), but it didn't ruin our stay whatsoever. I would highly recommend the Eden House to anyone looking for a well priced, low-key stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: dirkoflame
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights after driving down from Miami in the mustang convertible. Great place, cool pool and fantastic staff especially Katherine on the front desk who booked us on a couple of tours. I'd employ her tomorrow but can't see her giving up Key West for rainy Manchester! Restaurant next door is pricey but great quality food and excellent Canadian waiter (sorry can't remeber his name). Mike has left notes in room on local restaurants - he wasn't wrong on most of them although one of the places he recommends in Malory Sq is shut after a fire. After 7 nights five star in Miami, the room sizes are a bit of a shock especially for more or less the same priceas the Miami hotels but what you get in Key West, it is worth the money. We will be going back and can recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “OK, here it is.....”
Reviews.Author: joefromamodio
Reviews.Content: Ok, here it is... I have vacationed in southern Florida, mostly FT Lauderdale, for 15 out of the last 20 years. I have watched the Ft Lauderdale area grow not only in popularity, but in amenities as well as cost. So, I decided to lay out the big bucks and go to the creme de la creme of Florida... Key West. Yes, it's true, not a cup of coffee to be found for less than $2.75 on this island, and not a steak for less than $30. However, the atmosphere, the people, the "experience" is worth every penny. Oh yeah, that's right... I'm supposed to be rating Eden House! Friendly, courteous, knowledgable, accomodating, ALL words we hear in the service industry and people throw around easily. Except at Eden House they really do apply! Every employee of Eden House was all of these and MORE. Not so much catering to me or any whim I may have, but more the straight "look you in the eye" give you real answers kind of people. From the recommendations of the local sandwich shops and fine dining establishments, they steered my vacation in all the right directions. Here's the best part... after spending those few hours each day away from the hotel grounds, it was most enjoyable to return "home" to Eden House. That is my experience in a nutshell. I felt like I was at home with family. You know the what I mean; like the cousin you see once or twice a year but you wish you lived closer to. First the sun deck beckons, then the pool calls out, then the hot tub is wispering your name. All of that followed up by a quick stop back at the room refridgerator for a freshening of your favorite beverage, and then back to the "family atmosphere" among the other guests. I was actually sad to call it a day, because of the atmosphere that was created by the staff "family." Of course that's not so bad... to go to the room... with the perfect bed, welcoming air conditioning and roomy shower. Being a clean freak myself (at least my wife calls me that) I can't say enough good things about the cleanliness and organization of the whole hotel. Meeting Mr Eden several times at happy hour just seemed to top off the comfortable and inviting atmosphere that I now call "my vacation home." Feel free to quote me on this, "The Eden House is the best place to stay in all of Key West. Period. Bar none." Thank you so much Mr. Eden and your family of employees. You made this vacation the best ever. I'll see you in 348 days!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our first stay @ Eden House”
Reviews.Author: canttravelenuf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ Eden house early Feb. 2008. I have family who highly recommended it, and have stayed multiple times. My only recommendation is to book a larger room (as mentioned all around on the reviews, I wasn't listening). We booked a "Private" room. It was clean, as described, and had a surprisingly comfortable bed. However, the sink & shower were not part of the bathroom, they were part of the room (see sungal06's room pic). It was startling at first, but did grow on us throughout our stay. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. They squared away everything we wanted to do, even greeted us with a cold beer (Bud Light) and a soda when we checked in. It is a short walk (5 blocks) to Duval street, far enough from the chaos, yet close enough to get there quickly. Unfortunately, we missed happy hour during our stay, we were always out and about. All-in-all, it was a good time.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place We'll Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: VAMom2008
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Eden House over 10 times since 1990. We absolutely love it and wouldn't stay anywhere else. From the laid-back, come-as-you-are attitude of the staff and guests, it's hard to imagine another place in Paradise that is more visitor-friendly without the hype. Our family, including our kids, ages 12, 10, and 6, has come to view Eden House as our special vacation place, since we are all able to relax and enjoy the amenities that make Eden House so wonderful. The pool, hammocks, shaded swinging chairs, and even the fish pools are all we need to unplug and enjoy the island sun and breezes. We love the fact that Eden House is off the beaten path, yet a short walk to excellent dining, shopping, and sightseeing. We used to rent a car when we stayed here, but we've found that we don't need it, don't use it, and can just as easily take a taxi to and from the airport and just walk/bike everywhere else when on the island. So don't waste your money on a rental car! The rooms are clean and well appointed; the staff is friendly and will go to all lengths to make you feel welcome; the pool is just the right size for a small hotel that caters to families, singles, honeymooners, and retirees alike. The webcams make those stuck at home jealous - be sure to tell them to tune in and see you having a great time at Eden House!

Reviews.Title: “A garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: buferino
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden House for a week during the annual Key West Literary Seminar in January 2008. This was my first trip to Key West and I chose the hotel based on its description and from its website vibe - I opted for a small deluxe room, which turned out to be just off the lobby. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room had a fridge, a rainfall-type showerhead in the shower, and was otherwise really well-appointed, cool, and comfortable. One day I came back to find that the TV had been replaced with a plasma screen TV on the wall! I was surprised to find how quiet the staff and surroundings were, due to the10am-to-10pm quiet time. Being a big fan of naps and quiet time in general, I thought this was a great suggested rule for a vacation property. I think that people with less than positive experiences here brought them in the front door to begin with; my experience with staff, especially the housekeeping staff, was one of the best I have ever had and I told them so. All I lacked was breakfast, but there are so many places on the island to get great chow I couldn't really complain after bolting down some lobby coffee and getting ready for the day. Breakfast aside, the staff, the grounds, the whole hotel could not be better run or better kept. Great food and the waterfront are a short walk away and you will have a chance to meet all kinds of locals on Fleming Street and in the surrounding neighborhood. Ask Jay at the front desk to read you some of his poetry. I cannot wait to return to this beautifully landscaped hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyand82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Eden House for 5 days in 11/2007. The room was very clean. We stayed in a Deluxe Room #114 and it was very small. The description of the room on the website is somewhat deceiving. There wasn't a closet for hanging clothes. There were some hooks on the wall to hang your clothes. Also, there weren't any drawers to put your clothes in, if you wanted to unpack them. The pool and the grounds were relaxing and well kept. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel was close to Historic Seaport area, but not that close to Duval St. and Mallory Square. When walking to Mallory Square, it took us about 25 minutes walking fast. If you don't mind small rooms and being about 5 blocks from Duval St., you would probably like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Big on Noise, Low on Quality and Attitude”
Reviews.Author: Blugolds
Reviews.Content: Wow, was this place overrated. Bad vibes kicked in when we were greeted with a warm Milwaukee's Best straight from the box. Only went downhill from there. Rooms are small, with ridiculously misleading labels on website even for a Guest House, but one could live with that if the atmosphere were better. Friends renting the Conch House, one of the largest and most expensive rooms on site, had a smaller room literally attached to it. Needed to run the blow dryer to gain some privacy. By far worst part of stay was the noise -- don't stay here if you plan to sleep past dawn. Once the sun rises, the downstairs doors literally start slamming, the footsteps start pounding and the voices start rising from the employees starting their day. Door slamming was constant and literally made room shake. Irony is that this hotel has a strick Quiet Period from 10 p.m. to 10 a.m. -- clearly employees are exempt. Indifferent, chilly attitude continued at checkout when our group never even received a thank you or a "how was your stay." We were model guests, never raising a fuss despite plenty of cause. But we were treated like those traveling in steerage. Bottom line is this place is clearly living off its past rep. Place is clean and pretty, but so are a lot of other places down there. Much better values and quality places to stay in Key West. Don't make same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Treat”
Reviews.Author: LynnFromPA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful Christmas stay at the Eden House. The grounds are gorgeous and just what we wanted for our Key West vacation! The staff was friendly and efficient. We enjoyed Happy Hour and meeting the other guests around the pool each evening. It was a relaxing way to get away from our busy lives for a few days and soak up the Florida sun. The location was great...far enough from Duval Street to be quiet yet close enough to walk. We made use of rental bikes from the hotel for our longer jaunts and rented a scooter for fun to buzz around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Eden House”
Reviews.Author: bonemachine48
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Eden House in December. Great Staff,great rooms. Enjoyed the peace and quiet. Don in Mi.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena14
Reviews.Content: Eden House is unlike any other hotel I've ever stayed in. From the minute you arrive you feel like you are staying at a friend's house rather than in an hotel. The grounds are so relaxing and in addition to the sun loungers around the pool you can relax in a hammock beneath the palm trees listening to the sound of the waterfall whilst enjoying your free cocktail during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “the eden house is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: stevieknox
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended it and it turned out to be exactly what i have been looking for in a place to stay in key west.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: spcrwmn
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I arrived last in our group for a corporate-sponsored vacation in Key West, we were at first disappointed to be forced to another hotel due to several rooms at the appointed one being closed. However, it turned out to be a blessing - not only did we end up with our own room, but Eden House far outranked the other place, particularly in atmosphere. The Eden House grounds are sprawling compared to most Old Towne accommodations. Lavishly landscaped, we enjoyed simply sitting on the balcony facing the trees! I could have easily spent a week here, swimming in the heated pool or lounging in the jacuzzi, sunning on the sundeck, or resting and reading in one of the many hammocks. There's another nice sitting area with rocking chairs upstairs facing the road, great for people-watching. I can't express how amazing the atmosphere of this place was, very quaint, yet so detailed and varied. The hotel itself is in several different buildings, each holding rooms of various sizes. We didn't get to tour the other rooms, and ours was the bargain room, but it was more than adequate. Be warned - the room was TINY, barely big enough to fit the queen-sized bed and enormous entertainment center. But it was perfect for us, since the only time we planned to spend in the room was to be spent sleeping! We were in the last room on the second floor of the main house, so we didn't have to share a bathroom. The view from our windows was all trees - beautiful! (If you're not into tiny rooms, larger ones are available in the other buildings, including "apartments", "lofts", and "conch houses".) Another thing - the room was *immaculate*, as was the bathroom. And the grounds. Everything here really was perfect, and the staff was crazy friendly! For lunch the second day, I walked to a nearby shop for subs. On our last night, we rented bikes at the front desk, and spent the evening pedaling about the island. We stopped at Finnegan's Wake, an Irish pub frequented mostly by locals, and definitely worth a visit. Eden House is within walking/biking distance of Duval Street, although we did frequently use cabs when we needed to get somewhere, like to the corporate-sponsored dinner, in a hurry. I'm sure I haven't done Eden House justice with my description. If you're used to the Hilton or Marriot, you might be disappointed, but for a real taste of the laid-back Key West life, this should be your place - they don't even have alarm clocks in the rooms, on purpose!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: semoash
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Eden House as the best place to stay in Key West. What a great place. Great location, great staff. Very laid back but, but in a good way. We've stayed other places in the Keys, but this is where we'll be coming back to. Can't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: jharward
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Key West. We did the drive in the convertible from Miami. I went down with friends this time and left the hubby at home. This place is a little piece of paradise. I couldn't imagine what the other reviewers were saying about not wanting or needing to leave the hotel because Key West is such a fun place to go, now I know better. Now I know the real meaning of come, relax, enjoy. We had the upstairs 2 bedroom apartment and it was perfect. 3 porches/balconies, swing, picnic tables, refrigerator, toaster, etc... I am completely in love with this place and so are all my friends. We met new friends by the pool and we are getting together with them again soon. I can't say anything bad about this place. It's not perfect, but that is what gives it it's charm. Wonderful staff, thanks a lot! As Jimmy says, "I have found me a home".

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is my Key West”
Reviews.Author: flinsman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several of the B&B'S throughout Key West but our heart is with the Eden House. If you are looking for a new Omni style hotel, this is not it. If you want a great place to stay in Key West and never leave the hotel, you've found it. There are several types and sizes of rooms for all budgets. To be fair, we tend to rent the nicest room available. The owner and the staff make you feel like they have known you for years. We have made friends with other guest and always ask about them on each visit. Great enviroment,great people and yes cheap free booze.(I bring my own thank you!)

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: cassidy79
Reviews.Content: Eden House felt like a little oasis in Key West. Hammocks for afternoon naps, a nice pool with rafts, a great hot tub... all were surrounded by palm trees, lounge chairs, and sunshine. All of the employees were so friendly and helpful. We rented bikes with baskets for $7 a day, and did not move our car from the lot the entire time. After taking the drive from Miami and arriving after midnight, we didn't care what brand of beer was handed to us... it truly was that thought that counted. The only minor complaint was that the cd's playing near the pool could have been mixed up a bit more, but whatever music was played was enjoyable. We will definitely be back and cant wait to try the cafe. By the way, our room was on the 2nd floor which overlooked the pool; carpeted, and very quiet. And why would you even want a B&B, when "Blue Heaven" (best breakfast ever!) is a 5 minute ride away?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milla75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this small hotel a couple of nigths while visiting Key West. The location was ok, less than 10 blocks away from the main street. We had the smallest room and it was really small; only the bed, a sink in the same room, toilet and shower separately - no tv or refridgerator, even though the price was quite high compared to other accommodities. Nice pool area and staff. After reading the rewiews on Tripadvisor I was a bit dissapointed, probably the people who wrote the rewiews stayed in better rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but it ain't paradise”
Reviews.Author: Davy_Gam
Reviews.Content: I've been putting off writing a review for several months, principally because I want to like this place more than I actually did. Now don't get me wrong: It's a nice enough place and I would not hesitate returning to it, but there are several places I would go to first. There are a lot of positive things to say about it. The staff is friendly and extra-helpful. The rooms are spotless. There was fresh paint in a bunch of spots. The grounds were lush and well tended. There's an in-ground jacuzzi. The hotel has a nice, funky vibe. Our fellow guest were fairly friendly and nice to talk to. Our room had a lot of good things going for it, too. Lots of space, first floor, porch right on the street. But there were a bunch of things, little things, about the place that just screamed cheap! That they were maximizing there income a penny at a time. The devil is, of course, in the details and those details made me feel like they cared more about those pennies than me. There was no breakfast, but we knew that going in. The walls in the room were so thin that we could hear our next door neighbors completely. And when I say "hear completely," I mean you could sit on the commode and have a quiet conversation through the walls without raising your voice. The floors were tile, which obviously made it easier to clean than if there was carpeting. But we had upstairs neighbors, whose every footfall we could hear because there was, obviously, only tile up there. When we checked in, the desk clerk, as promised, gave my wife, the delightful Mrs. Gam, a cold beer. It did not make a good first impression. It was a "Milwaukee's Best," which, if you know anything about beers, is far from being Milwaukee's best. It's the kind of cheap beer you get for yourself if you want to sit on the sofa and get sloshed, not that you give to someone who just dropped serious money to stay at your hotel. Better to pay the extra pennies to get a good brand of beer or give nothing at all. The "happy hour" was also kind of cheap: no beer or wine, just vodka, dark rum and, I think, gin, in unlabled decanters. Now, everybody seemed to enjoy the happy hour, I know I did, but I also had the impression we were being nickle and dimed. There are other things that might effect someone's decision to stay at Eden House. They allow children. A pool filled with screaming little kids might be someone's idea of a Key West vacation. It is not ours. The pool itself, while nice, just does not seem big enough for the property. And while located in old town, the location is not the most convenient to everything. It is convenient to the east end of the harbor, but several blocks away from Duval. As I said, I really wanted to like this place more than I did. It's just Okay, no five-star paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House Forever”
Reviews.Author: T_boneVirginia
Reviews.Content: To be short and sweet the Eden House was excellent. The layout is cool, the staff is great, and the 24 hr pool and jacuzzi is a great way to close out the evening after a night on Duval Street. The Happy Hour is also a great way to kick off the evening after a day of sun on the sundeck. The hotel is exceptionally kept up and is a perfect short walk to Duval and/or the waterfront districts. We cannot wait for of our next trip to the Eden House; oh yes and Key West was excellent also. We made all our friends jealous as they watched us on the live pool web cams. See you soon Eden House. Cherie and Todd

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: DaliaRose
Reviews.Content: My review is kind of long, just because I'm going through everything I can type. My boyfriend and I just returned from an incredible 4D/3N vacation to Key West and the surrounding keys. We stayed in the lovely Eden House from July 27th through July 30th. Everything was absolutely perfect! The sign when we first walked in ('There are no strangers here, Only friends that have not met yet') described the staff perfectly. Not only were the girls and guys of the staff really helpful, friendly, and welcoming, (Super special thanks to Jim and Sarah who were really great and showed us nothing but warmth and hospitality the whole time) but the hotel was amazing! We stayed in a private room, so we had our own bathroom. The room was cozy, but very comfortable. The cleaning service was perfect, and our room was always well taken care of. The pool and jacuzzi were phenominal! We could have, without a doubt, lounged by all the beautiful waterfalls, nature, and foliage for the rest of our lives! My boyfriend had to drag me out by the feet when it came time to leave. The pool was just cool enough, and quite refreshing, while the jacuzzi was just warm enough, and the spa settings were INCREDIBLE. I felt like mush (in a good way) when I was done with the massaging water jets. The gazebo in the middle of the courtyard was beautiful. With a palm tree growing through the middle of it, complete with a family of woodpeckers, and a swinging chair you can melt into, the view was great from up there and you could see everything that was going on in the pool area. Happy hour was awesome! There were great drinks and everyone came out of their rooms and got together by the pool. The fish ponds and waterfalls really added on to the tropical paradise atmosphere. After 10, it's quiet time, and the fountains and wildlife is all you can hear. Every day music was playing by the pool which really got us in the tropical mood. The hammocks were sooo relaxing. We especially loved the library portion of the hotel, which is a 'quiet zone'. We lounged on the hammock for hours on end and just cuddled and whispered, sipping on our drinks.... It was really beautiful. Trees canopied over the hammock, leaving just enough shade and allowing sunshine to filter through. Just the sounds of the birds and animals could put you to sleep in no time at all. There were a lot of other hammocks and porch swings located in different parts of the hotel. Everything was great. The whole look of the hotel is so laid back and relaxed. Key West is BEAUTIFUL! We can't wait to go back, and have our little pineapple cup from 'The Cheese Burger' restaraunt on Duval st (Try the MAI TAI drink; the pineapple cup is yours to keep and the drink is GREAT) with the little amount of change we saved up inside it. We're saving for next time around! I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE! I've never had such a beautiful, relaxing time in my life. I don't even want to try anywhere else, with this being our first visit to the Keys. I checked so many hotels out and we kept coming back to Eden. I'm so glad we did. The only bad reviews that I found were ridiculous. Complaining about the noise curfew (Quiet after 10) and room space? Trust us, The noise curfew makes the place enjoyable and lovely for everyone. They aren't incredibly strict, but there is a need for some noise control, as everyone knows :) The rooms vary in size depending on what you pay for. All in all, our trip was awesome, and we can't wait to go back! The only bad part about the trip is that we (well mostly me haha I was tipsy) dropped the camera in the hot tub.... Saved the memory card though! So pictures will be posted! Thanks again Eden House for a great time in Old Key West! (Oh, and they're minutes from Duval and all the touristy attractions) Dalia and Sean

Reviews.Title: “Our little slice of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: JanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We were first timers to Key West and Eden House and both were just wonderful! After days of researching guesthouses, hotels, etc. we kept coming back to Eden House so we booked our room there. It just seemed like such a homey and comfortable place and we were more than pleased with our choice. We traveled with a couple of good friends whom were celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary and we celebrated our 28th as well. After our plane ride to Miami and then taking our time driving down the keys which was a lot of fun, we were ready to relax and enjoy our all too brief stay at Eden House. When we arrived, we were greeted by a a very friendly face at the front desk and were immediately offered a cool and refreshing beverage. We were shown around a bit and then up to our room. We had a nice upstairs apartment with a very spacious bathroom , a full kitchen, television, a queen bedroom area which our companions slept in and a queen sofa sleeper with an air mattress which we slept on very comfortably, a back screened in porch and a private balcony overlooking the pool and jacuzzi. We settled in , put on our swimsuits and barely made the end of happy hour at the pool . We immediately began to socialize and meet some new friends. After a refreshing beverage and a dip in the "Garden of Eden" pool as we called it, we set our sights on exploring our new home away from home for four days and a nice dinner. We went back to the front desk and chatted with the ladies to get the lay of the land and got a complimentary map of Key West to help us guide our way around. Although we had a rental car, we walked most everywhere we went. We were also able to book some activities through Eden House and it was nice to be able to get good feedback on what activities were better than others and get some good recommendations of dining, snorkeling, shopping etc from our hosts at Eden House. This made it nice because we didn't have to waste our time trying to decide on the many activities, restaurants, etc. to choose from and how to get there. The folks at the front desk were always ready to answer questions and offer friendly advice. The walk up to Duval Street was a straight shot up and we walked it easily within 10 minutes. Another nice thing about our location was that it was a lovely stroll past quaint homes, guesthouses, etc. and we were glad that we stayed well off Duval Street which is where the all action is. This made for nice quiet evening strolls back to our little slice of paradise and with the 10PM quiet time a restful sleep too! On our first morning there I got up at my usual early time, and left the other sleepy heads in bed and headed downstairs to a hot cup of coffee and a very cordial greeting from the folks that took such good care of us during our stay. We chatted briefly and I had mentioned some activities we wanted to do and was given a lot of good information to look over. I took my morning coffee out in the lovely gardens and pool area and enjoyed the tranquility of the morning and waking up to face my first day in Key West. I met a four-legged friend, GITMO, the cat and we became fast friends and he met me each morning on my stay. Being an early riser, I watched as the grounds keeper quietly and carefully was already tending to the pool area tidying up the place which he did each day. Soon the other people in our party awoke and enjoyed the same ritual. We scheduled the days trip to go snorkeling and the nice folks at Eden House set up our trip for us so all we had to do is show up! Afterwards we came back to our freshened apartment , changed clothes and struck out for Duval Street and all the shops, restaurants and bars. The walk was pleasant as we passed rows of other nice guesthouses, small homes, cats and chickens (which are everywhere) and even made friends with a local resident parrot. It only takes about 10-15 minutes to get to Duval Street. We were very glad that our guest house and room were at a distance from all the activities on Duval Street. It made for a nice transition and Eden House was just far enough off the beaten path to relish in the quiet morning and evening strolls to and fro. There were other areas nearby that we frequented. Just a few blocks over we found a harbor area with several wonderful restaurants, bars, and boating activities such as sailing, fishing, snorkel trips, etc. . All were within a 5-10 minute walk as well. . We could have rented bikes at Eden House but walking was our choice mode of travel, that way we got to see many of the lovely local homes and beautiful gardens along the way. We came back to Eden House to rest a bit by the pool each afternoon and met new friends poolside for happy hour at 4PM each day and we looked forward to our time just chilling by the pool each day. We had an excellent stay and it far exceeded our expectations. We most definitely will return to Eden House again and again I am sure. All I can say is if you want a little slice of paradise, Eden House in Key West can't be fully appreciated until you go there! Hat's off to all the people that made our stay so much more than just another trip. We found a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “ONE BIG POOL PARTY!”
Reviews.Author: BUGJUICEGIRL
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 4th trip to the Eden House. Our whole vacation is based on the availability there. We always stay with a big group in the Deluxe Conch House. Meeting people by the pool from all over the country and even the UK (Maaark) is what we love about it. We are known for bringing our Jello Shots to share with everyone poolside. This year we served Key West Bug Juice. If you were there then you had some...if you weren't then you missed out and maybe you will catch us next year. We even met a couple that came to the Eden House because she read our review on Tripadvisor.com. She couldn't believe that we were actually there at the same time. It's a wonderful vacation for adults...not kids!

Reviews.Title: “We are hooked!”
Reviews.Author: PermanentTourist
Reviews.Content: This review is long because I will go through everything! This was our first time visiting Key West and we did a lot of research on where to stay and what to do. Had we known Key West was going to be this fun, we would have stayed there for the entire week we were in Florida. Once you set foot in the Eden House, you realize that you want to take a few days and just relax within the gates of the hotel itself without ever leaving! My two friends and I stayed at the Eden House for 4 days in May in room 403 and it was phenomenal. The staff is very friendly, this includes everyone from the front desk to housekeeping and maintenance. The room we stayed in was very clean, comfortable, and had a perfect view. As you go up to the room, there is a covered porch with a table and chairs. We really didnâ€™t use it though because there was a balcony on the other side overlooking the pool and Jacuzzi, making us feel like we were in a presidential suite! Each morning we made plates of fresh fruit for ourselves and had breakfast out on the balcony! The room had a queen bed that was quite comfortable and then a pullout air mattress sofa that was equally comfortable. The entire 4 days we were there, we left the balcony doors wide open, even when we slept, because when you lay on the sofa-bed, you can see the stars and palm trees blowing in the breeze and you can hear the waterfalls. The ambiance was very peaceful. The room had a little living room area that had two chairs and a TV. We put our suitcase in front of the TV because this is paradise and we wanted to be disconnected with the real world while we were here. There is also a kitchenette with a full size (new) fridge, a sink, cabinets, stove, microwave, dishes (although we used our own paper plates and plastic cups), and paper towels. We had fresh towels everyday because Pasha, our housekeeper, was wonderful! She was so sweet and kind. The bathroom was big and I mean huge actually. There was enough room for all three of us to be in there at once doing our hair and makeup. There is plenty of counter space and electrical outlets. The entire room (including the bathroom) has ceiling fans that help move the air because hey, it gets warm, duh! There are also lots of shelves to put your clothes on if you donâ€™t want to live out of your suitcase, along with a hangers and an iron. I really donâ€™t think I can say anything bad about this place, except for those roosters all over the island that donâ€™t know when to shut up!!! Every day I would look at some random rooster (not the hens of course because they were quiet) and threaten to have them for dinner but it apparently didnâ€™t faze them. Oh well. The pool is always the perfect temperature and the Jacuzzi is HOOOTTT which makes it perfect!!!! They are both very clean, as is the entire pool area, including the chairs and decks. If you are planning on sitting out by the pool at night, bring mosquito repellant though. There is a NO NOISE AFTER 10:00 pm policy which you must adhere to. It is for the common courtesy of the other guests. For those who donâ€™t understand this, I suggest they go back to Duval Street and sleep on the street. If you want to bring the party back to your room, donâ€™t. Go back to Duval Street and come back when you are ready to be quiet. Eden House is a quiet (at night) and relaxing place. For those who enjoy noisy and very lively hotels, might I suggest the La Te Da Hotel or anything else on Duval. For those who complain about this policy, why are you staying at Eden House when you know the rules? The hammocks on the property are large and very relaxing! There are plenty of them also! There is a huge list of restaurants in the lobby so check that out if you donâ€™t know where to eat. People who complain about the distance to Duval Street are either in extremely bad shape (and I mean they have emphysema or something) or they are just plain lazyyyyyyy! The distance is a nice 10 - 15minute stroll through the Old Town with beautiful scenery and proper sidewalks to walk on. It also helps that there is a small mom and pop grocery store on the way in case you need something on your way back. Fleming St (where Eden House is located) deposits you right at the hub of Duval Street, where you can find virtually anything you want or need from food to entertainment. Sloppy Joes is to the right, along with Mallory Square and other great places, while the Southernmost Point, the Butterfly Conservatory, and a great pizza place called Upper Crust is on your left. The best thing was that the hotel is only two or three blocks away from the marina! The day we took a day trip to the Dry Tortugas, we took the 5 minute walk over to the docks and it was so easy! The Conch Train is also there so we did that on another day. We rented bikes from Eden House for $7.00 each for a 12 hour rental which was just fine for us. A 24 hour rental was $10. They all have locks which you will need. There are also baskets on the bikes which you can place a purse or map in. We took the bikes over to the Key West Cemetery which was close and we rode through the streets of Old Town which were really beautiful. It is a very pedestrian and bicycle friendly city. The Eden House is a wonderful place to meet new people as well. You always know that people are from out of town but whatâ€™s interesting is that we met people from as far as Switzerland and as close as New York. The people are very friendly around there, so if you end up down there, be nice and say helloâ€¦it doesnâ€™t hurt! We met some wonderful people and quite a few interesting characters at the Eden House. This was the perfect place for us and we will book at the Eden House every time we head back to Key West, hands down. We told our friends and co-workers about Eden House and they loved our pictures and stories so much that five of them have already decided to visit within the next year and stay at Eden House. This isnâ€™t a Marriott or Hyatt so remember that and just relax. If you need super amenities such as a soaking tub or spa, go elsewhere. Otherwise, if you just want a clean, comfortable, beautiful, and relaxing place with reasonable prices, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not A Fan”
Reviews.Author: CTDusty
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews, I expected to have a great time at the Eden House. We stayed for 3 nights. Because we booked so late, our first night was in a small room off of the pool area. The room was tiny. At night the outside lights kept our room light and you could hear everyone pass the room as they came in. The next two nights, we had booked a larger room. We moved rooms mid afternoon, the second day, after the larger room ,an efficiency unit, had been cleaned. We brought our stuff in and we had some food to put in the fridge. The freezer door fell off, it was one of those old fridges, that had an internal freezer door--it was in desperate need of defrosting. Why the cleaning staff didn't notice that before I do not understand. It was also very warm in the room, the airconditioning unit was older and probably not large enough for the space. We called the desk and Jim, the manager came in, he suggested we move to the room downstairs. So he showed us the room, another efficiency unit and we repacked our stuff and lugged everything downstairs. later in the evening when we came home from dinner we watched some television and then noticed that water was dripping from the ceiling--the upstairs freezer was defrosting! We called and the Jim went up there and mopped it up, by the time we woke up, it was no longer raining in our room. We asked Jim if we could check out later because we had a late flight. He said to ask Pasha, the cleaning woman. She said we could stay as late as we wanted and she would just clean the room out the next day. When we went back to the front desk, Jim was gone, and Elizabeth was there she said that we could not do that. We had to be out by 2pm. So we said fine, we're running some errands, we'll come back and be out by 2. When we returned to the hotel at 1, Mike the owner (who never introduced himself to us) was speaking with Elizabeth as we passed through the lobby. The minute we got to our room, Mike called and said we had to be out by 2. We told him we were aware of that. And we were out by 2. I saw no evidence of a friendly caring owner, whose customer's happiness came first. As far as cocktail hour? They put out generic liquor, some mixers and a bowl of pretzels for one hour.
