It was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: CheechWP
Reviews.Content: Goodness gracious, did we have a great time this year. The folks who visit the Eden House are the best people you'll ever meet. Mike and his staff were the greatest and made us feel like we were one of the family. A special thanks to Mike, Jim, and Leon for making our stay extra special! Happy hour is the best. If you book a room here, do not miss the happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “So Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KettnerGirl
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend in Key West and had a great experience @ Eden House. My husband and I took the Ferry from Ft. Myers, so we arrived about 1pm to our room being immediately available. We were in room 105, which is right near the pool. It was clean and cute and all we needed. We enjoyed the pool and sun deck for much of the afternoon (thanks for the cheese Wisconsin Guy!). We had several great meals based on the recommendations found in the little handbook (and also online @ edenhouse website). Just a very nice and peaceful vibe throughout. Loved it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.!”
Reviews.Author: TheEnglishAbroad
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed after reading reviews of this very pleasant hotel. We agree with all the positive comments made and would not be able to find anything negative to say. The room was clean and all in good order. The location is quiet, but with easy access to the main attractions and we found it easy and safe enough to walk around wherever we wanted to go. We liked the friendly nature of the place, the very nice peope that work there and would certainly return if we go the Key West again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Get Back!”
Reviews.Author: le229
Reviews.Content: We stay @ Eden House every year. The day we leave starts the our countdown until we visit again. The entire staff goes out of their way to accomodate. It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay needs cotton sheets”
Reviews.Author: tictoc2
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Eden House ......... Get a feel for the real Key west ........right in the historical part of old town area...........Stagering distance from Mallory Square and Duval..........This place gives you the true feeling that Jimmy and Ernist stayed for ........ You can find a chain hotel anywhere; trust me when I tell you stay in one of these old time inns............This one is made of several old homes sectioned into rooms..........the Houses are connected together with a common garden ,pool, and hammock area .......... tucked away from all the noise when you need it ..............very clean! rooms ........ very cozy as well.......you will not spend time in the room however........... the comon areas have many places to chill and soak in the shade and cool breeze that whips thru the place................CONS The beds need cotton sheets; the dew point gets high and you will know what I mean............ Pro is there are some nice hammocks to sleep in during the day or night...........

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ft Myers, FL and Milford, PA
Reviews.Title: “We go regularly, a great to meet new people!”
Reviews.Author: lilyontheroad
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Eden House 5 times in 2 years and can't wait for our next trip. We have stayed in different rooms/levels each time.... this place has something for everyone! No wonder there are so many of us who return so often! The staff is very friendly, we always feel 'at home' while we lounge by the pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bellkaka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Key West on March 9 and stayed 3 nights at the Eden House. The hotel was fabulous. We checked in early on Friday and made our way down to Duval for lunch. Duval Street is about a 5 block walk through beautiful Old Town neighborhoods. We enjoyed the walk and took a different street each time so that we could explore different areas. The pool area and the hotel grounds are beautiful. The pool is the central area of the hotel and the place to be. At 4:00, the hotel serves complimentary drinks. Everyone comes out for this and we met many other couples at the pool. We were surpised by how many people staying at the Eden House were repeat visitors. Many of them had been there over 5 times and we were introduced to Ira who was in his 20th year of visiting the Eden House. The owner, Mike, is great and came by the pool a couple of times to hang out with his guests. He has owned the hotel since 1975 and was happy to share stories and recommend restaurants. Cafe Med next door was excellent!!! Get the Mushroom Souffle. We were very impressed with the customer service of the front desk and the housekeepers. Our room was a Deluxe, room 205. Small room with a refrigerator and a separate bathroom. Very clean and comfortable bed. We didn't spend much time in the room, though. We rented bikes the third day and rode all through Old Town. We ate breakfast at Blue Heaven, went to the beach at Fort Jackson Taylor, and saw the sunset at Mallory Square. Don't miss the sunset. We can't wait to visit Key West and Eden House again. We wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Hotel par excellence”
Reviews.Author: tripsterCarmel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Edenhouse Hotel a number of times over the last 20 years, and it's amazing how something so good keeps getting better. The hotel is a great place to relax and enjoy Key West. The grounds and pool are so relaxing, and Duval Street is just a couple of blocks away. The staff are great, the pool is great, the price is right. The best place to stay in Key West, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could get married there!”
Reviews.Author: Eric-A95
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous time at the Eden House this winter. My fiancee and I were celebrating our engagement with a getaway and decided on Eden House after comparing several Key West properties online. We got a large deluxe room and were very happy. Our room had two doors out to separate patios. One had a swing and overlooked the street; the other door went directly down to the pool. The pool was lovely - it is well insulated from the street, enclosed by the hotel's several buildings. With all the plant life and shelter, it's like being in a little rainforest. They even had a free happy hour (serve your own) every afternoon. We were only 5 blocks from Duval Street, an easy walk taken several times during our 3-night stay. We would be happy go back there, and as my fiancee says, if it were practical, we would be happy to plan a wedding there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Lush!”
Reviews.Author: karilc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Eden House, along with friends who stayed 4 nights. We had a combination of rooms -- two were the least expensive 'shared bath' category ($135/night), and one Semi-deluxe at $270/night. Eden House is a beautiful place, very well kept up, and the rooms and public areas were immaculate. Beautiful paint on all the woodwork -- everything looked freshly painted in subtle tones of grey, white and light blue, gorgeous pieces of art here and there, and of course the lush plantings, mature palm trees, and waterfalls and water features make this a relaxing and friendly environment. This is a small property, [nothing extravagant here], consisting of a cluster of shuttered and wood-painted buildings that all more or less surround the central pool. It has the feel of visiting well-off friends at a quaint back-yard guest house. Our semi-deluxe room was located in the main building in room 202. This is a beautiful room, and was very spacious, when compared to other rooms in the same category/price range. Other rooms in this range, that we walked by, were about 1/3 smaller, and fronted the long shared porches that faced the pool. We had a semi-private porch that encompassed the entire second story of the front of the Eden House (what you see in photos of the exterior of the building.) This porch was shared with just one other room (201) and it runs the entire length of the building front, so it is spacious enough to feel like your own private porch. We really, really liked having this semi-private area -- coupled with the fact that nobody walks past your door, this was a private space. Spacious large porch with small table, wicker chairs, and a padded chair swing. Our room was tiled with slate/stone, had a large bathroom with shower stall and small fridge and TV. Again, the room was kept immaculate by our friendly housekeeper Leon! The only drawback would be that fronting the road, this porch could be noisy [from street noise, most often in the early mornings] (garbage trucks, street sweepers, etc). We felt that the privacy of the porch and the size of the room made up for this, but this would be personal opinion. I imagine some would prefer a smaller room that looked out on the quieter pool area -- even if people were walking by on the porch. All in all, we liked our porch, though because In the evenings, it was fun to sit on the porch and see the ongoing activities in the town (residential neighborhood, as opposed to looking down over the pool). Also, be aware that there are blinds, and not curtains, so that the room is never very dark. This is true of all of the rooms at Eden House. The bright sun in the a.m. made it tough to sleep in past daybreak. Might want to bring along something like a sleeping mask if you like it very dark or like to sleep in late. Of course, we live in the woods and are used to pitch dark at night, so if you are used to an urban environment, you might not even notice! Our friends were in the shared bath rooms which are a real bargain in Key West! That said, they are indeed very very small (one has a double bed, and one had two twins) and the bathroom was teeny tiny with an old claw foot tub. It was clear these were the original rooms to the property, designed in the days when travelers were not accustomed to the large spaces we see today! These rooms have an older feel -- much like sleepaway camp. If you like the price, don't be scared off though.... they are still quite charming and for the price, a great, great deal! Remember, there is no TV and no fridge in these rooms. [There is a large-screen tv in the lobby.] The layout of the shared bath rooms was not the best for sharing with someone you don't know... the bathroom abutted the rooms very closely!! If with friends, not too bad, however. For a family with kids, it might be just right. The water pressure was not great in this bathroom. The upside to these many caveats is this: right outside the door, literally just steps away, is a hallway shower and hallway bathroom (two separate rooms) so that you can just step outside your door and use these if you prefer more privacy and better water pressure! We liked that these rooms (shower and bathroom) were available to anybody so that if you check out at 11, and have a late flight, you can still shower and freshen up once you've had to give up your room. The grounds are beautiful, and very relaxing. We were there during a busy school holiday, and the only drawback was that we were dismayed by the ongoing practice of "lounge chair saving" that made it a race each day to get the best lounge chair by the pool. Some guests were placing towels and personal items on loungers and then going off for the day!! This rude practice seemed to be just one particular group of visitors, however, and by our last 4 days, there was none of this happening, and chairs at the pool were quite plentiful. There is also a nice sundeck up above, with more chairs (though no shade at all up on this deck) so if you are a sunlover, you can get a chair up on the deck, just a flight of stairs up from the pool. Also, the hammock area is nice, and just to the right of the pool. Shady spot, and big comfy cloth hammocks with pillows attached! Even though EH was at full capacity while we were there, there were so many nooks and crannies, that it never really felt too "busy" or "cramped". There was always someplace to find a shady spot, or private corner. Pool is kept VERY warm. Ranged from 88 to 92 degrees. Hot tub about 100 degrees. Pool floats, etc, were provided -- noodles and such. The BBQ area is great! Eden House provides Charcoal, Lighter Fluid, Tin foil, lighters, clean up pails, and all utensils, so that the only thing you need to provide is your food! This is in a fenced off area, away from the pool, and private, and was kept very neat and clean. There is a full service grocery store just about 10 minutes walk away (Faustos) and several smaller neighbhorhood type groceries are even closer -- though I don't think had fresh meats. We rented bikes on a regular basis from the front desk. Very convenient, and we really enjoyed getting around on these touring style bikes. You leave a $250 CC deposit, and then the reasonable rates are $7 for 12 hours, or $10 for 24 hours, this includes a lock and key. The $250 is not charged to your card, simply kept as a deposit, returned when the bike is returned. (weekly rates are even a better deal) It was nice to have them right at the front desk! At night, we were given flashlights to place in the bike baskets. Front desk staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, and more! Thanks Sarah for all your help! There is no breakfast of any kind at EH, but, coffee and teas and Hot chocolate are available in the lobby. There are many, many restaurants nearby, within walking or biking distance. Location is really great, with a short walk to the docks area -- Key West Bight (including Turtle Kraals, Half Shell Raw Bar, Schooner Wharf Bar) and to Pepe's on Caroline street. About 10 minutes to Duval street if that's your thing. For us, it was not. We preferred the quieter back streets and very "small town" feel of Key West. We loved El Siboney (suggested by the front desk) for their Cuban food. We biked over, waited a half hour out front while sipping home-made Sangria's, and had very reasonably priced meals that were great! Blue Heaven has fab Key Lime pie...and a ping pong table. It would be a bit of a walk... again, those bikes are great! We also biked to Smathers Beach, and down to the Butterfly conservatory on the southernmost point of the island. All in all, we enjoyed our trip to Key West, for it's small town yet semi-urban atmosphere and variety of laid back things to do. Eden House is well placed to take advantage of all the island has to offer. The daily free happy hour was fun for meeting other guests --- this is a low-key affair with gin or vodka in carafes with papered hand-lettered labels "GIN" and "VODKA" -- so don't expect Grey Goose! Also available was Rum, and all the mixers. And of course, that check in beverage of Milwaukee's Best, really sets the stage! This hotel has wide appeal for various types of travelers; even though it is somewhat funky and down-to-earth, it is charming enough that I believe even if you are used to 5 star properties, with more amenities, and bigger rooms, you'll still find this property quaint, and a fun place to stay in Key West!! Note: THERE ARE NO HAIRDRYERS IN THE ROOMS. We have gotten used to not packing these as so many places provide them -- so just note that EH doesn't and bring your own. (Also ---Just a comment on a previous post: We had no problems with noise, nor did we meet any Noise Nazis. We had a group of 5 people, and had no problems sitting by the pool late night (12-1 am) talking quietly and/or swimming)

Reviews.Title: “We'll NEVER go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: TheVaras
Reviews.Content: We have been to Eden House 5 times..1 year we thought we should try another place...but came back here the next year! We plan on coming again this spring....and every spring after! We have always loved the staff and been well taken care of. We have stayed in every room and even the Conch House and have never found any room to be unsatisfactory! The pool is always clean and the place attracts really friendly folks. (which is the TYPICAL Key West regular anyway!...not the snooty!) The perfect location- quiet at night for sleeping...but close enough to Duval St if you can't! Not to mention the fun places a the docks. PS...the staff has recommended and made us reservations at numerous places from private sunset cruises to wonderful dining...even a great bakery. We had 17 folks here last year and all are planning on coming back! Please don't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chris6210
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The girls at the front desk were very helpful in giving advice on where to eat..etc. Free drinks from 4-5 poolside...what more could you ask for! The cleaning woman was extremely sweet along with all members of the Eden House staff. Our room was close to the pool but we actually had our own private deck, table and hammock. The room was huge, the bathroom was ridiculously large, clean and very quaint. My one and only complaint was the noise. Our walls were so thin we could here everything going on in the room next to ours. Don't let this scare you off though...the good far outweighs the bad and I will def. be staying there again! (Just ask for a room on the top floor)

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing”
Reviews.Author: HolsRusWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eden House for a week and loved it.The outside areas are the making of the Hotel, the poolside,porches and hammocks make it the perfect place to chill out and relax.Our room was spacious and comfortable,Pasha was great, really helpful, as were Jim and Jeff. The only thing to let the Hotel down were the girls on reception,there was rarely any eye contact,monosyllabic answers to questions and quite an arrogant attitude.This is a real shame because it's such a gorgeous place.We would definitely go back...Key West is a fabulous place to go,I just really suggest that the girls take some lessons from Jim on making guests feel welcome and valued.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: frankoma
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Eden from Nov. 15 - 19. When I arrived, I informed the staff (quietly) that we were going to Blue Heaven that evening and we would (hopefully) be engaged when we got back. They had a bottle of champagne waiting and two very nice Eden glasses to take with us. Everything at this property is wonderful. We were in 421 which has its own outdoor hot tub and full kitchen. You really get the feel you are at a small grouping of B&B's and you are certainly treated that way. The staff was so nice and helpful that we really hated to leave. I have been to Key West a few times but I will not stay anywhere else but the Eden House. Two thumbs up and thank you for making a special week even more so!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Madgies
Reviews.Content: Arrived after a long flight from London, as soon as we booked in we were offfered a drink which was a nice touch. We were taken to our room and helped with the luggage. Fantastic room overlooking the pool and spa. It was one of the most beautiful places we have ever stayed in. The room was big with a lovely bathroom and small kitchen area, sitting on the balcony was a pleasure. Just a short walk away from busy Duval St made the location perfect. The staff were friendly and the whole place had a great atmosphere. We wish we could have stayed longer and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: jayjaymag
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two days at Eden House and I was upset to read some of the negative reviews posted here. We found the Eden House nice and friendly and quiet. Key West is a party town toward Duval Street, but once you get a few blocks away into the residential area it can be kicked back and peaceful. Eden house has a very good location. It is in the Old part of town and within walking distance of the action of Duval Street but far enough away to be quiet at night. Yes the rooms are small. I found that at this end of town, even the Hilton has small rooms and they are double the price. My room was very clean and the tiny bathroom seemed fairly new. The front porch was a nice place to kick back in a rocker and read and relax. The pool was inviting and the staff was friendly. The night man fussed over me when I got up very early one morning and came into the lobby for coffee, trying to turn on lights and get me more coffee and in general making me feel very pampered. This is not a chain hotel. There are plenty of them to choose from if that is the experience you want. This is an old and I think charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinion - Room/Staff vs Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TheReviewer
Reviews.Content: I have mixed opinions about this guest house and will probably try elsewhere next time I visit Key West (if only becuase life is too short to experience an average stay). I will start with the good points: Location - although a healthy walk from Duval Street, it is in a lovely quiet residential area, and the walk is great if you want to absorb the local architecture. Atmosphere - the "communal areas" of the house were lovely, from the nice pool, to the hammocks, to the hot tub, to the verandas of the ground floor rooms. Typically Key West and very quaint. Parking - free on-site parking, what more can I say. Now, sadly there are bad points: Room - small, cramped, in need of refurbishment. There was a very large fridge in the corner of the room (we are not talking mini bar size, we are talking ~4 foot high) which dwarfed the room, and there was some very strange furniture piled up in another corner. On entering, it felt like they had put us in the store cupboard. Large bathroom though (if basic) - but also in need of some investment. Staff - I have to admit, there was a girl who worked there who seemed lovely, but she did not deal with us. Instead, the girl on reception on our visit was simply atrocious. She was surly, disinterested, and never once smiled. The other member of staff I have cause to complain about was the maid - she was hurrying us to leave and check out of our room, even though it was one and a half hours before check out time - not good Noise - our room was right next to the hot tub, and when people are enjoying themselves in the hot tub into the early hours, you lie in bed hearing every word spoken (plus other stuff). And whilst we are talking hot tubs, here is the one thing I will remember this guest house by - the hot tub contained so much bleach that our swim suits came out white, from vivid blue and pink. This was in only a 20 minute dip. The said surly girl on reception barely grunted when we told her on checking out, and I couldn't bring myself to make a fuss. However, since the bleach had totally ruined our swim costumes, I felt compelled to complain once I retumed home. It took numerous emails before Eden even replied to me, but eventually, after some negotiation, they did compensate us financially. A very nice staff member dealt with my complaint very well in the end, and with good grace, but it didn't happen quickly. Price - I have come to price last, because of course it is a case of whether good value was obtained. Ignoring the mishap with the bleach, and ignoring the staff concerns, I believe it to be a little over-priced, but only a little (I paid US$250). In summary, a guest house I don't think I will forget, purely for it's nice asthetics (and of course the bleach thing), but the room let it down a bit too much, and the selection of staff is clearly not great in some areas. I have given it 2 stars, as I think there were more bad points than good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ray-&-Steph
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the Old Town, a short walk away from Duval St.. Warm friendly enthusiastic reception from Maggie (with a cool beer). Loft Apartment had kitchen, upstairs bedroom, overlooking pool. Free Happy Hour from 4 pm to 5 each day. Sooo relaxing!!! Lay by the pool or catch some shade reading in the hammocks. A few fantastic restaurants within 4 blocks. Parking to ditch the car. Just perfect. THANK YOU EDEN HOUSE STAFF. Ray & Steph

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing and Charming”
Reviews.Author: josey66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had planned a short weekend R&R in Key West and was looking for a nice place to stay that was not the chain hotel. Based on this website we found Eden House and we were glad we did! If you are looking for luxury accomodations then go someplace else but if you want a laid back, "don't worry - be happy" type of atmosphere then this is the place in Key West. Rooms are small but very clean but who goes to Key West to sit in a hotel room? A great pool, good people and very relaxing atmosphere in a lush tropical garden setting. Far enough off Duval not to hear the noise and a 15 minute walk to all attractions. What else can you ask for? We enjoyed it so much that we have planned a return weekend trip only 4 weeks after our first! Complaint Section: None worth mentioning. (Ok....the orange juice needed to be refreshed at the free serve yourself happy hour!!!)...

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time at Eden House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our 3rd trip to Eden House and as always, staying at Eden House was a pleasure. The staff goes out of their way to ensure you have a good time and are always willing to help you find a great restaurant or book a trip for you. The grounds are kept in immaculate shape and the Eden House always provides a sanctuary from the craziness that can be Key West. We are already looking forward to our next trip to Key West and the Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Horror”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a way to start a honeymoon. We arrived at the Eden House and was told room was not paid in full (mother-in-law had pre-paid). We paid balance. We got to our room and it was so small that we could not fit any of our luggage in it. The sink was in the room next to the bed. The bathroom was so small the toilet paper holder was five feet off the floor. Upgraded to a better room and paid again. Opps!! the room was paid for. Opps!! mother-in-law did pay for it. Opps!! the front desk lied. No apologize, except for sorry about that. Was recommended to Eden House. Would never stay again! Liked review from 4/06. Eden House found out they were on honeymoon and got free upgarde and champagne, all I got was sorry we don't do that here. I guess that was another lie too.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went out of their way”
Reviews.Author: pirtpirt
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending Memorial Day weekend at Eden House. Our stay was very enjoyable, but what pleased us most is how the staff went out of their way to correct a problem and then compensated us for our inconvenience. The first night we were there we returned to our room after dark to find flying bugs attracted to the lights within the room. Not a major problem, but certainly an inconvenience. We turned out the lights and the bugs were no longer a problem. They must have gone to sleep as well. The next morning we mentioned it to Diane at the front desk. She was very apologetic and offered us another room which we declined. WIthin an hour a man came to spray and the maid came to clean up the mess. This was all we requested. But Diane insisted upon refunding the money we paid to rent bikes, allowing us to ride for free for two days. When we returned to our room that afternoon there was a bottle of champaign in the fridge with two complimentary glasses. Finally, when we checked out the management offered to discount the price we had paid to rent the room. We told them that this was too generous but they insisted. This attitude of treating everyone right permeates the entire staff and we would certainly stay at Eden House on our next trip in Key West and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't even remember how I found the Eden House on line when booking...but we definitely lucked out!!! This was our first visit to Key West and my husband and I loved every minute. The pool, hammick, sundeck, porches, and trees in the Eden House common area were wonderfully relaxing. Simple and pleasant. Everything was super clean..the complimentary happy hour from 4-5 was a nice touch...and the staff were so friendly. We left for breakfast and before noon our rooms was cleaned, nice surprise. Yes, the rooms are small...but who cares, comfy beds, nicely AC'd, with ceiling fan. It's a nice 10 minute or less walk to Duval, located in a pleasant area of town. My husband and I are in our 20's and can appreciate the rowdiness of Duval at night...but we're glad we were staying a few blocks away. :) We came over memorial day weekend an appreciated that there wasn't a "three day minimum" when booking and the rates were very comparable to other places (Word to the wise...driving back on Memorial Day Monday was loooong, lots of traffic, plan for it!). We're going to come back next Memorial Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say....RELAXING?”
Reviews.Author: Urbanchik
Reviews.Content: My husband and i loved the Eden House because after a long, stressful drive, and the stresses of life that drove us to book this mini-vacation, we were finally able to relax. I can't remember the last time I was so relaxed. The previous reviews were right on the money. Eden House is a clean, beautiful, quiet, laid-back, and super friendly hotel. The beds were also super comfortable. Basically, we felt very welcome and immediately comfortable. It was also one of the lowest priced hotels in town, which is why I was slightly leary when booking, despite the positive reviews. But we were not disappointed one bit during our stay and we will not even consider another hotel for our next visit. After the chaos of Duval Street, we came back to the hotel around 11 and stopped at the market on our walk back and brought back a bottle of wine. We hung out of our porch for the next couple of hours, enjoying the wine while snuggling in the comfortable swing right right outside the door. What a way to enjoy the evening! Eden House is a very charming hotel - the rooms feature wood ceiling, tiled floors, there are hammocks and trees everywhere. If you want to really experience Key West, then stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was just the room we were given. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable, but there was very, very little space. Not much surface space. The sink was a free standing one next to the bed - the toilet had a separate section, and the shower had a separate section. First floor, just to the right of the door from the reception area, facing the pool. The air conditioner worked great. At night, the area was very quiet. Perhaps had we had a larger room, with a bathroom that wasn't "in" the room and some more surface for toiletries, etc., we would have been happier. In all, it was friendly and funky and possibly our expectations of a B & B in Key West were inaccurate.

Reviews.Title: “An Appropriately Named Guest House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If there wasn't someone named Mike Eden (and not having met him, I can't prove there is), Eden House would still deserve the name because of its similarity to that Biblical place from which Adam and Eve were booted. This isn't hyperbole: Eden House is unique in that everthing seems right. It's difficult to imagine how one could improve the place. Okay, there are a few things and I'll deal with them first. The official explanation for the shelving for your clothes instead of bureaus with drawers is because of the humidity. Maybe so, but more shelves would be helpful, particularly if you're traveling further on after your Key West stay, as we were. A few extra hooks in the bathroom would assist with wet bathing suits, bath towels, etc. And the morning person staffing the desk should be assured that smiling or otherwise acknowledging her guests is not fatal. Perhaps she's not a morning person, and that's why they've put her on duty when guests won't be checking in. And that's it for the nitpicking. Everything else is exactly as it should be. Eden House is a short distance from Duval Street, the historic seaport, Mallory Square, and plenty of memorable restaurants. But with its shaded hammocks, excellent if modestly-sized pool (which is uniquely landscaped and actually better than it looks on their website), jacuzzi, and gardens that surround guests with tropical atmosphere, Eden House is itself an attraction. You'll be surprised at how enlightening lying in a hammock watching the courtship of lizards on a palm tree can be. Keep in mind, however, that Eden House is not really designed for the young and rowdy. While the proprietor's request for quiet at nighttime might be construed as an impediment to fun by spring breakers, it didn't cramp our style in the least. We had our fill of that type of diversion on and around Duval Street, and appreciated the quiet serenity of relaxing in the jacuzzi after a busy day of sightseeing and barhopping. Although the pool and jacuzzi are officially closed after 10 p.m., they'll permit later swims if you promise to be quiet. "If we can't hear you, we can't see you" is how the sign reads. Heck, they'll even hand you a towel! Our room was on the second floor, and it featured a porch swing outside the door and a good view overlooking Fleming Street. We've stayed in larger hotel rooms, but they weren't in Key West and they weren't at the reasonable price we paid for this one. I'm sure there are fancier accommodations in Key West with bigger rooms and the sterile environment of a chain hotel, but if you stay at one of those you'll be missing the true flavor of this unique island. Eden House gets it just right.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quaint with a delightful open bar happy hour.”
Reviews.Author: domyownstunts
Reviews.Content: Cozy place. We keep coming back for more. Convenient location for walking down to Duval, Mallory Square or the Marina.

Reviews.Title: “A wee gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: wallaceman38
Reviews.Content: I walked into the hotel and once i had booked in, i was given a free drink on the house, a very nice touch that doesnt happen that much. the room was great with very good air con. The whole place is perfect and the best bit it is a ten minute walk from duval st, you dont want to stay close to duval or you woudn't get any sleep!! Bars are open to 4am! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going. Mike Dow

Reviews.Title: “The true way to relax”
Reviews.Author: trainerbryce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Eden house once a year for the past seven years. Our stays have ranged in length from three to six nights in length.I can say, without a doubt, that we can't wait to return this year for our longest stay of eight nights. I have visited over 35 states and hundreds of hotels and I can say this is the most unique, relaxing hotel experience there is. The Eden house is not a five star resort or even pretends to be one, but is the perfect embodiment of the Key West style. The staff is the most friendly and helpful I have ever interacted with and they make you feel just like one of the gang. Mike (the owner) visits with geusts and takes a keen interest in helping you forget the outside world. On one occasion when they found out my wife was pregnant they suprised us with a painting of the Eden house, two wine glasses and a bottle of apple cider. The rooms are some of the cleanest and are designed to help you relax and feel as if you are a part of the tropical landscape. They are somewhat small, but you can stay in your room at home. The hot tub, pool , hammocks, water falls and gazebo can relax some of the most stressed out proffesionals (trust me, I married one). The Eden house is a great place to meet people from all the world and enjoy a conversation by the pool. Its location lends to a quiet feel, but is close enough to Duval if the party urge hits you. the Eden house is also very close to a few great restaraunts. If you love your plasma TV, Blacberry and jet set lifestyle this is not the place for you, but if you want to unwind this is the ultimate place in all of Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbc1717
Reviews.Content: I am sitting at the front of the Eden House right now using their free internet. This place deserves its #3 tripadvisor rating. The hotel is very clean and the service is excellent. Their is a free parking lot, which is a big advantage in this town. Once you are parked, you can get anywhere on foot. The location is excellent. It's enough off the beaten path to be quiet but it's a very short walk to the action on Duval Street. Free happy hour from 4-5 at the pool is a nice touch. Tons of nice hammocks and chairs around the beatiful property to relax. I actually had Maggie, an employee here, perform a marriage ceremony for us and it was excellent. This is a real easy way to cur down on wedding stress but it's memorable at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “What A Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MrsEML
Reviews.Content: What a perfect relaxing way to unwind after planning a wedding for over a year and getting married! It was a dream! Hammocks EVERYWHERE!!!!! The staff found out it was our honeymoon they upgraded our room and they brought us champange. It was close to Duval Street but not too close that you could hear the noise and the music. It was perfect we will be going back in Aug for our 2 year anniversary!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden House over 2006 St Patricks Weekend Celebrations. I cannot fault the hotel, its as described on their website. Clean, standard accomodation in great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I hope they get paid well, because they do an excellent job. We stayed in 2 adjoining semi private rooms. These rooms suited us perfectly, yes the bathroom is a tad small, but its sufficient for anyone. The grounds of the hotel were soo beautiful, the pool and hottub were lovely and the hammocks added a very romantic touch to the hotel. The rate i paid was very fair, especially for the time of the year. Noone going to this hotel would be disappointed. It will be my first stop the next trip to key west!!!!!! Thanks Eden House for an amazing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected from other reviews .......”
Reviews.Author: JohnPhilipEllis
Reviews.Content: Eden House is a good 10-15 minute walk to Duval Street, but has the benefit of a quiet location. My room was very clean but small and spartan for $220 per night plus tax. The staff were very helpful with lots of useful insider knowledge, but their restaurant recommendations were a bit downscale. I'd go for Sarabeth's on Southard St. for excellent food and great service. Pool area was OK and the hammocks are a nice touch. The lack of breakfast means you have to go out every morning and is a bit of a pain. The happy hour from 4-5 is offered in lieu and is OK too - just spirits and mixers. Would I stay again? I'll probably try somewhere a bit more central next time, but wouldn't be upset if I had to come back to Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Fate works in mysterious ways”
Reviews.Author: midnightrider99
Reviews.Content: On a whim, I and my girlfriend decide to head out to Key West. Since it was very last minute our hotel options were very limited as most places were booked solid. At first we stayed at the Days Inn in Key West but it wasnâ€™t helping our idea of a spontaneous romantic getaway place to stay (see my review). So we packed up and went else were. The Eden House was the only hotel that had an availability that was one the Tripadvisor top 10. We stayed in the Loft Deluxe for $325 a night. When we checked in the staff was very friendly and I felt as though I was an old friend. They offered me and my girlfriend a cold can of Milwaukieâ€™s Best, which was a welcome relief from the heat. They showed us to our room and it had its own private hammock and was very spacious, clean, and secluded. Even though we didnâ€™t do much sleeping, the area was always very quite and allowed us a quite night/day sleep. We had a kitchenette and a full sized fridge which we promptly filled with beer. The staff was very friendly and I was never disappointed with any of their recommendations. They were also more than willing to make the reservations for us. Our room was also very clean and large. At 4 oâ€™clock by the pool, there were free drinks which made for great pre-evening events. I was sad to leave Key West and the Eden House. When I come back to Key West, I plan to stay at the Eden House and recommend you do too. If you canâ€™t have a good time in Key West you canâ€™t have a good time anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Eden House! While the trip started out a little rough, with no luggage for 2 days, the staff at Eden House made us feel at home. Cheyenne took on the chore of getting us set up with a kayaking trip. Dan was a great help in trying to deal with Delta. The guests, many who had been coming to Eden House for years, were most helpful and welcomed us warmly. Mike is charming and has created a little paradise. The whole place is spotless. We did not mind the small room and heard little or no noise the whole week we were there. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House - A little piece of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to the Eden House 13 times over the last 10 years and we intend to keep going back at least once every year. With that in mind, my review of the Eden House may be a bit biased, but the Eden House has EARNED my high recommendation over the last 10 years! The Eden House is a charming Key West guest house and is centrally located in Old Town Key West. We do not use a car while we are at the Eden House because everything is within walking distance. If you wish to use a bike to get around, the Eden House has them for rent. Guests of the Eden House should not expect a five star hotel, but you will enjoy the laid back style, mingling with the other guest at a daily happy hour, the large hot tub, the peaceful hammock area with a waterfall, and the well cared for grounds. The housekeeping is excellent and the people at the front desk can provide information on where to go and what to see while in Key West. Make sure to chat with Mike Eden, the Eden House owner for the last 30 years, because he is a great source for Key West information. While in Key West, make sure to see the Hemingway House, The Key West Lighthouse, The Butterfly Conservatory is a must for nature lovers, and check out Fort Zackary Taylor. I highly recommend a trip to Blue Heaven for an outdoor breakfast experience. Lastly, make sure to see the sunset from Mallory Square; for an experience you will not forget! My wife and I highly recommend the Eden House and Key West for those who wish to enjoy a relaxed Caribbean island atmosphere without ever leaving the United Sates. The Eden House has been our little piece of Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “noisy nights, not too clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay based on reviews I read at this website and based on price and availability. The rooms vary in size and age. There are four reasons I would not return: 1) Lots of noise at night - our friends in another suite were kept awake by some people who stayed up all night (they apparently trashed the room and may have had a criminal background). We were awakened a few times by what sounded like a wrestling match upstairs, and then at 4:30 by some people leaving their room with all their luggage. The walls and floors are paper thin. When we complained, they moved us to a "deluxe" room (meaning TV & minifridge), but we were still hearing party noise until midnight. 2) They would not let us alter our reservation so we could get out of there a day early. They require something like 20 days notice. Their info says they will offer a full refund if you were not satisfied, but this was just a case where we wanted to shorten our stay. They were inflexible. 3) The second room they put us in was so small there was not enough room to open a suitcase unless it was on the bed. We had to unpack and put our clothes on the dusty sticky shelves. My daughter slept on an air mattress wedged between the bed and the fridge. 4) The rooms are not very clean. The tub and shower tiles looked grimy and when I wiped the bathroom floor with a baby wipe, it was black with dirt. We had to clean the shelves before putting our clothes on them. I could smell the rotting dumpster from my balcony. Downtown Key West is one of the dirtiest cities I have ever been in, judging by the soles of my shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, not loved it...”
Reviews.Author: RakkmUp
Reviews.Content: The Eden House certainly had a great atmosphere but our room was simply average. The room and property in general was very clean and we enjoyed the free happy hour drinks. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite (deluxe conch?) but beware that one of the bedrooms has no view whatsoever (unless you enjoy a restaurant rooftop and its associated equipment as well as a parking lot and its associated dumpsters). Unfortunately, the A/C units or pumps of some kind were quite noisy and prevented us from having a total quality sleep that we had hoped for. They also forced us to not use the bedroom's balcony...it was way too noisy. The other bedroom was very lovely and had a great balcony (with a nice, cushioned swing) overlooking Margaret St. The bathroom had pretty lame water pressure for the shower but we accepted that with no problem. Note that the door to this bathroom is not a standard door, rather a two piece door and we felt that it lacked privacy because it was right next to the "living room" with the TV, and you can hear everything. The fact that the Eden House has free wi-fi was what sealed the deal for us to book there. We were extremely disappointed though when we tried to use it for two days but it was flat out not working. On all occasions that we advised the front desk, they had no idea in how to assist in trying to resolve it. Take note that we did follow the explicit instructions that were provided on how to access their wi-fi yet it failed everytime we tried to access it - in the pool area and in the lobby area. We were very pleased with the location as it was very walkable to the Schooners Wharf area as well as Duval St. We even walked to and from the Hemingway House. Parking was tight but not a problem for us. All in all, I feel that we paid too much, however, it was a good deal (pricewise) compared to booking elsewhere because it was a two bedroom suite that 4 of us were able to share. We did stay somewhere else on our last trip to Key West and liked it alot better. In our opinion, the Eden House is an acceptable place to stay, however, we would probably look elsewhere when it comes to looking for Key West accommodations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Jambero
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden House this past weekend with a friend and chose this guest house because it did not have a 4-night minimum this time of year like some of the other and much nicer gay B&Bs right nearby on the same street. The surroundings are pleasant, the staff is very friendly, as is the owner, Mike, but the room we were in with two twin beds left a lot to be desired. It was very small, dark and spartan and the bathroom amenities totally lacked in privacy, particularly if you are not rooming with a partner or spouse. The pool area was quiet and relaxing with friendly guests, but the happy hour was low-budget. The porch is prime kick-back and relax territory with very comfortable chairs. A nice continental breakfast instead of just coffee and tea would have made up for the room. Probably would not stay here again unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Spot Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent, rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. We stayed at The Eden House for our Honeymoon and would recommend it to anyone who loves the local atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, grounds; rooms, ok”
Reviews.Author: jlm30
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the EH over New Years and had a great time! The pool area is wonderful. There was so much to do while we were there, but every time we were out and about, I wanted to go back to lay by the pool. My favorite part of the day was lounging in the hammock area. I fell asleep there many a time. The staff was always willing to help you out/give advice. Luther at the front desk was really helpful and friendly. Location was excellent--walked everywhere, so no need for a car. My boyfriend was a little taken aback by the size of our room (small and shared a bathroom in the hallway). But we did book the cheapest room possible. I could have cared less. The grounds made up for it. My only complaint was that the sun set too darn early (around 5:30) so we had to leave the pool area early to get a good spot at La Concha Hotel. Mike Eden, could you remedy this for our trip next year over NYE? Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The Eden House is Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Nukefamily
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the front porch of the Eden House (wi-fi, just one of the many reasons to choose the Eden House). This is my second stay, in as many years, at the Eden House. I am in Key West because I wanted my youngest daughter, Kelci, 17, the only true native Floridian in the family, to see the Island for the first time. I chose the Eden House because I had such a great experience the last time I stayed here. So here's my review: Pros: 1) The Hammocks (library). 2) The staff could not be more friendly and helpful. 3)Hot coffee 24/7. 4)CLEAN rooms and beautiful, well kept grounds. 5)Parking. 6)Location. 7)Wi-fi(free), from our room in the main house, the lobby and the front porch. 8) Free happy hour every day 4-5 (you fix your own drinks, alcohol and mixers by the pool). Cons: 1)The buildings can be noisy in the morning after 900 (with cleaning and such). 2) The street (Fleming) tends to be busy, sometimes with big delivery trucks and noisy scooters. It can make for a not so pleasant front porch spot (I used an Mp3 player very successfully to block out any unpleasant noise). 3) The wi-fi can't be picked up out back, where it is quiet, by the hammocks or pool, much to my daughter's dismay. Overall, It is the best place I have stayed on the Island and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Old hotel,slightly off the beaten path, small rooms, but very clean. Staff where good, cute too! Bike rentals are great, pool makes it, with all night swims and some crazy sights! Also sun deck had some winners! A little pricey for what you get, I would probably try another hotel! Front desk day staff needs to get act together!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: arthi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to visit Key West from November 3 â€“ November 9. We had been to Key West as a part of a cruise in January and loved it so much we thought we would return. Spending only part of a day there we were unable to find a place we would definitely want to stay at when we returned. Instead we relied on the reviews at Tripadvisor. We are both glad we did. The Eden House lived up to the reviews and then some. If you are looking for the Ritz-Carlton this is not the place for you. Luckily we were not looking for the Ritz-Carlton. Vacationing in Key West is about the fun and sun coupled with the quaint shops and the happy-go-lucky residents. The Eden House epitomizes all of these things with its pool surrounded by palm trees and small bungalow-type rooms complete with patios and hammocks. We stayed in room 422 as it was one of the only two-bedroom units available in the hotel. This room was the upstairs portion of their newest addition to the Eden House complex. The rooms were absolutely spotless and Posha, our maid, made sure it remained that way for the entire week we stayed. If we were to stay again we would probably request room 501 (downstairs) or 502 (upstairs) as they seemed to have some of the prettiest views of the grounds. The entire staff was extremely friendly and always willing to suggest places to go and restaurants to eat at (which were never a disappointment). Location was also very convenient. Although most anything in Key West is convenient with the island being only 2 miles by 4 miles. Eden House is only 4 or 5 blocks off of Duvall Street and a only a short distance from the Wharf and the northern end of Old town which includes Mallory square (donâ€™t miss the sunset here). The Eden House definitely lives up to all of the wonderful reviews that are here on Tripadvisor. Some of the things that are a must see/do in Key West are happy hour at the Rooftop CafÃ©, sunset from the roof of the Conch Hotel (Duvall Street), and Fort Zachary State park (beautiful beach).

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great. Would definitely go again!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House in May 2004 (yes, I know I'm late, but I've had a baby since!) as we went out to Key West to get married there, so the trip was our weddingmoon, I think it's called. All the dealings we had with the front desk before we arrived were pleasant and helpful and certainly nothing like has been mentioned of other reviews. We chose to stay in the Conch House downstairs and it was fab. Plenty of room for us. My only criticism of this, if I had one is that the bedroom overlooks a street and once or twice, someone came flying down the road at 4am in cars with music blaring full blast - but that's not Mike's fault. The staff we found could not do enough for you. The night before we were due to get married, my husband's leg swelled up due to some infected sandfly bites and it was pretty worrying. They recommended a doc to us, who came to see my husband and prescribed antibiotics. We had dinner in the Cafe Med that night, having already eaten there once and Debra managed to fit us in somewhere that my husband could put his leg up even though they were pretty busy. We thought that the location was pretty damned perfect - not right on Duval Street so quiet, but easily walkable to most places. All in all, I'd go again in a heartbeat - if it weren't for the fact we have a baby and another on the way!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is the Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This past April was our fourth stay at Eden House (celebrating 50th Birthday) and once again we just loved it. It is charming,very comfortable and most importantly the staff is great. We cannot wait till our next trip. We think of it as our little "piece of paradise". It is also in our favorite part of town! Annie & Kurt (I love the book exchange!)

Reviews.Title: “Finally after Ivan Left us stranded 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We finally got to do our Girls Only family trip to Key West. It was a trip well worth waiting for. My two daughters, granddaughter and myself had a beautiful trip. We stayed in 402 an apartment that slept 4 with a huge bathroom. A dream for 4 women living in close quarters. The shower would have held at least 3 of us. Club Med was a wonderful, well run restaurant and the food excellent. We unfortunately didn't meet the owner, who I understand usually attends Happy Hour. The staff was very attentive to our needs. Anything we needed they supplied, from transportation to instructions on how to find someplace. I know my daughters plan to go back. I would probably do so myself, if I can. Even the loss of power was an interesting occurance, as we were on top of the LaConcha Hotel watching the sunset. They did have power for the elevators, so no problem. There was a huge traffic jam on Duval after the Coast to Coast Conga Line - red lights were out. Taxis were fast in coming, as at my age long walks in the hot weather are not advisable. The Eden House complex was up to all the rave revues written about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden Houe”
Reviews.Author: dealer9296
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pier House, Banyon House, Ocean Key and now the Eden House. We enjoyed the Eden House over the others and plan to return in October. We stayed in room 114 with a porch and swing......the room was like new. This was a perfict trip. We took our bicycles and road all over the the island......and then returned to relax in a rocker on the Hotel's front porch, under the ceiling fans. It was great. Thanks to all at Eden House, see ya again later, glenda and al Deerfiled Bch, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eden House June 13th-18th. We enjoyed the grounds, pool and happy hour. From some of the reviews, we were worried about the room size. We stayed in #201 in the main house and it was perfect for us. It had 2 entrances - one with direct access to the pool area, the other leading out to a balcony overlooking the street with a "sort of" private sitting area. From reading the reviews we expected the staff to be much more friendly than they were (maybe it was the extreme heat), although, we didn't encounter any rudeness. The really outstanding part of our stay at Eden House was the 2 meals we had at their restaurant, Club Med. The food was delicous and the service superb - even during the power outage Friday night, our food was prepared perfectly to order and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs way Up!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobskamato
Reviews.Content: At first, when we arrived here, I was not that impressed with the exterior and lobby of the hotel. I thought to myself that we got had. However, with no doubts, the rest of the establishment was great. The customer service was second to none from the second that we got in. They let us check in a couple hours early too. We were in Room 501, which is large deluxe room. You can get a virtual tour of it on their website and I highly recommend it. Plenty of room for two with all the amenities you need...even had a blender!!! Pool area was great and had a pretty good happy hour from 4-5pm. Hammocks were also good. Pool area stays open all night too which was nice on two separate occasions after late dinners. The big "kicker" was that as we left for the airport...Mike Eden helped load the cab! You dont find an owner who does that too often! I am getting married on the island in April and I plan to have this as one of my guests options, most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Expected More...”
Reviews.Author: dehamoib
Reviews.Content: I booked the Eden House based off the reviews that I found. I arrived in Key West with my group and was sort of disappointed. I booked rooms that included private baths but when we arrived we were placed in rooms that we had to share a bathrooms! In these sharing rooms - the room is quite small and the sink is right next to your bed. I work in hospitality and felt that the rooms that we ended up in were a bit overpriced for what we got. I was expecting a bit more - but all that we got was just the room and nothing else. The staff was friendly but not as much as I was expecting (based off of the reviews written). My husband and I love Key West and will probably look to other lodgings when we return the next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great Key West experience”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: Eden House is a fine place to stay. So why don't we rate it 5 stars? Because the basic rooms -- the ones that are around $110 a night in low season-- are tiny, perhaps 9x12. The bathroom consists of a toilet and a shower stall and is unventilated, so it is really hot in there. And when you call to book a room like this, they tell you it has a porch overlooking some area of the grounds. You start thinking you'll walk from your room to your own porch and sit quietly, looking at the grounds. What you actually have is a porch that serves as the second floor walkway as well as a place to sit. Not too private, and it is perhaps that misunderstanding that leads to disappointment among some guests. This point aside, the rooms are spotless. The grounds are beautiful, and include a fine pool and whirlpool. The management recognizes that sometimes a late night swim is in orer, so you can use either pool or whirlpool any time, as long as you're quiet. There's a happy hour with free drinks presided over by owner Mike Eden every day, so you get to socialize with other guests. The staff could not be more helpful and considerate. And the hotel itself is one of those sprawling Key West places, added onto over the years, with a charm all its own. We visited the room of other guests who (obviously) paid more than we did. It was a luxurious suite, beautifully laid out and very comfortable. We would definitely return, but we'd move up at least one notch in room quality.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Going Back...”
Reviews.Author: flaknitter
Reviews.Content: My mom and I are getting ready for our third annual visit to Eden House. Every summer when it's hotter than an oven in Key West, we head down for the long drawn out sunsets, leisurely walks and days by the pool at Eden House. We stay in room 112, the only room with two beds, and even though my mother snores and I have to wear earplugs, we wouldn't have it any other way. Eden House is exactly the way Mike posted it in the description - clean, quaint, private and friendly. It can get a bit rowdy poolside, depending on who the guests are - the first day of the first year we were there, some young moms and dads away from their kids were drinking all day long and got a little silly, but since they were all probably passed out by 7:00 and gone the next day, it's easy to overlook. Had it been a real problem, we would have felt comfortable informing the staff, who I'm sure would have taken care of the issue most diplomatically. The distance from Duval and Mallory Square allows for a nice stroll in the evening. If you're looking for a great dinner right around the block, visit Michael's and sit in the courtyard, if it's not too hot. The only odd thing about Eden House is the music by the pool - the same song is played twice in a row, every song! I don't know if this is intentional or not, but it's definitely unusual. Have a great visit - you won't go wrong with Eden House...

Reviews.Title: “May 26-31”
Reviews.Author: Reelgal
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research and upon recommendation by family member, chose The Eden House. We chose a small, but adequate room (#215). Room was clean, except for two areas: toilet needs a good scrubbing and our blanket was soiled, which I didn't notice until 3 days into our stay. No other issues. The tropical gardens at The Eden House are amazing. Flowers, bushes, trees really make the place a tranquil haven. Pool and surrounding area kept very nice. We didn't partake in daily complimentary happy hour. The Eden House was quite full during our stay, due to the holiday weekend. Previous reviews mention the hushing of loud guests. Not this time. There were private parties going on at the pool late hours each night. Perfect weather, upper 80s-low 90s with not a rain drop. Rented bikes from The Eden House, rode down to Southernmost Point. Spent a few hours poolside at Atlantic Shores. Went on a half-day fishing boat, Tortuga. Wished we could have done that again. Great meals at El Meson de Pepe (Cuban), Jamaica Me Hungry (Jamaican), fish & chips at Crabby Dick's, and the best meal, by far, at Conch Republic. Daily happy hour and raw oysters at Half Shell Raw Bar. Also visits to Schooner's Wharf, Monty's, and Turtle Kraals. Watching the Minimal Regatta at Schooner's Wharf on Sunday was lots of fun. Caught sunset celebrations at Mallory Square, walked Duval St. every night. Stops at Sloppy Joe's, Fat Tuesday's. T-shirt from Hog's Breath. Long walk back, but definitely do-able. Had a great time, but 4 days was enough. Would I go back? Maybe - to fish more, and next time I'd check out the other hotels & inns while there to see what they offer, while staying at The Eden House, of course. I would definitely recommend The Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “eden house was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: carlawed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden house with two other couples last december. This place is smaller, more private, relaxed and beautiful. Rooms are small so be prepared for that. You may feel cramped in a regular small sixed room. One of our couples actually got a bigger room once we were there. There is no tv in the small rooms and the bathroom,shower, and sink are all in a seperate spot in the room. May bother some, but we didn't care. We came in late at night and were a bit loud, hotel staff didn't like that, this is a quiet hotel at night. But of course there were six of us all coming in drunk and loud. Hotel staff was always friendly and helpful though. We go to Key West about once a year and would stay here again. The pool is pretty, they have a hot tub also as well as hammocks to lounge in. The grounds of the hotel are well maintained. There is also a house cat on the property named Priscilla who is very sweet. We were all very pleased with our stay. We are a group of well traveled couples and have been many places. This Eden house suited all of us just fine and was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, will definately return”
Reviews.Author: mistresssinderella
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with this amazing little place - I think Paradise was named after the Eden House. I stayed in the loft apartment overlooking the pool and had a fantastic stay. From the very helpful cheerful young lady at check in with the complimentary cold bottle of beer, who kept me supplied with umbrellas, band aids, sewing kit and of course the obligatory Advil (after a heavy night at the Schooner Wharf Bar!) to the guys who kept the pool side clean, tidy and washed down and the lovely housekeeper who managed to keep me tidy (not an easy feat), the staff were incredible. The Loft apartment was a dream, certainly totally spacious enough for me (as a single). The only downside was that I was alone as it was lovely and romantic climbing the spiral staircase to bed and with a lovely balcony lit up overlooking the pool. The room was very clean and the bathroom and kitchenette kept stocked with essentials. The pool was heated and the laying next to it with the waterfall tumbling into it and climbing into a beautifully warm jacuzzi in the rain with a complimentary drink at Happy Hour made my vacation one of the best I have had in years. I would not hesitate to stay at the Eden House again (always assuming they have rooms of course as it is very popular - but I can see why). Far enough from the action to get a good nights sleep but close enough to walk to Duval ( a few blocks) or the Schooner Wharf Bar (my new favourite place). The staff will easily recommend so many places to visit/do/see but check the Eden House website which is kept updated with all sorts of information. If you like individual attention, a wide range of different, quirky, interesting, romantic rooms, a staff that treat you by name and not number, and all the little things that make a good guesthouse great (such as complimentary happy hour) then try and grab a room (any room!) here, if not head to the big hotels in new town and get treated like just another dollar bill. Thanks Mike and all the other staff for making the Eden House probably THE best place to stay in KW.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ellengirl
Reviews.Content: We picked Eden House for our 10th anniversary for it's advertised beauty, quaintness and peacefulness. While it definitely was clean and landscaped beautifully, we hardly had much of a chance to enjoy it. Due to a group of about 4 rowdy couples and the fact that our room was on the ground floor facing the pool, unfortunately there was a lot of noise. Because the pool is small once you get ten people in it - especially when they are pushing each other around playfully there really isn't much more room for anyone else. While I probably should have complained about it I felt that the staff should have monitored it much more closely especially when they brought the "happy-hour" tray out - they saw what was going on for themselves. The staff was very nice but really didn't seemed too concerned about the noise level or everyone's comfort. Since we were on the bottom floor, we heard every noise coming from above. I guess the floors are tiled or wood which caused us to hear every arguement and every walk across the floor and the tremendous amount of furniture movement the people above had to make (for some reason) at late hours in the night and early in the morning. Our next visit this July we're going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise...Key West!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's vacation in the Keys. We were completely undecided where to get away, as we had been to all the "exotic" places one might have on their "wish list." Maui, for me, prior to experiencing the Keys, had been my destination of choice as we had vacationed there several times in the past. We decided we didn't want to spend so much of our time on a plane (coming from Nashville), and we found trip advisor, by far, the most helpful resource in selecting our destination. After reading countless trip advisor reviews, and using Priceline - we found roundtrip tickets from Nashville to Ft. Lauderdale and a rental car for a week for just a little over $300.00 for the two of us! Can't beat that price especially with gas prices well over $2.00/gallon. With our travel booked, we decided once in Ft. Lauderdale, we'd leisurely drive to the southernmost part of the US - Key West, FL. I was a little reluctant as I had only been there one time (at the age of 6) and my only memory was the 7 mile bridge, and at that age, it seemed a lifetime before I saw land! Finding a place to stay became a challenge for me after reading good to very ugly reviews of hotels, resorts, B&B's and guesthouses in the Keys, but I kept running across all these wonderful reviews of The Eden House. I went on their website, and clicked on their webcam several times before booking our reservations. We have always found comfort having been the "resort" type traveler staying at heavily advertised, well-known hotels...so selecting a guesthouse and having only the opinion of other people we didn't know was pretty scary...you just never know what you're getting in to. I kept second guessing these reviews thinking someone put these people up to it to gain advertisement for locations - I guess that's the cynical side of me. But...long story short - The Eden House and our trip to the Keys was by far the best vacation we have ever experienced. The accomodations and lush surroundings at The Eden House are impeccable; the staff are down to earth "real" people - not your typical starched, uniformed mechanical employees you find at a resort/hotel. This staff truly cares - which you don't find too often these days. They go above and beyond customer service to ensure your vacation is the best. There are many things to do in the Keys - and a car is just not necessary once you get there - so my advise to you would be to drop your rental off if you drive from Miami or another part of FL...get ready for bike rides, rent a moped, walk, take some boat trips, deep sea fish... (there are plenty of charters to choose from). The only negative thing that I will say (and this comes from a "southern" raised individual who deals with the public on a daily basis and understands that customer service is paramount to the success of any business) is that a handful of the wait staff at area restaurants and local shops were some of the rudest individuals I have ever run across...I kept thinking, come on people - you're in a beautiful part of the world, you have sun shining on your face every day and you have customers putting money in your pocket! If you're havin' a bad day - don't take it out on the hand that feeds you... All and all...visit Key West and stay at The Eden House. As I told the staff at Eden when we were checking out...we will be back...and they simply replied with a genuine smile, "we know you will!"

Reviews.Title: “Lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: redam
Reviews.Content: 7 or of my closest friends and I booked a weekend package (fun in the sun) four months early for May 6 - 9th with Maggie (who was most helpful) - we were assured that they would be able to accomodate the group with rooms, bikes & snorkel trips as advertised in website. I called one week prior to trip as she suggested to advise of snorkel trip dates - since we were on a limited time schedule we could only book one of the snorkel trips even though we were elegible and paid for two (not a problem for us). Maggie called me back and left a detailed msg that 8 bikes would be ready for us when we arrived on Friday and 8 people were booked for the snorkel trip. When we arrived at check in time at 3pm - only 5 bikes were avail. The very rude girl at the desk (not Maggie) did not seem one bit interested that we have reserved, paid for and confirmed they would be ready when we arrived. She said to check back in a few hours. So we had a drink by the pool and cleaned up for our bike ride to dinner/Mallory square. However at 6:00 - still only 5 bikes. She was trying to tell us how they would be back later that night and that she ahd 5 ready. This did us no good-were we to leave 3 members of our group to walk? I thought we were very understanding about the situation. So we did just that - all walked to dinner & sunset. We even talked to the gentlman at the desk to no eval before we left. He sd we would be compensated to 3 bikes - 1/2 day rental. When we asked if he could help us locate 3 bikes to rent for the evening, he called one place and sd they were all rented too. Not much effort there. Finally after sunset & dinner (10:30 pm) they had the addidtional bikes. Well to say the least we weren't going far on them by then. When we checked out - we all received $1.50 each ($3) checks with just a note "sorry for your hardship" - no explaination - This incedent did not ruin our trip - the rooms were clean, place was nice, but the customer services was horrible. No one put the newspaper down long enough to help us as the visitor about the bikes, and in the end became defensive and rude. May I add that we all live in Florida and travel to KW a couple of times a year. It just would have been nice if Maggie or someone with management applogized in person to us while we were there - I thought our money was just as green as other tourist. I really don't know if we would return again with so many other guest houses to choose from with what can only be better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Our Sixth visit!”
Reviews.Author: myril
Reviews.Content: Yes we really have travelled here from the UK six times over the last ten years, this time to celebrate our silver wedding,so it is fair to say that we are fans of the place. This year we came with friends and had the 2 bedroom suite for the first time. It was ideal for us having 3 small decks with outdoor furniture, a small indoor sitting area and good bathroom. Some tips: 1. Don't miss happy hour! 2. Try the Half Shell Raw Bar, the Irish pub just along the street and the speciality pasta restaurant about 5 mins walk away 3. Don't go if you are looking for a "corporate" hotel Just relax and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eden House!”
Reviews.Author: DBowman
Reviews.Content: Great place! The room was small but clean and comfortable. The shower was large, very nice. The free happy hour was a sweet bonus. Can't say enough about the staff. Thanks for the awesome hospitality!! We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: TMAC&K
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have been to the Eden House twice. The first time we went we had no idea what it was going to be like. It didn't take long to settle in mix a drink and make some friends. Little did I know that 4:00 everyday they roll out a small bar and have an open house for an hour. It doesn't sound like much but it does bring people together. We went again last month and had a blast. The owner makes his rounds in the afternoon speaking with people and telling the hstory of this great place. If you are planning a trip to the keys at least give this place a thought . You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “10 Stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our vacation to Key West. (March 17 - March 26, 2005) The Eden House was absolutely FANTASTIC!! We loved everything about it. We stayed in room 114, which was perfect for us. It had a beautiful stained glass window and overlooked the hammock area and was right around the corner from the pool area. It was always clean and made us feel right at home. And we loved the porch swing! The staff was just amazing. Mike was so much fun to talk to and had a ton of great recommendations of where to eat, shop and sail in Key West. Maggie is the most friendly front desk manager we have ever met and Pachia always had our room cleaned before we returned from our morning lounge session by the pool. We instantly fell in love with the Eden house and the first day was just as great as our last day. We can't wait to return to the Eden house later this year. We have decided that this is one of our have-to's every year. We already miss the happy hour by the pool! (I could go on and on about how great the Eden house is!! :-) ) Thank you so much Mike for having such an amazing place for us to stay. We miss you guys tons and watch the web cams everyday wishing we were there. See you soon - Amya and Brad

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Key West to celebrate our 30th birthdays (March 26-April 2). To say the least, WE HAD A PERFECT vacation!!!! The Eden House was THE BEST EVER!!! We stayed in Room 115 and it was great. It was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and we felt like we were at home. We are pretty picky about where we stay, so this is saying a lot!!:) We had a swing on the porch to our room along with a table and chairs. Our room overlooked a hammock area, and it was VERY quiet. I would recommend this room to everyone!! Grant helped us out many times and he was so nice, helpful and sweet. He helped us set-up parasailing and a couple of other activities. They had a happy hour daily by the pool, which was very nice. The pool was very relaxing and the jacuzzi was the best. We did many things in Key West, so if you need any advice, please feel free to contact us. If you have any questions about the Eden House, we are happy to help as well.
