We will look no further for a place to stay next time in Key West, and have already said we want to return to the Eden House!!!!! The location couldn't have been better. We were all over the island and we were only like 10 mins at the MOST to everything!! We only used our car once throughout our entire vacation. Thanks everyone at the Eden House for making our vacation spectacular!!!! The Sweeney's

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing home base while in Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With no definite schedule during our week in the Keys, we arrived in Key West on March 29, 2005 with no hotel reservations. Having done a little advance work, Eden House was on our short list of places to consider, and it turned out to be great. Our group of four -- two adults and two kids -- spent the first night in rooms 216 and 218, clean but small rooms linked by a tiny bathroom. Rate was $115/room. The hotel's location and the pool area are great, and so we stayed a second night, but switched to room 504 ($285), roomier and fronting Fleming Street. Some street noise but, again, a very clean room. Our third night, we moved to room 503 ($285), which is upstairs poolside and the best room of our stay, in terms of location. Staff was casual but responsive, and we were allowed to use pool and changing rooms even after check-out. While the cost of staying here was more than we had expected to shell out, in the end we did not mind the price. Approximately seven blocks from Duval Street, it's close enough to walk or bike there, but far enough away from the traffic and crowds that converge on that area in the evening. We have no doubt that we will return to Eden House when we visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Boo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was several years ago, but make sure you inquire before confirming reservations at Eden House... August...our AC did not keep our room cool except way after sunset. The remodeling being done was noisy, dusty and had stirred up the bug population...we had thousands of some kind of white bug crawling in our room. No other room available to move into. We were in Key West for my daughter's wedding and had no time to find and move to another place. All in all it was a very unpleasant experience. Room very cramped and had to share a bath with other guests who persistantly failed to unlock the door on our side.

Reviews.Title: “North of Eden with wonderful memories”
Reviews.Author: Starby57
Reviews.Content: Eden House was perfect for us...great staff, not fancy, old Town charm, fab classic crusier bikes and a gorgeous setting all designed for relaxing...and for adults and families. Not a wild 'spring break" spot. Check out the hammocks tucked away in the foliage and dip into the pool after biking or beaching. The restaurant is terrific (Cafe Med) and the owner (Mike Eden) is a sweetie. Thanks Mike for the warm welcome, and the suggestions about Cuban sandwiches, "crisp" fish, Key Lime pie, and the wonderful "Danger Tour" sail, kayak, snorkel trip. What a great visit to the southermost point! Head to Eden --you'll love your time in paradise...Robin and Pam (best friends in Margaritaville)

Reviews.Title: “Not a place in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden House with my girlfriend in late February for four days and although I liked the location and the charm of the hotel, especially the pool area and happy hour, there were a couple of points that left me feeling uneasy. First, we stayed in a Large Deluxe room which was sold as a larger room, but ended up being slightly smaller than a standard room at any other hotel or "guest house" and the room itself was lacking in general warmth and feeling. This coupled with the noise from the garbage trucks and traffic from the street made the room quite unattractive. If someone had bothered to tell me of the rooms location I may have opted for a different room away from the noise at least. Finally, I was surprised at the rudeness and unprofessionalism shown by the bald gentleman behind the front desk. When we asked for help in arrainging some things to do during our stay we were shocked to be barked at and told to hurry making our decisions so that he could finish his other tasks. That curtness and the smell of alcohol coming off his breath made me wonder why he was even there in the first place. This was our first trip to Key west and we found that although it can be a beautiful location it is not the Paradise it is sold as and I won't recommend either Key West or the Eden House to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden House”
Reviews.Author: behemoth1852
Reviews.Content: My companion and I spent 5 delightful February days and nights in one of the larger, newer and pricier poolside rooms. The room was clean, modern and more than adequate for two guests. Loved the location in a quiet neighborhood, a 10 minute walk from the bustle of Duval St., the harbor and the larger hotels. Appreciated the retro look and feel of the lobby area and hotel front, complete with porch and rocking chairs. The staff was helpful but unobtrusive. The Pool and Jacuzzi area is a social center during daylight hours and a quiet retreat for a late night dip after an evening of partying on Duval St. An intimate haven for grownups who can do without all of the amenities of the big hotels. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Again”
Reviews.Author: textygirl
Reviews.Content: Magic, welcoming, hospitable, in flux. A mix of interesting, open-hearted regulars and new guests, who, by some happy twist of fate, find their way to the gates of Eden. A celebration at the end of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Tamara
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Eden House several times. A good choice for clean rooms at reasonable rates. The pool area is nicely done and relaxing. The area is quiet and the service is OK. The inn is a good number of blocks off Duval Street but it's still in Old Town (which is a must in Key West). Some of the rooms are certainly nicer than others and some of the beds are too small, but the owner has generally reinvested to keep things fresh over his many years now of owning Eden House.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: starward
Reviews.Content: We checked out after the first night. While the grounds were nice and the rooms clean, we felt the lobby seemed on the shabby side and the rooms way too small. There were no closets or any place to unpack your suitcase and the room had a funky smell. The staff was very friendly and understood our need for bigger quarters. I feel the Eden House is overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small rooms with no closets or dressers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, the location is wonderful. The facilities are very attractive. The pool and jacuzzi areas are well kept and clean. It was a nice touch to offer a refreshment when we checked in and to have the daily happy hour from 4 to 5. All of those are positives. But the room was tiny. We had a queen bed. On one side there was about 6 inches to the wall, on the other about 18 inches to the sink. At the foot of the bed there was about two feet. There was a shelving unit there that housed a tv, refrig and microwave. but next to the refrig, there was just a big open space that was pretty useless. No closet, just three hooks and six plastic hangars. It was difficult to unpack, find a place for clean clothes for dirty clothes and for shoes. While the bed was comfortable, the pillows were anemic. Had a better experience at Westwinds, and think I'll probably return to that establishment, or perhaps a pricier one, on my next stay. Quite frankly, I felt we got less than we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Key West is beyond wonderful, and Eden House is the perfect base for a visit. Great accommodations and a friendly, casual, civilized attitude. Pool and hot tub are oh so inviting, but personal favorite creature comfort is the porch swing in the gazebo. A haven for hedonists.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House...it's just so great!”
Reviews.Author: lpeters19
Reviews.Content: The Eden House was great. My pickiest issue is always with cleanliness and smells. I'll give you the low down but first of all, I'm a huge Dallas Cowboys fan! Carlos at the front desk doesn't like the Dallas Cowboys and he didn't hold back in letting me know. So, if you're a Cowboys fan..please make sure to let Carlos know and tell him the Ohio girls sent you. 1) My friend and I were there for 7 days, on somewhat limited funds, so we took the most basic room possible. It was fine. There is something for every price level there so if you can afford it, go for it! We had 2 twin beds which were amazingly comfortable and shared a bathroom with room next door. Really, it was ok. 2) The pool was amazing- temp set at 90 degrees and the pool area is so beautiful. The maintenance people were so quiet. Talk about relaxing. 3) The owner Mike Eden has passion for his job. He talked to us quite at length. He cares about your experience there and was so amazingly helpful...thanks also to Maggie and Glen 4) The walks are easy but take Tennis Shoes because there is somewhat of a walk to Duval...not bad though. Some things that make this place better- 90 degree pool, caring staff, friendly people, not only gave us a wake up call one morning but called us back to make sure we were up, beds, location right in the middle of residential around beautiful homes You just gotta go there...

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic time. This place is my new found paradise. From the wonderful porch swings to the great pool (and waterfall) I fell in love with Eden House as soon as I saw it. Sitting on the Flemming Street side balcony eating take out from Foustos and watching the world go by was an event unto itself. Doing the same thing sitting at street level under a ceiling fan was even better. After a long trip we arrived late and the front desk crew was supurb. Thanks for the beer! I'll never stay any place else in Key West again. Thanks Mike!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After choosing the Eden house from reviews on this site, we were surprised that the facility surpassed our expectations. Staff were great, the pool and gardens a piece of paradise. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Eden House”
Reviews.Author: jmac1234567
Reviews.Content: On Thanksgiving Day 04, four couples celebrated the Holiday locally in four different cities across the US. On Thanksgiving Friday we all met poolside at the Eden House in Old Town Key West. While this trip was a repeat visit for all to KW, we were all newbies to the Eden House. Most previous visits were enjoyed at the family condo in Truman Annex. Last year, 'Dear Old Dad' sold the condo, so we freeloaders needed to find new digs. The Eden House met our expectations of a clean, comfortable, welcoming, funky, friendly, conveniently located, owner operated and reasonably priced home away from home in every way. The deluxe room my wife and I reserved was smaller than we expected. When we returned to the desk to discuss this issue, we were politely offered several larger rooms to consider at no additional cost. With more than a few keys in hand we began a self guided tour. This unplanned adventure was fun, and we choose to stay with the recently renovated poolside unit we originally reserved. Happy hour......Gin, Vodka, Rum a few bottles of soda, OJ, plastic cups and ice....Poolside at 4:00 PM and compliments of the house. It worked for us and everyone we met. Each evening we enjoyed ordinary drinks in the company of interesting people. All in all a great way to prepare for Sunset! Mike, We enjoyed talking with you and appreciate your restaurant recommendations. The Eden House is not for everyone. I hope it never is!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House over New Year's 2005 and had a great time. The staff is wonderful (especially Maggie, and even including their adorable 19-year old cat, Priscilla) and our room (a large deluxe) was clean and bright and unfussy, which is our style. We had a great time and Mike Eden's a great guy whose suggestions were always exactly what we needed. We'd go back but would stay on the 2nd floor, as we could hear our upstairs neighbors clomp around quite a bit (not the hotel's fault, really), and the bed was a little hard (again, more our personal preference than anything else). Otherwise we quite enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great but. . .”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Caro
Reviews.Content: We chose the Eden hotel based on tripadvisors ratings. We have to admit that the hotel staff is super friendly and the set up of the hotel is superb. However we got a corner room facing the street whis was very loud. If you choose this hotel try to check in early so that you can take advantage of the happy hour. Guests are allowed to use the pool and jacuzzi all night long which made our stay - lets say it this way â€“ even more pleasant. . .

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch !”
Reviews.Author: Hawk0476
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Key West the week before Christmas and decided to stay at Eden House based on the many comments on this site. We were not disappointed with our choice. Eden House is perfectly situated in Key West, near enough to the many attractions and night life of Duval Street but far enough away to be in a quiet residential part of the historic quarter of Key West. We had a good size room with a very comfortable bed and a great shower. I especially like the porch with the swing chair on it , nice for relaxing after a busy day. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful without being over the top, which I sometimes cannot say as a visitor from the UK who has visited the U.S on several occasions. The gardens and swimming pool area at Eden House are its best feature especially the hot tub , ' A little tropical oasis' In conclusion a great place to stay. Only one criticism which is a little tongue in cheek - 'Get some new Christmas decorations ' you have got to compete with over the road !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay But...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Eden House and basically did not have time to enjoy the atmosphere of the hotel so our review is somewhat limited. The grounds were beautiful including the pool and hot tub. The staff seemed very nice but for the price we paid which was more than the La Te Da the rooms were very small. The sink was right beside the bed and there is no televison. Not a big deal but we thought that was important to include here. Out stay at the Eden House was great but thought it was a little over-priced considering the size of our room. There was no continental breakfast with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Eden in Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were tired after a long drive and needed to find our room and collapse. The staff at Eden House immediately made us relax and offered us drinks and a seat for a few mins before showing us round and taking us to our room. The staff were lovely and straight away helped you to slip into the key west time zone. The accomodation was lovely, although rooms slightly small. On days that we lounged around the hotel we would jump from the beautifully surrounded pool to the jacuzzi and into the hammock. This place would be an above average place to stay in Key West if it weren't for the staff. They make the place, the atmosphere and make you feel so welcome. A would recommend this rightly named house to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “eden house, fantasy fest - priceless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great time Eden House always makes for everyone. We met new freinds and as always the staff at Eden House is always like family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at a wide variety of Key West spots over the years - from upscale B&B's to run of the mill hotels to condo rentals - and we were very happy with our first stay at Eden House from which we just returned. Eden House is a good balance of all the varied options you have at which to stay in Key West. In our opinion, it's part B&B (without the breakfast) and part hotel, but not just your average hotel. More like a comfortable laid back hotel with lots of Key West character - from the lush gardens to the relaxing hammocks and swings to the nice wooden elevated sundeck and great pool (with waterfall) and jacuzzi (spent hours in the big jacuzzi). We stayed in a "deluxe room" which was pretty average, but very sufficient. Our friends stayed in a "small deluxe room" which was very small and a bit cramped, but again, very sufficient. Would recommend getting at least the normal deluxe room or a large deluxe. The warm cheap liquor and warm mixers at the daily happy hour were nothing to write home about, but did the trick to get the evening rolling. The positives of our stay at Eden House far outweighed the little minor negatives and I'm sure we'll return again. If you're looking for a good deal, with a lot of character in a very relaxing and very Key West setting, Eden House is a great choice. And with regard to prior crummy comments about the staff, we'd say while the staff may not be polished hotel professionals, they were all very friendly, very helpful and would have done anything to help us out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 wonderful nights at the Eden House in Key West. My wife thought the room was just perfect and had its own porch and swing. The staff were exceptionally helpful and attentive. Nice location within walking distance of Harbor and Duval Street. Others who we chatted with indicated that they had been coming for years we were lucky we had discovered it. We were, and we will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. We were one of five couples travelling together and I recommended Eden House after much investigation (thank you Trip Advisor). We could not have been more happy with Eden House. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were immaculate and the staff, especially Carlos (I don't know where some of those negative remarks came from- he was fantastic!), were extremely helpful in making our trip fabulous. It was close enough to Duval to walk but away from it all to relax. It was truly the PERFECT vacation! We all decided to make Key West and Eden House our annual getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel -- Disappointed with the "Package"”
Reviews.Author: lilliemae
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights at the Eden Hotel this past week. We had reserved the "Romance Package" which included Champagne & Etched Champagne flutes in our room at check-in, a lithograph, a Sunset Sail cruise, and Bikes for our stay. Our room was extremely neat and clean as well as tastefully decorated. Additionally, everyone employed there seemed very nice. We were really looking forward to having champagne in our room when we arrived. Unfortunately, there was neither champagne nor flutes in our room. About 30 minutes after we checked in, we asked why our champagne and flutes were not in our room. We were told they were out of champagne, and they were "working on it." No mention was made of the other amenities for which we paid. We needed to specifically requested the Sunset cruise. They did make the reservations for us and the cruise was wonderful. When we checked out I asked them again about the Champagne and ethched flutes and I was told they were still "working on it." I then asked about the lithograph, and they didn't seem to know that it should have been included in our package. Upon checking, the staff member realized that it should have been included and retrieved a lithograph form the gift shop. All in all, the Eden House is a nice place with pleasant staff, but I suspect that not too many people select their Romance Package because nobody seemed to know about it. I am disappointed because we paid but did not receive part of what we were promised. Because of our experience, I would not recommend paying extra for one of the "packages". I doubt we will be staying here again on our next trip to Key West unless a bottle of champagne and etched flutes arrive in the mail some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is Paridise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time at Eden House and we will never stay anywhere else in Key West. The Place is Beautiful, The Staff is friendly and helpful. Mike's reccomendations where right on!!! He sent us a bottle of Champagne for our Tenth Anniv. after we had mentioned it in our conversation around the pool. Nice Touch of Class.The Happy Hour is fun,getting to know the other guest's is a treat.We passed on our cooler to someone who would be there longer than us and it would be great to get that back next year. This place is low key so if you are looking for loud and flashy stay away and keep it quiet for the rest of us.Thanks again!!!! RJ & Jen

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sorry I waited so long to post a review of the Eden House! We spent 4 days at the Eden House in March 2004. We were joined by my brother and sister-in-law, who were on their 4th or 5th visit to Eden House, and sister and brother-in-law. The minute I walked into the place, the stress in my shoulders completely disappeared. What a beautiful and relaxing place. Our room was immaculately clean and the staff was very helpful and polite (with the one minor exception being Carlos' rudeness). From what I've read in other reviews, this problem has been corrected. We are looking forward to a return visit next May with our other family members joining us again, as well as the ones that didn't make it last time. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “accomodations at all prices”
Reviews.Author: SZ
Reviews.Content: Eden House has small and large rooms, those with or without kitchenettes, etc. There is something at the right price to please everyone. Staff were wonderful in their recommendations of places to eat and drink. We simply told them a general area and exactly what we wanted to find and their information was always right on the mark.

Reviews.Title: “You must experience Eden House to understand what it's all about.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay this year at Eden House and it won't be our last. This place is so relaxing I can't put it into words. This trip was better than the last despite the fact we were run out of town by Ivan. Again, we have put together photos of Key West and the Eden House on a small site. It can be found at: A picture is worth a 1000 words. Thanks Mike - and all the gang at EH. See y'all next summer. Ruth & Ted Manno

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is aptly named”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Eden House is aptly named. Although the owner is named Mike Eden you would never guess that is why it has its name. It is paradise and justly deserves the name. From the quaint rooms to the best restaurant on the island to the complimentary Happy Hour every night by the pool, Eden House is the best vacation spot I have seen. Sure you can go to the big chain hotels and get more modern amenities but if that is what you want than why did you decide to go to Key West in the first place?. This place captures the essence of the island and makes you realize why this place is so special. The staff genuinely seems to care about their guests and realize that they have waited a long time to come here. You are treated like freinds, not customers and frankly, that is refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: witless
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2004. Beautiful place, best location, great staff, but $125+tax is pricey for a rather simple room in the off-season. It's certainly worth paying a bit extra for Eden House rather than a chain place, but at this time of year, the chains are discounted heavily on Priceline, etc, so it works out at a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CaraPhilly_PA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed w/Mike and the Gand 3 times now, and our daughter as well (she lives in Tampa) We love the Eden House for its beautiful lay out as well as relaxing atmosphere and friendly staff..rooms are clean and lovely..last time we stayed in a 2 bedroom apt. in the back..hammock on the porch facing street..hint, downstairs has a spa!next time we'll stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcome, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TheladyLisa
Reviews.Content: I booked this accommodation because of the glowing reviews on trip advisor and wasn't disappointed. From the unexpected welcome drinks to the lovely rooms, it was all that we needed. We stayed in a loft apartment which was simply delightful Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon We'll Remember With A Smile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at EH, which I affectionately notice is the same initials as Ernest Hemingway, for our 5 day honeymoon June 27-July 1. We had a larger room, two patios, kitchen, nice size closet area, nice size bathroom (room 403 I think). I was not expecting the great size and coziness of our room. We also loved the short walk to all the night life and water activities. The harbor is SO close and we snorkled and sunset cruised with a company via EH recommendation and had a GREAT experience! The people are friendly and love the mutual respect: especially the "we don't hear you we don't see you" rule. I was disappointed Mike was on vacation; I mean why would you need a vacation from Key West!? I was looking forward to his music I had read about on the webpage. But we got great treatment from the rest of the staff and champagne, glasses, and a print of the hotel to take with us! Great surprise! Smallest of complaints: itty bitty ants in the kitchen, but it almost seems like a given with so many beautiful trees and plant life. And there was construction going on around the pool during the day, but we had no problem relaxing anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hour is every hour at the Eden House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 2nd annual trip to Key West. As long as they will allow us to come back, we will be there every year. We come with 6 of our closest friends and stay in the big house. We have the best time with the other guests and the staff. The only complaint I have is that our trip is never long enough. By the end of the weekend it's sad saying goodbye to the new friends that we've met but we hope that we will see them again next year--same time , same place. See ya in Paradise! The Jello Shot Crew!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Eden House is the Garden of Eden! Nothing could top our stay, ever! 3 years in a row and gets better every time. Grounds are beautiful, crew is awesome and atmosphere is outstanding! If you go to Key West, you MUST stay in the Eden House! And make sure you make it to FREE Happy Hour at 4-5pm!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In early June, 2004 we stayed 5 days at the Eden House and were not disappointed. The rooms are kept exceptionally clean, the linens and bedding are nice. Other than noise from the street occasionally and noise from the hall, Eden House is quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “The Eden House ambiance was better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: TedM39
Reviews.Content: Mike Eden is right, Eden House is not for everybody. But it's right for us. A fairly recent reviewer gave EH a poor review -to each his own. I could rebut each negative statement, but why bother, our experience was extremely positive. Mike, Carlos and Maggie are so helpful. The atmosphere is laid-back, calm and peaceful. The landscaping is lush. The apartment we had was clean & roomy. Cafe Med was the best meal on the island. If the Tripadvisor folks allow, I posted photos and trip info on a personal site this weekend at http://home.earthlink.net/~mannoman/vacationalbum/index.html. Check it out. It was our first trip to KW but won't be our last. We liked it so much we plan to return right after the Labor Day weekend. If you are looking for a Chain hotel experience, this ain't it, but if you want to just relax, look no further. We met a couple from the UK who said it was their 4th return trip to EH. Nuf said?

Reviews.Title: “Don't think about staying here (I want it all to myself!)”
Reviews.Author: 2RInsider
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Eden House for years, and would never go anywhere else in Key West. Seriously, I'll change my plans if Eden House is booked up. It's the quintessential Key West experience, laid back, folksy, charming, and thankfully not for everyone. If you want to stay among friends and give your vacation dollars to people who really deserve it, stay here. If you prefer a sterile, cookiecutter room and a staff who collects their $8/hour and goes home, stay at one of the chain hotels on the other side of town. I love the free happy hour, the funky pool, Priscilla the aloof cat, and the great people. Just don't try to book the last room when I need it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well Eden house was all that and more, it's so nice ot go to place that really makes you feel like you are at home. The front desk was fantastic, and so down to earth, they were very helpfull and fun! What a nice group of people they have their, and Mike, Mr. Eden, was great that day around the pool tell old stories, wish I could've stayed there even longer, I would recommend Eden House t anyone that wants to really relax and enjoy Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.. The best of Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House for 3 nights and loved it!! We Initially were aony going to stay for 2 nights but stayed for 3. Upon Arriving Grant Met us and showed us to our room. We quicky made our way to the hammock area for a relaxing nap after a long drive. The Pool area was crowded at times during the day but at night it was empty. Make sure you check out the Cafe Med next door. the food and service is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Really! -an enjoyable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful, lush grounds, a tropical cozy setting. My boyfriend and I went down June 24-26 for the first time. We stayed in a private room, it was a smaller room, but I didn't expect a large room considering we only paid $95 a night, and anyone who says a room is too small is spending too much time in there when you're in KEY WEST!!!!!! Everyone who works there was very, very friendly, completely not hotel-like whatsoever (especially maggie :)...while I was relaxing in the beautiful pool they came around to ask if I wanted anything to drink. It's like you're staying at a friend's house and they want you to be happy and comfortable. Many times when I travel, I like to look for other places to stay each time so I have a variety of memories, but not when I return to KW, I have no need to create a different memory in another hotel or inn. If your iffy on where to stay when you come to KW, trust me, I researched for months online, as well as on tripadvisor, no place had such good reviews, so I went with the Eden House, and all those reviews were confirmed. Anyone leaving a bad review, nothing is perfect, so better luck next time...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not totally happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden House from June 24 - 27. When we first checked in, the kid at the front desk (not sure of his name) wasn't the friendliest, kind of cold and indifferent. He gave us our room key and told us where our room was. When we walked into our room, we put our bags down, looked down on the floor to see a cockroach run across the floor!! YIKES! I'm freaking out and go back out to the front desk and tell the kid that we just killed a cockroach in our room. He just looked at me like I was crazy. He then asks me what I would like him to do about it. I didn't know what to say! I just told him that I was kind of surprised to find a cockroach in my room. He then told me that they are not cockroaches, they are Palmetto bugs, and if I'm staying in Florida, I need to learn to "cohabitate" with them. The following day I awoke to find Maggie at the front desk (THANK GOODNESS). I told her everything that had occurred the day before and she sincerely apologized. She said that she would talk to Mike about the issue when he returned from his vacation. That was a MAJOR disappointment. The minor thing that bothered me was that we had asked that our showerhead be cleaned off (calcium build up - due to hard water), and that was never done. We go to Key West every June to celebrate our wedding anniversary and like to try different B&B's. I was disappointed in the Eden House. Although in the end, Maggie gave us a partial credit back to our charge card, which we were thankful for. The grounds are beautiful but I don't think we'll be staying at the Eden House again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: sharibrat
Reviews.Content: For five years we had stayed at the same hotel in KW.....at the opposite end of the island. With an infant in tow this year, we needed a shorter walk each evening and found Eden House. We were a little reluctant to change, since we loved our other hotel so much. But the Eden House proved to be a fantastic choice and we now recommend it to all of our friends and will stay there from now on! We had a first floor apartment which offered a separate living and sleeping area, perfect for when our baby was napping and we wanted to watch TV or chat. The porches are large and private, the room was very clean with friendly staff. The pool was clean and the happy hour by the pool and in the hot tub was fun and a great way to meet people! A short walk to where the action is, but you are far enough off the main drag that it is very quiet. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Eden House....Only place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm. Maybe I should not join all the good folks who recommend staying at the Eden House. I just might find myself closed out when I call for reservations. But, then, how many Key West reviews mention the owner's name in the review? Or the wonderful employees by name? How many reviews are replied to by the owner himself? Very few, indeed! Although Mike Eden was on vacation when we stayed at the Eden House last year, and we have never met him, the rest of the staff made us feel like we were "home". From Bob's first email responding to my questions, to being met at the front door by Maggie, and Carlos to clean up after two very messy people, this is the only place we will ever stay in Key West. We stayed in the "budget" rooms, and although not as modern as the rest of the rooms, it was kept spotless as well as the shared bathroom. (Thank you, Carlos) Only complaint about our room, were the stairs to get to our room. Very bad on my old knees. Our fault. Not the staffs. Next time.....lower room only! And, because we were celebrating our anniversary, our room came with two Eden House glasses and a bottle of champagne. A lovely touch, indeed! And one that two senior citizens will not soon forget. There are many lovely places to stay in Key West. Many very highly recommended. But, for us, the only place to stay.....Eden House! Thanks again, Staff, for making our stay so wonderul. Sincerely, Butterkup and Stan

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at the Eden House!!”
Reviews.Author: thrashersfan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay at the Eden House and Key West. Like the other reviewers, we totally fell in love with the Eden House. The staff (Carlos, Maggie & Big Bill) were awesome. They were very helpful and went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The grounds are beautfully landscaped and there are plenty of hammmocks on the property. If you want a great steak & a romantic resturant (Micheal's) is #1. The steak was unbelievable. (Thanks Carlos for the recomendation). We will be returning to the Eden House in Sept. We are already counting the days!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: rich1963
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at Eden House. Perfect location, beautiful grounds, nice & clean rooms (stayed in 501), and very helpful staff (hats off to Carlos for finding us parking & all the tips.) Although Oregon is a long way from Key West, we hope to make it back & will return to Eden House. Tips: 1. If you like extra space & they're available, spring for the larger rooms. We peeked into a smaller room & found it to be very nice, but a tad small. Regardless, I would still stay here. 2. Upon arrival...park your car, unload it, & don't look back. Rent bikes from the front desk and enjoy exploring Key West. You can cover a lot of ground with litte effort or time and there are plenty of bike stalls for locking up & taking off on foot. 3. If you can't find free parking on-site (1st come, 1st served) or on a nearby sidestreet, don't worry. A parking structure sits within two blocks and it's only $10 for 24 hrs. Park it, leave it, and enjoy your stay. 4. Read through the Eden House/Key West notebook in your room. Provides nice background info & great dining tips. Breakfast at Pepe's is an affordable must. 5. If you stay in upper level room, please show consideration for your downstairs neighbors. Rearranging the furniture at 11:30 P.M. is NEVER a good idea! And tread lightly - Regardless of how thin you really are, if you're stomping around like a hippo....you'll never shake the image!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to the Keys every year for our anniversary and we always make sure to stay for a while at the Eden House. This was our 4th year staying with Mike and the gang and we already cannot wait to get back. The property is absolutely beautiful not to mention very relaxing. The pool has a beautiful waterfall and the tropical landscape makes you feel like you are a million miles away. Not to mention that the rooms are some of the best that we have stayed in. If you are a first timer you will not be disappointed. Try one of the apartment rooms! (our favorites are rooms 402 and 403) Trust me you'll never want to leave. Hope to see some new faces next year at Happy Hour!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: sldue
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very nice. The hotel is neat and clean. But the rooms are small. They look exactly like what is pictured on the website. The inn was packed the weekend we were there and the pool was a little small to accomodate everyone. Plus the hotel is a little too far away from Duval Street... B-n-B's Ambrosia & Ambrosia Too are nicer and about 5 blocks closer.... at night in Key West those 5 blocks make quite a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eden House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in the Key West. The Eden House Staff was very helpful in getting my friend and I transportation around. The grounds were very relaxing I love the porch and the hammocks I really enjoyed the spa and the pool as well. The rooms were very clean. My Friend were always able to cool off after sightseeing. I will go back again and again it was just incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 2-week holiday to Florida, and stayed at the Eden for 4 nights late May 2004. I would definitely recommend staying here. We paid for a Deluxe Room which had a TV and fridge and a bit more room than the Private Rooms (our friend stayed in the Private). The rooms are clean and well maintained. The only thing that I would have found handy would have been a safe, hairdryer and iron/ironing board. However, hairdryers and irons were easily available to borrow from Reception at no charge. The pool is lovely (they supply fresh towels, again at no charge) and the whole place has a relaxed and very welcoming air about it. Maggie on Reception is so helpful and friendtly too. It's only about a 10-minute walk to lively Duval Street. If we ever get a chance to return to the Florida Keys, this is where we would stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Get Away"!!!”
Reviews.Author: kingkiller
Reviews.Content: >>>> My wife and I just booked our 2nd stay at EH for June 14 - 17,and would'nt consider staying anywhere else. Quiet and relaxing are the key words that come to mind,but the "glitz and glamour" are only a few blocks away if you're into that sort of thing. Mike's staff does an outstanding job.......

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the lush tropical landscaping, to the cozy hammocks hidden away in secluded nooks, to the heated pool and jacuzzi, Eden House is a little slice of paradise. The grounds are so nice that we spent one entire day on site and had our meals delivered from the local restaurants. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay the vacation of a lifetime. The complimentary happy hour at the pool every afternoon, allows you (if you chose) to meet and mingle with other guest. We enjoyed it so much we extended our stay, and we're already planning a trip back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups!”
Reviews.Author: Cilla4991
Reviews.Content: I went to the EH with a group of 6. We stayed in the Conch House (both floors) and it was great. All 3 bedrooms are good sized and the bathrooms looked new. Best part...private jacuzzi! Staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mike and the gang have been so wonderful for the last ten years. (Even advised us to get out of Michigan's Tundra) During the sickness they always made room for us downstairs and we loved them for that.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all,I highly reccommend the Eden House. Mike is a class A guy that goes the extra mile to make your stay a great one. We brought the kids (ages 13,16,18) and they thought the same, good and clean rooms, beautiful gardens, nice pool and hot tub, great reccommendations, and most all ,a cool funky place to hang out with new friends! Mike, thanks for the tunes and for a great Vacay and the watch for the Shiitakes. See ya soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a nice location with very friendly staff. Maggie on reception was really helpful and welcoming. The room was nice and clean but a little on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “You either get it or you don't!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying with Mike and the Eden House gang 7 times in the last 5 years, one thing that I have learned is that (as stated by many others) the Eden House is not for everyone. If you are looking for a chain hotel environment, the Eden House might not be for you. This is a place that makes you feel at home in paradise! The rooms are simple, pretty and clean. Most people who have had complaints about their rooms don't seem to have looked at the website. Each of the room types is described and there are pictures on the site that show what a specific type of room looks like, but how much time are you spending in your room? I would suggest that anyone who is a first-timer and is concerned about the room size, to spring for a large deluxe and you will have no worries! All that being said, this place is not about the room size; it is a beautiful, tropical getaway, that makes you happy to just be there. As soon as we walk in and take that first corner toward the pool, we are home!!! Mike and his crew are all great for help and assistance, but they are also great storytellers and characters in themselves!! The Happy Hour may offer less expensive liquors(as stated in an earlier review), but that's not what it is about! Happy Hour is about talking to and meeting other people visiting Key West, trading stories about restaurants and bars and getting to know new people. That is precisely how my husband and I have become a part of a great group of "November Irregulars" and will welcome anyone else that wants to really have a true Key West experience! Mike and his staff offer very reliable recommendations for things to do in KW. Mike, keep up the great work and take care of your crew- they are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Eden House. The room was very clean, spacious, and we had our own patio overlooking Fleming. The innkeepers were helpful, and very nice. We relaxed on the sundeck, swam in the pool, slept in a hammock, etc. If you are looking for the real/historic/non-touristy side of Key West, Eden House is the perfect destination. The only complaint we had is the thinness of the walls. Our wall-mates really enjoyed watching television at all hours - at high volumes. Plus, we could hear every word of their conversations.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West at least 5 times and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. We stayed at the Eden House for the first time without knowing anything about it. We were suprised (pleasantly) by how NICE everything was. Those who truly love Key West, know why you are there. You are not there to be kissed up to or have your every whim met. You are there to be yourself, relax and not think of anything but the sun and beauty that surrounds you. I love this place and wouldnt dream of staying anywhere else. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For a particular visitor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights at the Eden House over Christmas. My husband was down with the flu the entire time & the staff was great. Maggie, Carlos, Mike and especially Bill and the housekeeping staff were so kind and helpful. Our room was too small to stay in 24-7 and Bill gladly upgraded us to a suite at a very reasonable cost. If you're going to spend a lot of time in your room you may not be happy with the small/regular rooms available. The grounds are spectacular, comfortable and relaxing. If you're a tourist you may feel too far from the action (3 blocks), but if you're a visitor seeking out the real essence of Key West, you've come to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: msmithmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the eden house last month. We came down with friends and booked the deluxe conch house upper floor. It's a 2-bedroom, 1 bath condo that attaches to the rest of the hotel and the pool area by a private walkway. I think that the price would be steep for just one person or family, but splitting it two ways was great. The pool/hot tub/sun porch area is fabulous, and we spent half our entire vacation just enjoying it... we were very pleased and surprised to find that the outdoor pool is heated- never dreamed to find a heated pool this far south. Don't expect a room out of a Ritz Carlton, but for the reasons one goes to Key West- outdoor fun- this place can't be beat. The hotel location is about 1/2 mile from Duval street, which was plenty to abate the all-night noise, while still an easy walk to and from dinner. Overall, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Let me tell you”
Reviews.Author: jimellen
Reviews.Content: Having been a guest at Eden House at least 8 times I have one thing to say. My wife and I go to Key West to stay at the Eden House. Sure there are many things to do in Key West, many we have not done. Our favorite thing to do in Key West is lay by the pool, read a little, have a drink or more and talk with all the wonderful guests and staff that are there. It is a "state of mind" that brings us from Maine to visit there every year. Any negative reviews that you see are from people that are way too uptight to enjoy the peace you expirience there. If your room was too small you should have upgraded and if that is not enough there are plenty of chain hotels that can accomodate you. People who enjoy the Eden House know what I am rambling about. -Jim & Ellen

Reviews.Title: “Vastly over-rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is an attractive place to look at, with small but nice grounds and pool. Other than that, it was poor. I wouldn't normally knock a place, but since we went there due to tripadvisor reviews, here I go. Service was friendly but unhelpful - For example, when we arrived the front desk guy ran up the stairs in front of us, leaving my girlfriend to carry 2 large bags behind him, followed by me with suitcase. We stayed in a 'large deluxe', which was almost as big as an average hotel room. View of road only. No wardrobe and the shelves were dusty as hell - Clothes laid on them had to be washed not worn. 'Happy Hour' is a joke - Dreadful, cheap gin and stuff you wouldn't offer your mother-in-law. I suspect Mike Eden is a 'smoke and mirrors' guy. He exudes laidback attitude, but stocks a giftshop with 'Mike Eden' towels and other tat, priced 25%+ more than same stuff without name elsewhere. He don't miss a chance for a buck (front desk made 1 'phone call to book something for us and we later found out they would get a 20% 'kickback') and wants you to know it, which is fine but not exactly 'laidback'.

Reviews.Title: “Eden House is the Absolute Best”
Reviews.Author: eileenandted_11
Reviews.Content: We found Eden House on Trip Advisor, and stayed there from Jan. 26th to Jan. 30th. We were on our honeymoon. From the moment we arrived until we said goodbye on Friday morning everything was fabulous. Maggie, Carlos, and Bill were all helpful and friendly. We met Mike and had a great conversation with him by the pool. We followed Mike's restaurant suggestions.. Mo's was especially great. The room (501) was gorgeous. Eden House was warm, friendly, and best of all relaxing...we can't wait to come back. Ted and Eileen Theroux

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: JimFtMyersFL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Eden House more times than I can remember. (Late nites on Duval St. will do that to ya!) I must say that I am very surprised at any negative comments made about that staff at the hotel. They have been some of the most pleaseant characters I have met. I have stayed in almost every room in the hotel, and have a recommendation for the folks complaining about a room thats to small. Spend the money for an upgraded room! (Can you people in Canada hear me??). As for a bike thats uncomfortable, comon its a bike not caddilac, stop at the beach or a bar and rest your butt. Remember the Eden house isnt for everyone, But I love the fact that everything is so clean, there is no noise after 10:00pm and the comfort of the pool and hot tub. Cant wait for my next trip down there this May!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Visit - Recommend Eden House to all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor is 2 for 2 with us now! For winter getaways, we did all the research (Foder's, Brommer's, AAA), and have been most successful with the recommendations from this site. Personal opinions continue to be very individual, and as long as you read a variety of the reviews, the flavor of the destination comes through. This was definitely true with Eden House. We were expecting personal attention and cozy comfort with a laid-back, friendly attitude, good location and helpful staff. Last month, during the 6 days we spent there, we enjoyed all this and couldn't have been more pleased. We could walk to everything, the staff was super-friendly and helpful with recommendations, and Mike is one-of-a-kind! Thanks to everyone there for making our vacation perfect. If you are looking for a place to stay when visiting Key West, go to the Eden House website and look around. If you like what you see, give them a try! We stayed in a terrific second floor room overlooking the pool, noise was never a problem, fellow guests were great, happy hour was a blast, the pool was spotless, the towels were big and fluffy, the rooms were clean, the bed was comfy... HIGHLY recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 203 in the main building this past weekend. The entire vacation was FLAWLESS! We will never stay anywhere other than the Eden House. The room was exceptionally clean. The staff (particularly Carlos) went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure our stay was perfect. We were able to meet Mike Eden poolside during happy hour on Saturday. This man is the BEST!! He is so friendly and eager to make sure you enjoy yourself. We definitely got very penny's worth and cannot wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to Eden House...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed from Motel6 to Marriott, and they are both bests at different things. Eden House seems to be the best at wanting to make your whole Key West experience enjoyable. (not just your stay in their hotel!!) Our room selection was a Small Deluxe in one of the outer buildings for 8 nights. After reading some reviews here on small rooms, I was begining to wonder how small our small deluxe would be. We were pleasantly surprised. It was located next to the Hammock area with a very tropical ambience. The sleeping area (approx 13'X15') was more than adequate for our stay, with a very nice decor, good/firm comfortable mattress, TV & fridge. The washroom was quite large for what we had expected as well. (approx 6X13 feet) and out our front door was a screened off porch (approx 5X20') with table/chairs making for a nice relaxing area next to the tropical plants/trees. All the staff (including cleaning staff) were exceptionally pleasant to chat with and were always checking to make sure all was fine & always trying to see if there's something extra they can do to enhance our stay. Although we didn't partake in too many happy hours as we were busy exploring the Island and often didn't arrive back in time, it was a good *social* event. (Make sure to at least go to one & ask Mike [owner] for a restaurant list, that alone made our trip better not having to guess what places are good, as we prefer not to eat at chains and like trying the local flavour of restaurants.) The pool and hot-tub were clean and the hot-tub was especially enjoyable after hiking/exploring the town for most of the day. Overall my wife and I had a wonderful week staying here. Would we stay at Eden House again? Definitely!!! I would rate Eden House as a 4.5/5.0 based on our stay there and the exceptional staff. I'll round this up to a 5.0 (rather than the 4.0) because of their wonderful policy of providing a shower facility for those that check out but don't fly until days end. You can enjoy the facility for the last few hours & freshen up before the flight home!!!

Reviews.Title: “We are going back”
Reviews.Author: philelc
Reviews.Content: Well after 20 hours on our travels and the thought of being given the 'eden house welcome' was appealling to my wife and I but alas it never came and we were told to try the Irish bar around the corner for a quick drink and then not getting the room we thought we were due didnt set our week off to a good staret BUT i shouldnt have worried because Mike and his great team soon put that right. Our room was upgraded and we felt $1m. The facilities were better thsn we anticipated and on Tueday our 25th wedding anniversary 2 glasses and a bottle of champagne was waiting for us on our return from a day out.By all means try other accomodation before booking at Eden House.A big thanks to Mike Maggie and co for making it a memorable stay.Make sure you take a trip with Dolphinwatch to observe or if you are lucky like ourselves swim with the dolphins www.dolphinwatchusa.com

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: explore20
Reviews.Content: So many things to say, so little space to write!! We would like to commend Mike and his staff for taking such good care of us during our first visit during Fantasy Fest! We have traveled to Key West several times in the past, and love all of what is offered! A wonderful opportunity to vacation and do as much or little as we want! This review of ours will try to focus on the Eden house. #1 Location - Eden house is not right on Duval, this means you can relax without a cruise ship at your front door, or noisy revelers staying up till 4 am. We found Eden house nestled in a quiet section of "old town" easily spotted on the corner of Fleming and Grinnell. This put us very close to the harbor and a fair walk to Mallory Square. #2 Cost - We visited during Fantasy Fest, which means everyone is booked fast and rates are at a premium. Eden house was less expensive than several B & B's that we contacted and had many more amenities. We agree that our rate was fair and well worth the stay. #3 - Comfort - We were greeted with a smile and a cool beverage. We decided to stay in room 204 which was completely updated. This room was listed as a deluxe suite with a queen size bed. Our room had a microwave, TV and refrigerator. There was space under the bed to store our luggage, and hanging racks for our clothing. We found the bed comfy, and the shower large enough for two. There were plenty of available Hammocks for quiet time, and several swings. We found the Hot tub spacious enough for 8 guests, and plenty of room to swim in the pool. The upstairs front verandah was a perfect perch to watch the Parade walk by on Friday. Kathy and I loved to sit on the front porch just before we took off on another adventure, or right when we got back from a long day! This allowed us to make new friends, and learn of more exciting places to visit and things to do. At 4 PM everyday, Mike hosted happy hour. This was a time for some guests to reminisce of the day's events, while others were just getting started! We felt that this was a perfect way to have a time for guests to mix and mingle, making new friends along the way. The free refreshments were a nice touch, compliments of the hotel.#4 Staff - Mike has hand selected a great group of folks to run Eden house! All were sensitive to any needs and would go out of their way to help us. Many good suggestions were found simply by asking. We loved talking with the staff right before or after our journeys. Having someone right there at the front desk 24 - 7, let us rest in comfort. Kudos to Bob, Kirk, Maggie, Morgan, Bill, Dexter, Mike D, John, Gary, Olga, Pasha.#5 Cleanliness - Our room was spotless upon arrival, and was cleaned to perfection every day of our stay! (Thanks Leon!) One final thought about Priscilla the cat, only people that were confident in their abilities to take good care of their guests would share their best friend with them!

Reviews.Title: “It's Key West; not CLub Med”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Eden House gives you the perfect taste of Key West. Key West is an old town... it has none of the glitz of South Beach. Key West is funky. Bright colors adorn some of the houses juxtaposed next to grand Southern Mansions. Key West is laid back. My first trip there, I packed 8 pair of shoes and wore one... my birkenstocks. Eden House is all of this. You're greeted at the door with a warm smile and an ice cold beverage of your choice. Depending on how cheap you want to be, your room could be a newly rennovated one or one of the older ones. (They're slowly rennovating all of them.) I've stayed in both. The new ones are beautiful... pickled wood, tile floors, luxurious showers, funky stained glass, and comfy beds. The unrenovated are, of course, older. But the shower and tub are clean and the bed is comfy as well. In both cases, there's not a lot of room, but hey-- are you in Key West to stay in the room?? It's a place to lay your head and sleep off the hangover! Speaking of laying your head, there are about 6 sweet hammocks scattered throughout the property. THAT'S my idea of island living... communing with nature in a swinging hammock. The review panning the pool area is a first for me. Every time I have been, the pool has been crisp and clean. Something must not have been working when that traveler was there, but be assured, Mike and his staff handled it as soon as they knew about it. And yeah, the pool is small, but if you want olympic size, go to the ocean! The happy hour is a perk I enjoy. Going down to the pool area around 4:00 is a treat. People gather 'round the bar like flies... you find out where they're from... what they've seen, and you may even make a friend. It's like a big backyard party every night. Who cars if the liquor isn't top shelf? It's free. Walking through the lobby, grounds, and pool area of the Eden House, I feel like a native Conch. The rough edges show, but that's okay... I'm relaxed, on vacation and enjoying myself. If I had wanted space, glitter, and newness, I'd have gone to Atlantis in The Bahamas. But I don't go there and my choice for every trip to Key West is Eden House... hands down! Chill out, y'all... and let the sound of the palm fronds swaying in the breeze overhead wash over you.

HotelInfo.Name: Eden House
HotelInfo.Address: 1015 Fleming Street, Key West, FL 33040
